Paladins is commonly compared to Overwatch due to the similarities with the games I will sometimes reference the latter game. 

THE GREAT:
- Paladins has a card system in which you can modify/buff certain skills depending on your playstyle. You can set up multiple builds which is nice. This is the main difference between the games as Overwatch all characters are exactly the same.
- Paladins adds an extra/unique character mechanic in the flank classes. These characters specialize in infiltrating the enemy teams back lines to cause havoc on back lines (snipers, healers, etc.).


THE GOOD:
- Paladins has in match currency in which players can purchase upgrades for their character. This rewards players that play well during the match. Even though these items do give players who play well an advantage, they are not as strong as MOBA style items where players with more money become overpowerful.
- Like any game Paladins has characters that are deemed by the community as stronger than others, but few characters fall into the overpowered category (when allowed in competitive matches). All characters have the potential to be good in the right hands. Some characters do have a higher learning curve, but most of the characters are useful in some fashion.
- The ingame cash shop is strictly cosmetic. There is no "pay to win" in Paladins.
- The competitive match ranking system in Paladins rewards players who win consecutivly. For instance, if a Silver 2 player wins 7 matches in a row and ranks up, he can skip Silver 1 and go to Gold 4 or 5.
- There are 4 games modes to choose from as well as an additional game mode that changes weekly.
- No matter which game-mode you play the game-play is fast paced. There is rarely a moment where you are not engaged with another player.
- New characters come out frequently, usually every other month. All be it, you won't be able to play them in competitive matches until they have been out for a month.
- Servers are usually stable, very seldom do I find myself lagging or disconnection.

THE NEUTRAL (comments placed here have pros/cons):
- The competitive match system in Paladins has the traditional pick/ban phase. While I do enjoy this feature, it also can lead to conflict within a team. Sometimes you get that last pick player that WILL play damage regardless of what the team actually needs. The game has yet to incorporate a system where players Que as a particular role. 
- Unlike Overwatch you will not be able to change a character mid match. Once you choose your character you are locked in until match completion. 
- Paladins retains the typical roles of tank, healer and damage.
- There are a few characters in Paladins that share many similarities to Overwatch characters. Examples are Fernando (Paladins) vs Reinhart (Overwatch), Viktor (Paladins) vs Soldier 76 (Overwatch), and Drogoz (Paladins) vs Pharah (Overwatch). These characters are not an exact spitting image of each other, but for Overwatch players wanting to test the game out they give you something familiar. 
- The graphics in this game are not as clean and pretty as Overwatch. Graphics are more similar to Borderlands style graphics.


THE BAD:
- Most maps in Paladins are just too small. With the fact that there are mounts to get back to the action faster. Once one team gains and advantage they usually keep that advantage. Getting a kill in Paladins is significantly less effective than in Overwatch where it takes an opponent precious time to get back to the action.
- While the skins in Paladins do have a certain ascetic value, it is often costly and painful to get the skin you desire. Some skins are able to be purchase outright with either earned or purchase currency, however most are not. Most skins require players to buy different treasure chests and players basically "roll the dice" on obtaining skins they desire. Each chest has a certain number of skins available within. Some chests only have single digit skins obtainable within which do increase the chances of getting that skin you want. 
- Typical of any free to play, team based, competitive game you WILL find trolls and flammers. They are not as abundant as games like League of Legends, but they are most definitely present.

THE WORST:
- Paladins always has a few bugs after any major update. In most cases these bugs are simply annoying, however, they often take weeks for developers to fix. At the time of this review the major bug is the inability to mute a single player by voice. If there is some player you do not wish to hear you will have to turn off all voice chat.

It's a great game, but I've never seen more bugs in a single game, and I'd play tested a lot of games in their  alphas. The devs are trying, but publisher just doesn't care, they only sell skins for easy profit while major problems known for years are not being addressed. Game needs a complete rework, because its basic programming is bugged beyond help, but of course that will not happen, so don't waste your time on this. Cheers.

The idea of the game is fun but the matchmaking seems really odd, no matter how much you lose you still keep getting matched against real sweatlords, very rarely do you get a close game with even teams. It's mostly getting rolled or being on the rolling team.

Also in my personal opinion the game does a really poor job at indicating received damage so most deaths feel like instant kills, but there are things in this game that do kill you near instantly too.

Weirdly enough i enjoy the training/bot matches the most because there you get to enjoy the game without feeling like you are playing in a 500k USD tournament, but the training/bot matches get boring really quickly because of how easy they are. There is no middle ground in this game, its either super easy with bot matches or the rolling veteran team or its super sweaty and hard while getting rolled by the veteran team.

(all of these experiences are from matches played with 1-2 friends who are the same skill level as me)

I occasionally have a fun game but for the most part it's just frustrating as hell.

EDIT: Recently there has been a ton of issues joining matches, there is roughly 20% chance that some sort of issue happens and best case, you have to requeue. In the worst case, your whole PC blue screens or you get stuck in a join loop to a bugged match and can't play anymore. At the moment i'm stuck in the latter, tried to play a quick match or 2 and the match didn't load so i force closed the game trough Task manager, after restarting it attempted to reconnect me to the match, it loads for 3 mins before kicking me back to the menu and i can't click anything ingame anymore, forcing me to restart which starts the reconnect again.

An amazing third-person hero/class shooter. It ticks all the right boxes. More advanced then Overwatch, more fun then Overwatch,faster paced compared to Overwatch too. So much to learn, so many characters to master. Continuous updates make this game worth returning to.
Sure they is some balancing issues, sure they is some rough edges, like queues sometime's bug out, or the odd crash, but it is definitely worth playing.

This game has had it's ups and downs, times when it was very buggy and unplayable competitively and times like recently(for the last year or 2) where it's incredibly polished and MLG worthy. 

The game has always been very unique and special, from the art to the twist on a champion shooter using moba systems and as you can see from my playtime one of my top 3 favorite games.

Considering how similar it is to Overwatch I feel I can rightfully say there is almost no reason to ever play Overwatch, this game is hands down, no contest, leagues better in every aspect I can think about above Overwatch.

My only complaint with the game is how sensitive the developers and the community are. My best friend is from Pakistan, there is no reason for the word "paki" to be censored, at all. That is just one of hundreds of words that are censored with a chat filter. People afk out of games in ranked constantly because they're sure we are going to lose when the truth is I have around 10k hours(didn't start playing on steam) in the game and i've been to masters so I can confidently tell you that even top tier players don't really fully understand the meta. The game is too complex when you get down to the nitty gritty, there are far too many variables and i've seen teams win that according to top tier players shouldn't.

Overall I highly recommend the game.

Paladins, I got into this thinking that this was a cheap low quality game but it actually looks amazing and plays smoothly. Almost all champions are really well balanced and that’s hard to accomplish considering how many ways you can customize your settings and gameplay during and before matches. Paladins is really about customization. One champion can be played as a passive backline healer in one match and an amazing dps character with lots of crowd control in the next. It all depends on how you alter your champion’s “loadout”, and this makes the game so much fun and I never get bored. The pacing is perfect too~ the fights actually give you time to think and react and there are tons of outplay opportunities.

"Guess who lost connection?" - SLOGAN of EU SERVERS!!!

Paladins is a free to play Multiplayer FPS which might remind you of another game called "Overwatch". 
The game includes more than 50 champions divided into four different roles such as: Damage, Flank, Tank & Healer.
Each champion is played differently and I do believe that you can and will find a champion that you enjoy to play with.
Besides that there are a handful of maps and 3 different game modes you can choose from and play against real online players or against bots.
You also have the possibility to earn different cosmectics for your champions through finishing challenges or purchasing them.

Now why do I still not recommend playing this game? This question leads me to the technical status of the game. It's DISASTROUS!!!
First of all the EU servers are a joke!!! I have played this game for more than 700 hours now and it rarely happened that I did not loose my connection to the servers during a gaming session. It happened before the game started (champion selection), while I was loading in, in the middle of the game and even in the menu screen, If you play this game, stay away from the EU servers!
Every time I played a regular match and lost connection, I could load back in the game but if I played against bots there was no chance to come back to the game!
The next aspect would be the bad matchmaking system. The lobby gets mixed quite often, so well experienced players play with or against new players which leads to frustration. 

But the biggest issue I have witnessed is about to be described now: The Infinite Loading Screen Bug!
Whenever I am in the loading screen before a match starts,  the game might freeze and you only see the cards with the different champions on your screen and nothing happens. Or you get lucky enough to be thrown back to the menu screen, but you can't click on anything. Now why is it called the "infinite" bug? Players have reported that they have not been able to play for at least 90 mins. Imagine you want to have a fun time playing this game and due to this bug (which is well known for quite some time now) you are not able to play it for 90 mins. at least. That's something I have never experienced before and leads me to this bad rating of the game.
Instead of fixing these issues, the developers decided to realease new event passes every two months with a new champion and new cosmetics. Neither the bugs get fixed nor new maps or different game modes get added. 

My conclusion: If the developers do not start taking their game seriously and start fixing the game, I do believe many long time players (including me) will turn their back on this game in the long run! Instead of realeasing a new event pass every so often with new champions and cosmetics, start fixing those bugs! Paladins is my first game which technical status got worse and worse with every new release of a new event pass! I would be perfectly fine if there would not be any new content released due to working on those bugs. I will check it out later again, but for now I do not recommend playing it! 
Thanks for reading!

But all of that potential is clouded by bugs that have been in the games for years, changes to systems that didn't need to be changed in the first place (i.e. the new event pass system), and general lack of care from the developers. 

At the end of the day though, the game is free so it's up to you whether or not you want to play it, you'd be losing nothing by initially doing so. But investing time and more importantly, money, is something i do not recommend you do.

Pros:
1) Interesting characters + gameplay
2) Unique skins
3) Easy learning curve
4) Fun game with a group
5) So little ppl use VC and chat that it isn't super toxic (can be a con for ppl actively trying to communicate)

Cons:
1) IMO the skin system is really odd. I know it's a money thing for the company, but it doesn't seem fair.
2) Matchmaking is awful. It feels like 1/10 games I queue up for have people that aren't toxic and are around my level. The rest consist of people that are so much better than me that I have zero impact on the game, or people that have zero awareness of the game and int their butts off.
3) So many ppl that AFK. And zero punishment for it. 
4) Solo queuing is hell on Earth. Don't do it.

I think that the reason I like this game so much is that it is fun. Shooting things feels satisfying with almost every character, and the maps are interesting to play on. Something that can maybe rankle your experience is playing with people that are a higher level than you, but that's really a problem with multiplayer games in general. Overall, I think the game is fun.

I remember playing this expecting it to feel like a huge ripoff of Overwatch that was actually on Steam. Instead it actually turned out to feel pretty different from Overwatch. Not super different, but the same feeling that you get from playing two games in a similar genre that have few differences, but still do things a little differently. Personally I actually prefer this game to Overwatch even if I still think Overwatch is of better quality. The f2p system requires them to come out with consistent content so characters come out much more frequently than they do for something like Overwatch. That's good for content, but bad for balance. The more characters the harder it is to balance them all. I personally can't speak on that side of things as I don't play competitively nor look to deep into those sort of things. However I've had fun with a majority of the champions I've played in a casual setting and never felt like one was at the most 1.5x better than another one, but don't take my word for something like balancing.

If you want a free team based shooter similar to the likes of Overwatch this is definitely the best option if not one of the best. And hey it's free, might as well just give it a shot if it seems like something you'd be into.

Paladins on the surface seems to be the poor man's overwatch. Which it is. I don't hate nor do I like this game but I will still give my thoughts on it. Personally, as much as I do like the number of characters there are just WAY too many. I understand this makes some nice diversity but at the same time, this is more characters you also have to buy with either real or in-game currency. Not to mention a personal pet peeve of mine is how they model the women of the game with only 1 exception being a giant worm monster. You will see what I mean when you play it. However for a free game to play with friends yea it gets the job done genuinely. Something to do. But in my personal opinion if you want a free version of overwatch to play with friends just play Team Fortress 2. A lot more fully-fledged and a lot sillier too. Old Fashioned Pumpkin Pie

2 large eggs
1 large egg yolk
1/2 cup packed dark brown sugar
1/3 cup white sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 teaspoons cinnamon
1 teaspoon ground ginger
1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
1/4 teaspoon ground cloves
1/8 teaspoon cardamom
1/2 teaspoon finely grated lemon zest
2 cups pumpkin purée from a sugar pumpkin (see Recipe Note) OR 1 (15-ounce can) pumpkin purée (can also use puréed cooked butternut squash)
1 1/2 cups heavy cream or 1 (12-ounce) can evaporated milk
1 homemade pie crust, chilled or frozen (see pâte brisée recipe or our no-fail flaky pie crust recipe), or 2 pre-made pie shells

Preheat the oven:
Preheat your oven to 425°F.
Make the filling:
Beat the eggs in a large bowl. Mix in the brown sugar, white sugar, salt, spices — cinnamon, ground ginger, nutmeg, ground cloves, cardamom, and lemon zest.
Mix in the pumpkin purée. Stir in the cream. Beat together until everything is well mixed.
mixing pumpkin pie ingredients
pumpkin pie ingredients mixed well
adding cream to pumpkin pie puree
pumpkin pie filling ready to add to pie
Fill the pie shell and bake:
Pour the filling into an uncooked chilled or frozen pie shell. Bake at a high temperature of 425°F for 15 minutes.
Then after 15 minutes, lower the temperature to 350°F. Bake for 45 to 55 minutes more. The pie is done when a knife tip inserted in the center comes out wet but relatively clean. The center should be just barely jiggly.
(About half-way through the baking, you may want to put foil around the edges or use a pie protector to keep the crust from getting too browned.)
Note that the pumpkin pie will come out of the oven all puffed up (from the leavening of the eggs), and will deflate as it cools.
pumpkin pie in dish ready for baking
Baked Pumpkin Pie From Scratch
Cool the pie on a rack, then serve:
Cool the pumpkin pie on a wire rack for 2 hours.
Serve with whipped cream.

I came to this game because two friends were playing it, which is already weird because it's not a thing I do usually, especially when it comes to "competitive" online games. Maybe the artstlye appealed to me idk. 

Anyways 2 weeks and 94 hours of playtime later and I can say I enjoy it. I'm not gonna kid myself the main reason I stayed is because I had a high level friend who helped me a lot when I started. but even then I still feel like the game is a bit more accessible than other competitve games, like don't get me wrong I'm not a good player but I have fun and I don't feel like I'm a deadweight for my team. Maybe it's because I'm still playing in my comfort zone in terms of champions and I haven't played ranked (probably never will), but it still keeps me entertained anyways. 

The current problems in the game that affected me are mostly from a technical standpoint : me and two of my friends had a game-breaking bug that required deleting a config file to fix, quite often a match just fails to load and boots me back to the main menu, you have some champion texture bugs depending on your graphical settings, refer a friend just doesn't work, and the bounty coin skin store is just a pain to look at. 

Also a quick tip I can give if you're planning on playing beyond a few games : Link a Hi-rez account, you can't get bounty coins without that and this currency is probably your best shot at getting some cool skins for free, even if it takes some time.

Terrible balance issues, not beginner friendly (many unexplained mechanics. Not only do I mean unexplained, there are mechanics that have 0 references inside the entire game anywhere to he found. You have to learn about them through word of mouth). Servers are OFTEN shit. Matchmaking is terrible. Ranked can take over an hour just to get into because of how many people will drop as soon as their main is picked or banned. Many players die once and then throw the rest of the game. 

The devs have no idea how to implement a new champion without it being absolutely broken. Uninspired, too, from what it used to be. Also, the majority of the community doesn't want new champs that don't fit the game and break balance and ruin peoples experiences. The majority of the community wants more maps, bug fixes, and maybe new content for existing champs. It took them YEARS to do anything useful to Torvald, and it boiled down to give him a 3 sec speed buff, but they'll release another high mobility edgy dark ninja that's ridiculously OP and difficult to deal with. Routinely they have trouble nerfing champs, too. Instead of nerfing the frustrating parts of dealing with a champ, like built in autoaim, they nerf what makes the champs actually fun to play as. Absolutely tone deaf, and it leads to a multitude of champs with only one viable play style/build, and a multitude of champs who are just garbage to play unless you're playing against new players in casuals. 

Overall, yeah I play the game a lot (steam says 686.7, but I only have 408 actual in match hours), and I'll probably still play it, but if you're considering downloading the game and starting as a new player, I'm warning you about a long term frustration. This is not a game you can pick up and play here and there casually and have a good time. You need to understand the kits and abilities of all the champs and how to at around them. Trying to play here and there casually will lead you to CONSTANTLY being obliterated and farmed. This is a minimum 50 hours invested before you can even grasp the mechanics that the game literally has 0 mention of anywhere in the interface/client/official media at all. And with investing that kind of time, you'll just end up frustrated. 

Stay away if you don't want to be routinely frustrated.

If you ever want to have the sensation of hitting people with a wet pool noodle, this is the game for you. This game might have some of the worst sound design I have seen, and it makes everything just feel off.

There are some of the same flaws you might expect to encounter with any team-based game that involves roles needing to fulfill certain functions. I see why people compare it to Overwatch, but it does not suffer from Lootbox syndrome, where the only way to get anything is through luck. It has a similar model to LOL in terms of unlocking new characters to use. But with the ability to try out any character in the training grounds and a constant cycle of characters being free to try out, I had no trouble finding the ones I like to play. Because each character can play significantly differently from the others, do not necessarily be discouraged from playing (and do not think you need to spend money on it to have any fun). Characters may be locked behind a gold paywall, but you can easily earn the in-game currency by just trying out the different characters available to you at the start and learning how it works. In one night of playing and figuring out what Paladins was really like, I already had enough coins to get the first character that I actually wanted to play. 

THE BEST THING about this game might be the lack of toxicity in the player base. I don't know if I just happened to join late enough in this game's shelf life that the toxic people have left, but there is a surprising lack of toxic interactions (at least from my experience so far). With any free-to-play online game, you would think it would come with the territory... a low cost of entry + a competitive model usually add up to a bunch of toxic players looking for a dopamine rush no matter the cost. While at times it feels like barely anyone even knows what they are doing in this game, at least it is not the complete cesspool of endless negative experiences that Overwatch has become. I am glad a friend of mine got me to try it out because so far it has been fun.

Almost a really good game. The heroes are well designed (for the most part), have a variety of play styles, maps are short but intricate, all leading to a very fun experience… on paper. 

Much like Hi-Rez’s other games, the community absolutely ruins whatever good ideas/designs are present. People will only pick damage/flank about 80-90% of the time, leaving non-ape brained players to either pick a healer or a tank… and only half the tanks/healers at that, since some are designed to be off-healers/off-tanks and as such aren’t very good as solo healers/tanks. To top it off, the spam picking damage players don’t have the common decency to be good. Most of the time they will charge headlong into the enemy team and die immediately or stand waaaay back and do nothing but take pot shots, if even that. Naturally this leads to getting out damaged by healers/tanks, which makes one wonder why they spam pick damage or flanks in the first place. 

Ranked isn’t any better, but for different reasons. For starters, it’s dead, expect to spend 8-10 minutes (sometimes longer) for every match, and then spend the entirety of the game in an argument with your tilted team mates. If they aren’t whining about not banning/playing X, they’re rage quitting because they FEEL someone isn’t doing well or just salty they’re not winning out the gate. 

TL:DR - it’s a Hi-Rez game. Great ideas and mechanics, absolutely terrible community.

This game has gotten worse and worse. Questionable changes, weird balancing (except for the last balance changes, they were superb) and a ton of infuriating glitches make the game near unplayable. The amount of character releases are great and all but some are really gitchy and unpolished. VII in my opinion is a mess of a character. His kit just doesn't make sense. Why give a flank a glitchy grappling hook if the other ability can only be used on the ground, Why does a flank have 
 a heavy smg with the ability to switch modes to deal damage on a far. I get that his sticky bomb is his burst ability. It's questionable tho considering the low range of the attack + his low health and sustainability. However there is a reason why most mode switching champs are dps, like Imani, Strix and I'll count Kinessa and Octavia too. Since they mostly attack from a far and deal damage periodically, unlike flanks usually short ranged burst. Also why make the hook be able to pull enemies, but also be able to attach yourself to walls. This means that if you miss your hook you might just fling yourself into the enemy, wich in my opinion is just stupid. This just makes me think if they ran out of ideas and is totally understandable considering the paste of new champion realeases, however I don't get why they focus on new champions when they could start polishing the game. It just doesn't make sense to keep shitting out new unfinished characters.

The release of azaan singlehandedly made me question the design philosophy of Hi-Rez. I don't know what they thought during the developement of Azaan. Whatever substance they were on, I want some. He had everything: infinite range, plenty damage, respectable CC, walls, CC immune movement ability that can fly across the map and also stun enemies for some reason, a massive healthpool with passive DR and a sustain higher than Raum's and get-out-of-jail free card ultimate. I get that balancing can be hard during the creation of a new champ, however I feel like he was made without a weakness in mind. In testing he was probably the strongest Champion to ever exist and when he came out he was nerfed a little, but still made normal games unplayable. Even after the hotfix he was still broken. And after he was finally nerfed the game could be played normally again, as he was not able to 1v5 or hunt down a single player while tanking the entire damage from the enemy team. As a cherry on top the hitbox of azaan was god-awful, as you could shoot through the arms and the head hitbox felt non-existant.

The game isn't dead and some rounds can still be enjoyable, however examples like never bringing back the play of the game because it caused some game breaking makes me lose hope in Hi-Rez Studios abilities to fix a problem. Especially when you realize, that this feature was removed years ago.

Please go ahead and play this game. It's free and worth the time. But looking back at all the weird decisions I can only give this game a thumbs down. What a shame.

Paladins is that one friend you find really annoying and can only really stand their existence when you are with a few other friends. At times it can be  really fun to play but without a group of friends it can be really un motivating to play it by yourself. For me personally (im sure a few others in the community do this as well) it has gotten to a point where me and my friends only log on to do the in game challenges (trials of the realm) to get that sweet premium crystals  and then log off. I've just sort of lost that motivation for the game that I once had 2 years ago, back when you felt rewarded for when you played a few matches (cough cough back when the battle pass had over 100 rewards and at least 20-30 on the free track), now its just 30 or so rewards and only 2 skins plus 2 recolours of said skins. I am not saying its the worst game out there, hell its far from the worst game out there, its just lost the love (and most probably the funds  to add  that sweet sweet good content we all look for) put in from Hi-Rez and Evil Mojo jojo that drew me in the first time. And i can confidently say that with over 400 hours on this game that it is ok, its fun when playing with friends but boring as hell without them.

Paladins is a free to play team-based hero shooter.
There are currently above 50 playable champions in the game and these are divided into 4 different classes: Front Line, Damage, Support and Flank. 
Paladins is free to play, so you just have a handful of champions at the beginning. The other champions you can unlock by playing a long time or by purchasing them.
For lovers of skins, there are alot of cosmetic items available for purchase...
Paladins features a card system. The card system can be described like this: "Cards offer players the ability to empower Champions' attributes and enhance or modify their skills, tailoring them to a particular playstyle." 
 (https://paladins.fandom.com/wiki/Cards)
There are different game modes like Siege (a round based game mode where each team works to earn Objective Points), Onslaught (players must earn tickets by either killing players or controlling a Capture Point), Team Deathmatch (the first team to achieve 40 kills wins) and a competetive mode.
If you consider to play competetive, I highly recommend to play it with friends. Playing with randoms can be very unsatisfying in terms of climbing up the rank ladder.
Paladins can be fun if you play it with friends. I recommend to give it a try if you like hero shooters and have someone to play with.

I bought the Paladins Founder's Pack way back when the game came out and I enjoyed it but it had its drawbacks and I found myself playing Overwatch much more than Paladins. But with all the new heroes and the huge changes the game has gone through in the years since, I've recently come back to it and found that it's by far my favorite team shooter.

There are heroes for all different kinds of play styles and most heroes can adapt via the in-match loadouts and purchases to the situations that come up. (No tank? Pick up some extra HP and damage reduction since you'll likely be taking more damage, etc.)

I know the game systems have changed so that free-to-play players can't feasibly get all the heroes unlocked anymore so I can't recommend it for them, but for anyone who just buys the hero pack with all current heroes, it's a really great game with a lot of depth and a ton of fun with friends.

shame.


[edit]
Also this game has so many leavers it's ridiculous. Every second game.

Kinda fun to try the champions, but too many gameplay issues.

About 75% of your games will have someone leave and be replaced by a bot barely capable of walking onto the point to feed ult charge to the enemy team, much less actually helping to replace the leaver.

About 1/3 of your games will have intense rubber-banding issues - good luck playing any of the characters who rely on dashes for movement, when dashing means flying forward, stuttering back, then finally flying forward again.

Ability animations often lock you into them really hard, so a number of the characters that should feel fluid instead feel terrible as you desperately spam an ability but die while your character finishes the flourish at the end of the previous ability.

It's fun for a bit if you've gotten bored of Overwatch, but you'll notice the lack of polish pretty badly after the novelty wears off.

The characters are..... good. I know you expected me to say this game was garbage, but it isnt. Instead, i think that each champion isnt the worst thing to ever grace this earth. But it suffers from overchoice. When you have so many champions to use, why use anything besides the meta for that major problem? Why use lex to mow down that stupid kinessa sniping my fernando when i can snipe them with Androxus? Why use really any shield character when barik has such good defensive and offefnsive capabilties he is just... good? You get the idea. Mostly fun characters, but too many characters.

[b] [h1] [i] "No one's over-powered, because everyone's overpowered" [/i] [/h1] [/b]

In the words of The Incredibles' Syndrome: "If everyone's super, no one will be," and i find that to be quite fitting for Paladins. From the Hero's i've played (That's 3 in total... yeah) your abilities seem so brokenly overpowered on paper... [i] and [/i] in practice. Heals your whole team 1000 hp each, with a 6-second cool-down? Sure. Place down two ultimate flame-thrower turrets at once? Done. Push the entire enemy team far enough to make them fall off the map? Simple.   

[h2] Features that i like: [/h2]

Legend rotation: 
Every week (i'd assume that, only played for 2 days), several legends are playable for free. This makes trying out legends in combat possible, which makes the game so much fun. Bored of your legends but can't afford to farm a few hours to get a new one? Bam, we've got you covered. I don't know why other hero shooters don't have this, it's such a pivotal mechanic. It's like a free trial for a legend, which will increase sales and user enjoyment at the same time. 

What else... I don't know yet. I'll have to play more to find out, and'll update this review when i find stuff. 

Anyway, i'm off to have more fun in Paladins. Gl, HF my friends.

First, this business model is horrible. The game is set to charge a player as much as they can get away with. Pay for characters, pay for subpar skins, pay for passes, pay for chests. They even charge you to send a gift to your friends-its like double taxation...just horrible.

Second, the characters are all stolen from far better MOAB's. Their abilities, many of the skins (add horns, add claws, change the wings). Willofor example is Willow from DOTA with mixed up abilities and the same concept. Just the laziest plagiarism that somehow is allowed because its a wee-bit different so you can't say its the same.

Third and most importantly, the game is boring. Quick matches, boring maps, simple champions with simple abilities and simple objectives. Its a young child's version of a competitive game made for the lowest tier player.

Play DOTA if you want a well balanced MOAB that doesn't suck the money out of your pocket.

Like Overwatch, but fun.

Pros:
-every character has 3 basic abilities (plus ult), with greater depth/synergy on average
-just straight up better map design (low bar I know)
-character picks are lock-in, so no counter pick hot potato mini-games
-receives regular updates (lol)
-tanks that are fun to play
-healing reduced during combat - sustain is still powerful but not oppressive
-symmetrical game mode, very little attack/defence disparity in the character design
-free to play, and you can just buy the champion pack to auto-unlock all the characters if grinding freemium currency isn't your thing

Cons:
-the game be kinda (really) jank sometimes
-UI options are minimal
-people will judge you for playing "that budget OW clone by the developer that ruined Tribes"

At first glance I thought this was just an OW clone, but it's really not.

The characters are customizable with card decks/mods, you can choose between 3 different "talent builds" so every single character can be played several different ways!
The graphics reminds me a lot of Spyro Reignited which is wonderful in my opinion.
It does force you to play against bots for the first 5 lvls of your account (both characters and your account gain lvls) but that makes sense since it let's you learn the game a little before you try against other players.

It is a free-to-play game so they have to make their money somehow, you do have to unlock characters, but you can also do this by simply playing the game and earning gold to purchase characters with and it's not really all that much of a grind to get the gold needed and the matches aren't that long.
There is a free weekly rotation of characters you can play for free.

It does offer a Starter Bundle in the shop that unlocks several characters and gives you a good deal of Gold which you can use to unlock even more characters. The bundle is only 5$.

It gives you Gold and XP bonus if you play with people from your friendlist, so bring your friends along for some fun!

You don't have to pay anything to enjoy this game!

For who knows how long there's this bug that freezes your game as the match loads. Not only it screws your game, it also screws the game of 9 other people, as they have to play with a bot. Meanwhile the devs are pumping new champions and low-effort skins through battle-passes, ignoring bugs and long-standing player gripes. Lag is a perennial complaint.

It's a shame, as Paladins really had some unique takes on the genre, and definitely had the potential. But devs no longer have the mojo, and the players see the downfall, as evidently seen in the declining playerbase. Many of middle-core gamers have left. Most of who remain are fresh blood that you cannot really count on for teamwork and good game, and hardcore tryhards. Very poor matchmaking will make sure you'll often have unfun combinations of these through your and enemy team.

I'm kinda sad to wave goodbye to Paladins, after half a decade and three thousand hours sunk. But it's time to move on. I could accept the roulette of "will your team get stomped, or will the enemy team". But I don't want to play roulette "will you get to play, or will the game lock for a few hours and you'll straddle the team with a bot".

I may occasionally jump in and see how it goes... But my heart is no longer with Paladins. I've spent much more cash here than a standard triple-A game costs, and would have likely spent as much in the future. I got that latest battle pass for cringe anime girl skin (yep, cringe, not cute, and this comes from someone liking anime girl skins). But devs should've rather worked on fixing the game. By choosing another battle pass sale over having a quality game, they deserve neither and will lose both.

I don't really do reviews for games but I just had to do one for this game. As much as I enjoy it I can't recommend it to anyone, the community is unbelievably toxic, especially if you're new to the game like me. Every game you have someone flaming one person on their team over seemingly nothing. I mean, just look at the screenshots I had for this game, I literally just asked the guy why he went Buck with 2 seconds left when we needed a frontline and he and his friend decided to just spam flame me all game. Honestly, I really do enjoy the game but the community ruins it and the Devs don't give 2 fucks about it. Also AFKing is rampant, it feels like every other game you have someone afk and there's 0 repercussions for it. I really don't understand how there is no Surrender option after this game has been out for so long? Doesn't feel good playing a 3/4v5 when the enemy just sits outside your spawn for 15 minutes. The Matchmaking is also pretty bad, you can have a bunch of level 10s on your team against people with level 100 champs? How is that balanced?

I'm one of those people that wishes I could give a "middle thumb" instead of up or down.

Great game and even better for those who gave up on Overwatch and/or if you are really into amazing waifus (!), but the devs are doing little to solve the numerous bugs, crash issues, and rubber banding lag.

They also have some sort of f#tish with "exclusive" content. There's hundreds of fantastic, sexy, funny, and bad a## skins (hellooo Sun Kissed Cassie!!), but roughly 80% of the content is vintage; its there for a month or so, and gone forever. 

This doesn't work at all. 

Their sales are limited, and new comers miss out on a lot of good stuff. "Let's spend numerous man-hours to create skins and NOT sell them" isn't good business practices, either.  No one wins in this system. I was hoping that more folks learned stuff like this from Overwatch's mistake. "You want that skin? Spend $100's  on loot boxes and maybe you'll get it!" I don't understand. Why not just say "Hey, you want this? That'll be $5, please. Chaching! Here's your skin, thank you for your business, and good day."

 I just can't "whole heartily" recommend it until they nerf Seven (stylized VII), Skye, and Terminus. None of the above have any significant counters.

Every match is Skye vs Skye going "l0l crossbow go brr dead" x4 then she drops  a bomb to get a push-button pentakill. Not to mention her smoke screen can out heal the best support hero in the game. Seven has similar burst dps potential, and Terminus can push E and be invulnerable for most of the match. Did you finally kill him? That's ok: he'll self-res and explode to 1 shot any squishies in range. 

It could be semi-remedied by teamplay, but this community is so isolated from each other. Everyone I add/add's me doesn't talk to me at all. No one here is in any hurry to meet new friends and team up. This trickles into ranked play as well. 

People being people, ranked has all the same bull shift that is in every other online ranked game ever: no one wants to tank, no one wants to heal/locks 3 healers (meta is 1, maybe 2nd building dps), everyone want's to be the swordsman or the archer, silently trickling and feeding, ready to report you for calling them out on it to get you permanently banned for "abusive toxicity" (yeah I'm deliberately throwing this match with 30 deaths BUT BUT HE MADE ME FEEL BAD ABOUT IT!! GUILTY!!!) [OK to be fair, that's my Overwatch story, NOT Paladins].  Let's not forget the F2P classic: grumpy hispanics who's only English words are 'gg noob team report I afk". Meanwhile, the enemy team is a 5 stack premade of close friends all communicating, creating meta-builds for their hero, complimenting each other with an excellent team composition, all with gold skins (ie they played that one hero a looooot), absolutely FEASTING on the 5 defenseless noobs on the other side....so, you know, every single ranked match of every single online game. Ever. 

Worst of all is this EAC (easy anti cheat) software you're forced to use. Many other players have voiced their concerns about how intrusive it is as a spyware like screenshotting your pc and/or keylogging it, even if the game isn't running.

It's a flawed gem, but let's be honest: what else is on the market that hasn't been a cesspool of "fail" memes in the past 10 years? You're gonna be like me and most other gamers: playing Paladins because...dammit there's just nothing else out there after Blizzard sold their souls to Micro$oft. 

We're all looking for a plot of sand to stick our head in as the powers-that-be slowly craft the prophesied Orwellian nightmare and Paladins is one of the better right now, so do some research on EAC and go for it.

Oh, and if you don't speak Spanish, don't bother.

The benefits of pouring milk before cereal.

Too long have those who pour milk before Cereal been considered heretics. The truth is, pouring milk before cereal is just as valid of a method as cereal before milk if not a better one.

Benefits:

You get to see the milk level accurately. Face it, cereal before milk is a guessing game on how much milk is actually in the bowl due to the irregular shapes and sizes of cereal. Too often you are left with a dry oasis of cereal and are forced to return to the refrigerator to retrieve the milk or even worse, you have a soup of milk that has irreversibly soaked your cereal into oatmeal.

The bottom of the cereal bowl doesn’t turn to mush as quickly. Because cereal floats, the milk before cereal method allows the bottom portion of the cereal to stay in the perfect equilibrium of crunchy yet moist that is so fleeting in the cereal experience. Whereas cereal before milk leaves you with the flooded sections of the Titanic with little time to evacuate the bottom section before they are drowned in milk.

Response to Common Criticism of the Milk before Cereal method

“But it’ll splash everywhere!” Cereal is lightweight and will not cause milk to overspill if the user pours at the correct angle. Furthermore, you can simply use a bigger bowl.

“But you can’t measure the cereal then!” Inaccurate as almost all cereal floats. The inaccuracy your cereal pour is outweighed by the inaccuracy of your milk pour if you used the cereal before milk method.

It is time we stop acting like barbarians and adopt the milk before cereal method.

I wish I could give this game a good review, having almost 90 hours in the game. Unfortunately, those are fucking wasted hours of my life I will never get back. I honestly do times have fun with this game at times, but for the wrong god damn reasons.

Snipers:
 I main Kinessa, a squishy sniper that outputs a fuck ton of damage. Snipers like Kinessa are busted as hell because the hitboxes on the character models are HORRENDOUS, giving you a lot of bullshit kills. All health in this game is inflated for whatever reason, the average DPS having 2100 health (as an example a fully charged Kinessa shot does 1200, allowing for 2 shots.). 

Character Roster:
You start with a very boring and limited champion roster, needing you to do a lot of grinding to obtain fun to play champions. 

Bugs:
one of the biggest problems is the number of bugs, I see this a lot in highly mobile characters. Sometimes you do a leap ability and you just...stop mid-jump. some shots will no reg, I've logged in and the UI is busted, tons more than just ruin the overall gameplay.

Skins:
There is very obvious favoritism, for example, Maeve getting multiple skins in the same year. 
It is insanely hard to get a wanted skin in this game, a majority of them having a crystal price impossible to realistically grind for, needing you to buy them with IRL money. Now, this isn't a problem in a free game, they need a way to get money after all. But then there are the chest exclusive skins which are a pain in the ass. A chest costs crystals, which unlike the base skins are much cheaper, allowing you to use them more. But for each chest...you can only get one item. And when you have chests like the "golden chest" which has a few hundred cosmetics in it, you can see the frustration in it. Some aesthetic-specific chests have about 10-15 cosmetics in them with a higher crystal mark up, needed you to either do some hard grinding or pull out the wallet. 

Auto Aim:
....why? This is a PvP fps shooter...why the hell would there be aimbot abilities? Now I may be called a hypocrite when my main (Kinessa) has an ultimate that gives her automatic headshots, but this ult still needs you to hit your shots in some way, giving her a few seconds of guaranteed damage buffs. So why the hell is there damage and flankers that have auto game abilities, letting them burst you down immediately. The fact that some character kits revolve around this is fucking ridiculous.

Tanks:
I know this is a bit of an unfair comparison but for a moment I wanna compare tanks in Paladins to Overwatch. In Overwatch, tanks can serve a multitude of purposes. They can play for picks, point pressure, dives/flanks, or help with overall team synergies. Now in Paladins (except for Torvald) tanks just feel like just a body on the point that's only purpose is for point pressure and to spam at the front line...that's it. I'm not saying all of the tanks are all just copy/pastes of each other, I do think evil mojo did a really good job giving them unique kits. But when you boil it down, the kits are just glorified |Engagement tool, sustain, and CC|, they just seem uninteresting after a while.

Ranked:
Don't. Fucking. Touch it.
Besides one skin (which there is a better version you can buy) there is absolutely no reason to play it besides taking your placements and thinking "huh, that's where I placed." then going back to casual. Casual has more game modes and less toxicity where you can have fun instead of getting screamed at for playing an off-meta champion or not banning a meta champion.

Graphics:
not going to get too into it, the cover and splash art looks honestly amazing, just look at the steam banner for it. Then there are the in-game character models which aren't necessarily bad, not great. It's a free game, not gonna bitch about it.

Reviews for the Deaf and Hard of Hearing

Overall Game
----------------------------------------
KnightShift is a unique blend of RPG and top-down adventure. It can be played as a strategy game, an RPG, or a hybrid mix.

Seemingly very low-budget, KS still brings an interesting, if not intricate, gameplay to the gamer. For those who can tolerate the lower-end graphics and quirkiness of the game (I find it cute how the prince takes a nap, for example, as odd as it is), KnightShift will bring a good round of exploratory gameplay in an indie package that I'd recommend for a fun few hours of Princedom.

Overall Rating: 8/10

Gameplay
----------------------------------------
Warning: There are a LOT of keys/key combinations to remember for this game.

If you're undaunted, the next hurdle to overcome is a slightly awkward mouse control that seems to be reminiscent of Windows 98 mouse acceleration insanity. Once familiarized with it, the mouse awkwardness stops detracting from the interface.

I'm not sure if there were audio cues for some things, but I learned haphazardly that the giant withcraft looking areas are healing spas. This was useful fighting my first few bears. The lesson here is just to explore the areas, as context tooltips don't really exist to assist in understanding what is around you in the game.

Although rough around the edges, the quirky gameplay and level-matched quests can catch you and lure you in for more from this game. The random encounter fights contribute a little to exp farming and provide a balanced challenge as you build up your equipment set and character.

Overall Accessibility
----------------------------------------
KnightShift has dialogue that is not subtitled, making the plot a little inconvenient to follow. I don't blame the developers, who, as a small indie group, made the game because they wanted to, and did so as best they could.

Because I was unable to properly test multiplayer, the overall rating is based on only the subtitles category.

Rating: 7/10

Subtitles/Text
----------------------------------------
KnightShift is an indie game on a unique platform. That said, it's not subtitled or captioned. Deaf/HoH players can still read the text of what was said after by hitting F2 a few times, which cycles through the 'mission log' and flavor text/mission text.

At first I found it annoying, but I find the workaround tolerable and am happy they included it.

Rating: 7/10

Chatting/Communicating
----------------------------------------
While KS has multiplayer capability, I did not test. Based on the keyboard options, I saw no key for chat.

Rating: N/A

Terrible community and just boring gameplay. The only reason I've got almost 300 hours of gameplay on record is because my little brother is crazy about overwatch but can't have it so he settled for this crap (and even he says, "This game is way worse than overwatch, but better than nothing") 

Nothing in this game feels unique. Everything feels like a ripoff, even the things that aren't. It's like they don't have a clear vision for a game. They were just like, "let's make a hero shooter" with no other ideas or anything else. The characters are like the wish versions of LoL champions. And also most of the game just feels weird. Most characters mechanics' feel weird and out of place and don't have intresting traits (gmaeplay wise and personality), most game mechanics feel weird and out of place, the story is not good (I didn't even know this game had any story tbh), the art style doesn't really fit with the rest of the game or what it's trying to be and the game is heavily unbalanced. Ever wanted to play a game where one of the character's ult could snipe you across the map and hit you through walls and if you get hit it's a instant kill? Yeah that's one of the support characters... fun,right?

Not to mention the community. Unranked is fine, but ranked? OMFG KILL ME NOW. If you meet someone new and they tell you they're a ranked paladins player, get a restraining order immediately and this is coming from someone who plays LoL. I've never seen a more toxic community then this game's ranked players. Our entire team got killed once (because they're murder hobos that went all in even though they never stood a chance) and as support I knew if just ran away they'll blame it all on me, but then after they got killed it was a solid 5min of them sitting in base and trash talking eachother and that's when I stopped playing this game. Don't think the community alone was what made me quit, it was just straw that broke the camel's back; the tipping point if you will. In total I guess I only got like 8 hours in this game. Like I said, the rest was my little brother, but at this point he has also given up on the game.

I don't think I can give advice on how to fix things. Everything was a clusterfuck from the beginning and the devs just added more and more crap to the pile over the years instead of fixing things. So, don't expect it to be much better in the near future or even the distant future for that matter. The only thing this game is good for is shutting up your younger siblings

I dont recommend this game for one simple reason. Its community. It seems no matter how old this game gets, its playerbase still dont understand the basic concept of needing a tank/healer to actually win games. 

They keep going 4 damage dealers because shooting is fun. What this game needs to get more than 10k concurrent players is to add a Role-selector when you queue up, so you get queued with atleast 1 healer, 1 frontline every match. 
I main frontline and healer, and it sucks being a healer to 4 squishy cookies who almost never outdamage the enemies frontliners anyway OR frontline in a team without a healer. The last couple of years ive only been able to play a handfull of matches before uninstalling it again due to the annoyance it brings me. This game does not feel fun to play, it feels annoying and obnoxious and thats due to people not knowing how to pick.

Seriously, when a game that is objective based has a community that rather just picks characters that give them stats that dont mean anything since that shit isnt saved, then you know you either needs to implement something to force people to pick for objectives or change your game-structure.

To clarify to the "check his time ingame" people who cant read if it isnt in numbers, most of those hours was when Paladins was new and people actually wanted to win in it. the community and by extension the game has since dropped in quality considerably. i do not recommend the game IN THIS STATE.

PS; The ranked is botched in this game too but for other reasons, in season 1 i was diamond so ive got some experience in ranked (atleast in the earlier days), but nowadays its people who cannot play together to save their life, they spend more time screaming at one another over which champion is op and should be banned pregame than they do actually playing the match, its borderline funny just to sit back and read - up untill the match starts and you realise you have to spend 20+ minutes with these people.

This is a great game if you want to bully others, the community has toxic people but among them, you get the best kind who you're head to head with with skill making the match exciting. Over all I've loved this game since I got it, too many bugs and questionable game design choices that make me cringe, matching beginners with non beginners, delays in abilities causing you to be killed and that bug where you're in third person on drugs and the only way to solve it is to get hit. Other than that and a few other things, I highly enjoy the play style and can't wait for the bugs and glitches to be fixed along the way :).

TLDR: Play if you want to play overwatch or cod without getting 2 fps.

[h1]How to Make Fettuccine Alfredo[/h1]

Alright boys and girls today i have you here an absolutely Fantastic Fettuccine Alfredo recipe, that even Grandma Betty would approve, Alright lets get to it.

Homemade Fettuccine may have a few steps, but each step is EASY – and I assure you it’s worth the time; the perfect Italian meal. The ingredients in this recipe are all things you know and it’s not difficult at all! All you’ll need for this easy Fettuccine recipe is one pan, one bowl, and a 9×13 baking dish.

TIPS FOR MAKING PERFECT FETTUCCINE ALFREDO:
1. Start by bringing water to a boil in a large pot. Add salt to the water to season the pasta. Once it is boiling, add pasta and cook according to package instructions.

2. Saute the garlic and butter together until softened -- about 1 to 2 minutes.

3. Add heavy cream and let simmer over medium-high heat for about 5 minutes to thicken. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add half of the parmesan cheese to the mixture and whisk well until smooth.

4. Save some pasta water. The pasta water is full of flavor and can be used to thin out the sauce.

5. Toss alfredo sauce with fettuccine pasta and add half of the parmesan cheese. Once it is tossed, garnish with the remaining parmesan cheese. Add a little pasta water if it needs to be thinned out.

6. Garnish with Italian parsley, if so desired.

Ingredients

▢1 lb Fettuccine Pasta
▢6 Tablespoons Butter
▢1 Garlic Clove (minced)
▢1½ cups Heavy Cream
▢1/4 teaspoon Salt
▢1 1/4 cup Shredded Parmesan Cheese
▢1/4 teaspoon Pepper
▢2 Tablespoons Italian Parsley (optional)

Instructions
1. In a large pot, heat water over high heat until boiling. Add salt to season the water. Once it is boiling, add fettuccine and cook according to package instructions.

2. In a large skillet or pan, heat butter over medium heat. Add minced garlic and cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in heavy cream.

3. Let heavy cream reduce and cook for 5 to 8 minutes. Add half of the parmesan cheese to the mixture and whisk well until smooth. Keep over heat and whisk well until cheese is melted.

4. Save some pasta water. The pasta water is full of flavor and can be used to thin out the sauce.
Toss alfredo sauce with fettuccine pasta and add half of the parmesan cheese. Once it is tossed, garnish with the remaining parmesan cheese. Add a little pasta water if it needs to be thinned out.

5. Garnish with Italian parsley, if so desired.

Recipe Notes
▢Use real parmesan cheese, which is refrigerated.

▢If you like it to be more "saucy", you may use less than 1 lb. of fettuccine pasta. 

▢Leftover pasta water may be used to thin out pasta sauce. Do not take a bath with it.

Another prime example of wasted potential.

This game had something going, for a while. The "moba" mechanics introduced (such as itemizations and character building) were a really good idea. However, 2 or 3 good "ideas" are not enough to keep something afloat if controversial decisions are made, specially "character balance wise".

The devs can't fix their own engine, there are many reports of weird frame drops. There's no ultrawide support (even though you can select it in-game it doesn't actually work, at least didn't work here), and no, I'm not gonna "manually" set ultrawide via NVidia / Driver changes as some people stated. That's just absurd, if there's support, then it just works, simple as that.

But even if you tolerate the issues above, the main problem, in my opinion, still remains. The game is stuck on a loop of "pseudo content". The devs launch some new characters every couple months, "revamp" some maps, and that's it. There's no new game mode, for the time I've played I haven't seen, real, "new" maps (just the same map design with different textures).

As stated, the game had a lot of potential, it looks like it could be really fun,  better at balancing and managing match gameplay (through items / builds ), etc. But sadly, I feel like the "best" part of this game were the skins. They had real work put on, amazing particles, unique interactions, really cool references (Rave MAEVE is just insane) .... but that's it.

Can I just say, this game is actually so much fun and a real time passer. But for the LOVE of god! Stay well away from ranked. I've never encountered such a toxic ranked community in my life and I've put many hours on Overwatch and Valorant. Every ranked game, assuming you find one (20+ wait time) nobody plays ranked because its actually a living hell for casual players. You'll always get one person who's either eating their mic at you for not healing or for not doing enough damage. Or they cry because they don't like your card loadout, how you play, your position on the map etc. I never finished my placement matches because Id rather consume a mini cactus in its entirety than finish them. All my games just consisted of people screaming at eachother with the most pathetic reasons. And half the time, these little hormone freaks that yell at the team are often not actually playing with the team. (Mainly Victor mains) 

So yeah in conclusion, just play against A.I with friends. Even regular multiplayer is a hit or miss on toxicity. Like chill everyone. ITS A FUCKING FREE TO PLAY GAME!

First off I'd gonna be a real negative Nancy here about the art style and I'm maybe one of like six people who actually care about but I digress. Paladins as of writing this as four art styles and it looks like a colourful mess, There is this really hard to read comic book art style in which they use these heavy black outlines on literally anything and it just comes off as messy to me anyway and yes I know art is subjective but I feel very strongly about this. They (Hi-rez/Evil Mojo what the heck ever they're still apart of Hi-rez) used this art style for like a year and half until people on Reddit started to complain about it too and they even went as far as replacing better perceived art for some of the champions which was so weird. It was like trading in a brand new car for some clunker from the 80s, made zero sense whatsoever. Then they have this really detailed "realistic" style with really subdued colours in comparison to the comic book style which was just screaming colours. Now there is this like Photoshop with Blender art style if you can even call it an art style in which they just take the model, put it into a pose and just draw around the model to add detail to the background without having to do the effort of redrawing the character; You can see this alot in Rei's and Vatu's art. The final one is just a screenshot of the character doing a pose like finger guns or something or just an idle animation on top of a blue background; this is for singular cosmetics like Kinessa's Chillweave beanie and the like. Please for the love of god just stick to one style. While I'm still on a roll here I'd like to talk about Paladins' current art director, I'm sure you've at least know of him or heard of him in some passing reference but he has done some nice stuff for Paladins. Keyword there, has. ThunderBrush doesn't really know how to keep it professional about Paladins, and what I mean by that is he will openly debate people on Twitter regardless of if it's just a troll "y u creat furri character" or legitimate criticism he'd respond to it the same way and it all comes off as very childish and extremely cringe. I'm not done about him yet though. So I think it was two years ago a skin was released for a champion named Pip ( Anthro Fox with goggles ) that made him her. Pepper was created as a Genderbent Latina Gamer Girl Alt Universe Possible Scenario of Pip and this skin alone created so much controversy that people were evening trying to get the skin removed; no way in H E double hockey sticks was that ever gonna happen so ThunderBrush using his ability to talk calmly and talk in criticism very well made a post on Twitter saying something among the lines of "If you all keep complaining about Pepper then we're going to add another one called Salt". Not word for word what he said obviously but that was general gist of it so now we've come full circle. The Final Patch of 2021 would add Salt to the game two years after people stopped caring and it was all reignited again. I am fine with genderbending characters for skins, SMITE another Hi-Rez game does this very well actually and is actually professional about it, I am fine with Anthropomorphic characters as skins and even as just base characters. What bothers me about Pepper and to a lesser extent Salt is the sexualization of them and again mainly Pepper; Salt is covered up and looks nice and presentable. If you are going to sexualize a character go all the way and make that the main point of the character like Evelynn from League of Legends or don't do it at all because of stuff like this happens and just makes people upset and grossed out at least I was. They (being I don't know whoever the hell decided this was okay to put into the game) pushed the Pepper sex appeal thing even further by added a JPEG of Pepper as like a Cleopatra likeness but haha cats and put her in bandage wraps and a very loose gold skirt. You can look it up yourself but I went to church that following sunday after that image released.

The next thing I'd like to talk about is the Champions themselves and how I feel about them as a whole with some specific cases. Character design is something I wish Paladins marketed more about the game because while yes some characters (Kinessa, Viktor) are very similar to other games; the actual design of the majority are very pleasant to look at. Just some examples are Inara, Mal'damba, Vora, and Imani are some of my personal favourites. Now as I mentioned earlier Character Skins are the main income of Paladins as far as we're aware of I don't know what else would even be remotely worth buying to be honest with you. There have been and unfortunately always will be a set of around 6 characters that won't get skins in a blue moon; Please offer a prayer so people can actual have fun with the customization options for the their favourite characters. Atlas, Yagorath, Talus, Willo, Torvald, Sha Lin, Buck, and Evie all will wait upwards of two and half years for just a singular skin. Hi-Rez/Evil Mojo has gotten a tiny bit better about this by offer these character's skin for free by just playing Ranked (Which is absolute joke by the way it's just casuals with sometimes better matchmaking) but some of the characters I just mentioned still haven't gotten a skin in a while; Sha Lin and Atlas specifically because they both got their last skin on the the same patch two and half years ago and haven't gotten one since. Maeve, Ying, Lian, Cassie, Seris, and Furia are the queens of getting skins when they shouldn't but who cares right as long as the money rolls in why does it matter. It shows a lot when devs say they care and they do stuff like this. People really aren't asking for much, god I'd be happy with a recolour of the base model at this point. No online PVP game that uses skins as a monetization option has gotten this right yet. For Overwatch it's Symmetra, For League it's Skarner, Fiddlesticks; You get the point. All in all it's extremely demoralizing and frustrating to watch Ying and Maeve get a skin every 3 months and Atlas , Sha Lin and Torvald wait roughly 3 years. Here we go with ThunderBrush strikes again with not being able to keep it professional on Twitter. Quite of few people asked him a while ago on Twitter about when they could expect another Willo or Torvald skin or if there was even talk of one even happening and again not his exact words but he replies with (Probably never cause they are really unpopular champs, play lian instead). What a shitty way to reply to someone asking a genuine question and moreover a CUSTOMER. 

Hi-Rez/Evil Mojo is up next because I don't know if they ever publicly explained why but I'm gonna give you the short version of it. Evil Mojo is just a floor at the Hi-Rez office in Atlanta, Georgia. It's not a separate company, it's not different people, it's just a subdivision of Hi-Rez. Why? In their words it was to minimize the negative image of Hi-Rez studios. SMITE has an alias, Rogue Company does, Realm Royale does too. Did it work? Look at this review and you tell me. I have nothing against the people at Hi-Rez; They are all wonderful people and some of them even go out of their way to interact with players however they can some people I wanna shoutout are @TitanPonPon, @TitanForgeTina, @Romanova. Romanova specifically pushes for a ton of LGBTQIA+ Mega Collection, Final Mix, Act 2 and Knuckles representation in Paladins and that's nice cause she doesn't have to do any of that but she chooses too. My issues with Hi-Rez are purely with them as a company not them as individual people. 

That is all I have to say about Paladins and I hope someone gleamed something useful out of this. All in all I still have fun with the game but that might not be the same for you. Good Luck.

Never play this game, even if you think you like it.

Even if the ugly graphics, constant lags, glitches, monotonous gameplay do not scare you away, know:
The more you give yourself to this game, the more it will hit you in the face.
The more you succeed in this game, the more the game will prevent you from doing it.
I'm talking primarily about matchmaking and about boosting / nerfing players to achieve the "perfect balance" in the game.
You can lose 20 games in a row doing your best, and win the same number in a row without doing absolutely nothing.
If the game pulls you in, it is quite difficult to stop, because the game manipulates you very well.

Don't waste your time on this game, it's not worth it.

Never start playing this game.

This game is starting to die out as tons of bugs are not overlooked at, other than the devs just stacking up more skins, map renovations, game balances (which is good but it's not the case), adding more champions every 2 months, and more garbage decisions like changing the battle pass functionality, quests with no correct tracking, bounty store, etc.

Server Lag is severe and painful. No it is not my computer or my internet connection. 90% of the time, it's the game's servers being fucked all over. Probably because devs don't experience such thing in their side cuz they are stupid enough to realize that they are the closest to the servers or something. Why can't I jump? Why can't I cast my skills? Why can't I move right? Why am I teleporting everywhere? Why is everyone on my screen drifting to places? Answer is simple. Server is bad.

Matchmaking on the other hand is extremely stinky. We have Normal Matchmaking, Ranked, Training, and Custom. Yep. No Events or Alternative Gamemodes other than Siege, Team Deathmatch, Onslaught (Onslaught/King of the Hill), Training Siege, Training Team Deathmatch, Training Onslaught (Onslaught/King of the Hill). Absolutely no alternative gamemodes. Some Limited Time Modes exist, but why are they not permanent as a category or playable in Custom?

Back to my point about Matchmaking. It's stinky. You want to have fun in a Casual Server, but instead you are fighting against higher ranks. This does make sense with the lack of players, but it's not a great excuse cuz Ranked is not many people's tempo. With this horrible matchmaking, we are basically queueing for RNG to have good players. Which 80% of the time is bad. I wanted to play as this champion with my friends to have some funny memes, just to be ruined by a tryhard Evie, Cassie, Androxus, whatever.

Character Balancing is tame but needs a lot of work for every single character. A lot of the older characters are being forgotten and only remembered when mentioned or overlapped at the selection screen. One of the examples are Ruckus. Ruckus is a good example of a DPS Tank but a bad pick 90% of the time by how defenseless he is from multiple people that his own shield and healing gained is not enough to even tank. A skilled player knows how to use Ruckus, but many beginners (and intermediates like me) are not getting any better result with a character that is trying to do what the character's role is, but not being able to by the lack of its requirements to be the character.

Please Devs. Fix the Matchmaking and Server Lag. I can't take it anymore. I've been wanting and craving to play Paladins, but couldn't because of these issues. Your game is becoming unfun for literally anybody who joins in. It's just not the way it is supposed to be.

Add up more gamemodes as a category and bring back older gamemodes than just turning them into a Limited Time Mode. I want to experience the Payload gamemode of this game than having to deal with steroid people in Siege. I'm indeed getting tired of this game that I'd prefer playing Team Fortress 2 than this.

I just picked this game up after finally breaking up with overwatch and honestly it's such a breath of fresh air. Unlocking the champs blows but everyone has three different talents that you can choose from at the start of the match. These change how the champion plays, sometimes changing whole abilities. Items can also be purchased throughout the match that can also affect how your champion plays such as faster reload time or more damage to shields. These two things alone give the game so much more depth than overwatch. There are also loadouts that you make for every champion that affect everything such as ammo cooldowns and health. I haven't unlocked everyone yet but if you're a fan of overwatch looking for something else to play you have to give it a shot.

Paladins is the prime example of a game that is soured just by too much of one thing. Hi-Rez Studios is hyper focused on constantly creating new characters for the game instead of doing things like balancing previous broken or weak characters or even adding new maps. Paladins has 53 characters as I am writing this review and I have no doubt that it will probably reach at least 60 before it's shut down. Good luck keeping up with what these 53 characters all do, their abilities, how to use them, strategies against them and the various card builds and sub classes those 53 characters have. It's like someone gave Hi-Rez brain damage and now they can't go two seconds without making characters because that is all they literally think about. It makes sense why Hi-Rez killed its e-sports program because it would be impossible to do any type of competitive play in this Ringling Brothers circus tent of a game.

I cannot conceive of a better team-based hero shooter. This game is one of the best I've ever played. It has options for just about every conceivable play style. The mobility options are respectable, and as a TF2 veteran, that's saying something. Definitely not as competent at bestowing mobility and empowering the player as TF2 is with its perfect mobility, but it's the best I've ever come across in any other game yet. I was introduced to this game with the bot crisis in TF2, and I've loved this game ever since. The balance team actually cares about the game! While the game is best enjoyed partying with your friends, I still highly recommend the game to anyone looking for a good time. There's definitely a bit of a learning curve, given the over 50 champions running around, but it's definitely worth learning.

This game saved my life.

I am 41.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.
After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you
