Yal 100% hell no, community is literally non existent and toxic asf unless your a youtuber or a pro with other pro gc's. If you want to play with actual good people that don't suck absolute as- and actually work as a team you have to go into ranked which you then have to own EVERY single champion to even play DECENTLY as well as the fact of buying all of the champions which either you can pay a jack sh- ton of money for "crystals" or use the in game currency which on average you get about 300 coins per casual round and 2500 coins when leveling up which takes ages, and by the time you are able to even get ONE character it will be WEEKS, and not to mention the fact that if you want to be helpful in ranked you have to be really good at EVERY CHAMPION. Players in casual also either don't choose characters and end the match, spam click the character that they want to play as and then make you choose whatever role is left, or just choose a character that they suck at. Event passes are absolutely utterly useless and give you jack unless you pay for it which will also AGAIN gives you about absolute junk items and a cool skin plus a re-color of the same skin for a character you might-or might not have. "I like this character i want a skin for it" ok well there's the coin option and for the price of another champion you get one really either good-or awful skin!, if you want other skins that actually look good go pay a lot of money for crystals!!! "I like these chest items" welp too bad there are no coin chest anywhere so if you want a chest go spend your money on what?- Crystals... I have no issues with the game ITSELF (kinda) and i used to play this as a kid on my older brothers computer, it was MUCH better back then, the game itself is creative(you could argue on that point)-kinda with pretty decent(25% of the abilities suck as-)characters/abilities. Honestly this game is falling apart and the creators are just milking it for money at this point, its fun for like a month and then it just gets annoying after a while, same fancy skins for the same characters, same toxic as hell community, same junky hitboxes, same issues with bugs not being fixed :) Honestly if you want a better game with things like characters, community, story, gameplay, abilities, levels, and all of that, Warframe...don't need to elaborate much, honestly ion even like Warfame that much but its WAYY WAY WAY WAYYYY better then this...whatever THIS has become. Honestly i mean thank heavens this game is free, if it wasn't....it would still be the same review but worse. Honestly i got the game just to play Skye because she was my fav back then....its not even worth it for a character anymore... My overall experience match-wise though is always: Steam-roll the other team for a match. Get steam-rolled in the next match by a different team. Or vice-versa. It seems to be a rare occurence to get an equally skilled teams to go head to head.

Albion Online is a sandbox mmorpg in which you get to write your own story, instead of following a laid out path. Explore a vast open world consisting of different unique biomes. Everything you do has an impact on the world, as in our player-driven economy every piece of equipment is crafted by players from resources gathered from players. The equipment you wear defines what you are. Switching from knight to magician is as easy as switching your armor and your weapon, or be a combination of the two. Venture out into the world or into dungeons and face Albion's inhabitants and wildlife. Go on expeditions to encounter even more challenges. Fight other players in open world clashes. Fight over territory, or city control in tactical group battles. Relax by retreating to your personal island. Build a home. Grow crops. Raise animals. Join a guild! Everything is more fun when you work together. Leave your mark in the world. In Albion, everybody matters.

Game is full of bugs and terrible balance. Hi-rez is slowly killing the game (numbers of active players have been on a massive decline for a while now) and just pushing updates with more skins to milk the remaining playerbase of money. Bugs arent being fixed, every new update introduces a bunch of new ones (currently they added a new champion, while somehow managing to break the in game sounds and introduce a brand new bug, which kicks you out of your match and makes the game unresponsive for a few hours no matter how many times you restart it effectivelly not allowing you to play for hours when it occurs. I play casually as the ranked and matchmaking is dead and despite only the few times i tried playing, more often than not this bug would occur and render the game physically unplayable. 

This isnt a salty review, despite the company behind the game doing everything they can to kill it for the past few years, it has been a lot of fun, core ideas are imo better than overwatch with many resembling MOBAs (item shop, multiple builds and talents for champions, drafting, counters) all they have been doing for the past couple years was trying to milk the playerbase, making new skins constantly while ignoring the core game issues, introducing new bugs with skin patches and just leaving them there. 

It has got to a point where the few streamers and content creators who are left are quitting, player numbers peak at 5k and still dropping daily.

As a preface; I like this game. I have a few hundred hours into it, and I’ll get a few hundred more. 

However; 

Paladins is unpopular because, for a lot of outsiders checking it out, it looks like a cheap Overwatch clone with no thought or care put into it, and not many people are willing to jump into something popularly derided as a rip off a much bigger game. Most people would probably just say something like "I'd rather play the original." And for those on the inside it feels like a cheap clone with no thought or effort put into it. Im not saying it is, to be clear, but I am saying the feel of a game matters alot, and Paladins often feels like scorch garbage. Contrast this to Overwatch, a game polished to a very high standard, something I understand to be commonplace with Blizzard. Hell, they were apparently so famous there even used to be a phrase called "Blizzard Polish".

Now, I don't want to be one of those folks who blindly accuses the developers at Evil Mojo of not caring. (Im going to something semi-fresh and instead accuse the publisher, Hi-Rez, of not caring because they absolutely fucking don't.) But I am going to say that even if the developers from Evil Mojo are pouring their hearts and souls into Paladins, sadly, it doesn't really shine through. The game is falling apart at the seams. It has problems everywhere you look, from a shitty, barely functioning bounty store, to a matchmaker that seems to find the worst possible match-ups in history, to servers that die often you'd think they're powered by hamster wheels being tended to by poor mice that haven't been fed in 3 days.

Just because Paladins has had 6 champions shoved into it in the past year doesn't mean sqaut. Personally, I find the constant flow of new champios to be predictable and boring, and it isn't enough to keep me invested in a game that often feels like it's on its last legs these days. Paladins is unpopular because it often fails to feel like a living game which the developers truly care about. Again, Im not saying they don't, but all the words they put out about how invested they are in it won't matter to the average player when they log in, buy some skins, spend 10 minutes in a queue trying to find a match, having the server shit its pants halfway through said curbstomp of a game and they get kicked back to main menu and find all their skins gone.

Paladins is the 3rd best team shooter I've ever played. The designs are great, the controls are tight, it has way more to it than Overwatch, and it's free! Unfortunately, with the game being free, it has a lot of those problems the ftp model runs into. You have to grind an insane amount to unlock more champions, and the devs seem more focused on making skins than adding content. However, these don't feel like too terrible issues since the game is free, and you can buy all of the champions for less than Overwatch anyways. Its your standard team shooter fare, you have 3 gamemodes (usually, sometimes they have event ones) 4 roles in 5v5 matches. Queue is pretty fast, and matches are well paced. I've spent a lot of time on this game playing with my friends, and we picked it up again for the Ame voice pack. Overall, I think Paladins is a solid game and a great time with a group. If you want a game that'll last you forever, I don't think you'll find it here. My friends and I dropped it for the longest time, and probably won't pick it up again. But if you just want something to wind down on with some friends, its a great pick. 6/10

As much as I love paladins and I'm addicted to the game- it is lacking, like, a lot.

I've spent over 500 hours and I'll list some problems with the game.
1. The matchmaking. It isn't functional and doesn't allow us to play properly. Whilst playing casuals, I sometimes get paired up with lower levels who don't know how to properly play while other times I get paired up with people who simply get all the kills in the game. It's very RNG even when it says that it "depends on your elo". Playing ranked is a whole another thing. Gold players get matched with master players and go against grand masters. It's so half-arsed and needs to be fixed as soon as possible.

2. The champions. Instead of focusing on fixing the balance of older champions, they just introduce newer ones. New champions are always way too overpowered and older champions just can't keep up. But once they get nerfed, they're unplayable but HiReZ doesn't ever touch them again. Old champions need work and they should focus on that instead of massively producing new champions and skins.

3. The bugs. There are way too many bugs in this game. There's a loading bug which hasn't been fixed for about a month and it locks hundreds of people out of their game for HOURS without a fix (except reinstalling it or waiting it out). I'm not sure why this hasn't been fixed yet and it took them over 3 weeks to properly address it even thought the bug channel in their discord has been overflowing with reports.

4. How they treat the community. The community isn't listened to and even tho they have a game insights team called AoC, no one knows about them nor do they promote them. They're supposed to be the connection between the developers and regular players yet very little people are actually aware of that. 

5. Playing ranked. This is more of a personal problem but when playing ranked I've encountered numerous amount of people who troll pick a champion or who just refuse to play, running around spawn the entire game. I'm not sure how it's possible for them to just be running around, doing nothing and when you report them, nothing happens. 

This game can be fun from time to time unless you figure out the meta and start understanding the game. It will frustrate you that people do not want to play or similar. I will say it's fairly fun to play it with friends but getting one random person in your team can ruin the whole day.

Sorry for an essay, I hope this helps someone.

After playing hardly any of this game and way too much Overwatch during the pandemic, I can say without a shadow of a doubt or a hint of irony that Paladins is the better game.

This is not a perfect game. That being said it is extremely fun for anyone who likes shooters and team play. This was originally an Overwatch clone, but over the years it has become something all its own with frequent updates and patches for balance and to keep things interesting and fun. The best part about this game? There is ZERO advantage (besides maybe unlocking characters earlier) to throwing your wallet at the game. Your skill determines the win; everything else is purely aesthetic.

All in all, super fun and filled with heart pounding, adrenaline fueled firefights and cooperative endeavors such as escorting a siege engine to the enemy base or dominating a point. Also the classic of who kills who more. You can pick from 4 distinct champion classes which the various characters are divided into. The first class is damage (serious DPS guys). The second is flanker (fast and bursty, but usually very fragile guys). The third is tank (high survivability guys that usually have some kind of shielding ability). Last, but certainly not least, is support (your healers... mostly). Over 50 characters to choose from and master, but (and I think this is half the fun of it) you must unlock most of them by using gold (earned every match), crystals (earned by completing certain event things), or you can opt out of the unlocking process entirely and purchase them all in a big bundle. Personally I have never spent a dime on this game and I'm pretty close to having all the characters unlocked. Everything that is advantageous to winning is obtainable for free. There's no character you can only have by paying real money. The only 'pay exclusive' stuff are character skins, mounts etc. So you wanna play without getting stomped because some 11 year old's mommy bought him the deluxe best items and characters bundle for $169.99? Here ya go. Infinite replay value. No getting shamed by rich children.
Good game with a variety of characters and game modes. A game that is not boring, tired of the character? no problem, take another:D

I'm going to be comparing to Overwatch a lot, as most people view this game as the "free alternative to Overwatch". As someone that played both games, I can see where most people are comming from, but calling this game "free Overwatch" isn't really doing it justice. This is a great game that has similar gameplay mechanics and looks to Overwatch, but that's about it. The gameplay is quite different. I won't get into much detail, try it yourself, it's free! Now for the comparison. 
It's just about what you'd expect from a free game. Paladins doesn't have graphics as nice as Overwatch does, but that doesn't mean they're bad. There's also more bugs and the game isn't as polished as Overwatch is, but still, considering the price tag, it's pretty good! 
Since it's a free to play game, you can expect some microtransactions, but the game isn't limiting you in any way if you don't choose to pay anything. Microtransactions are basically only for cosmetics. When you start, you have just a few heroes unlocked, you'll have to unlock more of them as you progress. The gero usually costs 60 000 coins, which is, from my experience, roughly how much you make in a week, if you don't grind much. But as expected, you can unlock them faster, if you choose to spend real money. But again, even if you don't, you can still unlock all of them and it doesn't take forever. This mechanic is honestly something I'd like to see in Overwatch. When I, as a new player of Paladins opened the game for the first time, I had just 5 heroes, 1 for each class (except for support, which gets 2 heroes from the start). When I opened Overwatch for the first time, I was blasted with 32 characters that I could play right away and I was confused, I had no idea who I should play.
All in all, this is a pretty good game that deserves a better reputation than "free Overwatch".

I've never really been a fan of FPS team shooters. Granted, I grew up playing the original Call of Duty's, Battlefields, and Medal of Honors like most people. But I never got into Overwatch past the first few hours, despised the art style of games like Fortnight and slowly pulled away from the multiplayer genre of FPS due to the juvenile tantrums that started to infest the games. But for some reason, I really love the hell out of Paladins. 

Originally, I spent the opening years of it's release thinking it was similar to DOTA (don't know where I got that idea) so I avoided it. But a few of my friends were die hard fans and ended up talking me into it. I came in during the "Dragon' season and since that time, I've made sure to complete all the season grinds.

PROS

Quirky and Unique: a lot of these characters are super similar to Overwatch's cast. But for whatever reason, I enjoy the Paladin crew way more than Blizzards guys. Can't really explain it. But I find each character way more fleshed out and interesting.

The Talent and Card System: This is probably what interests me the most and is the main reason I think I've stuck with this game for so long. There are three ways to 'build' your character. First is one talent out of three that will change some aspect of the character (aka buff one ability with drawbacks on others, increase speed at loss of damage, ect). The second is a card system. Each character has 5 cards tied to each of their unique abilities. The player is given 5 card slots and 15 points to upgrade the cards they put in those slots. What that allows is a deeper customization option than what Overwatch provides. Since I'm a hard core power dork when it comes to RPG style games, this scratches the itch. There's nothing better than taking a character the community thinks is complete garbage and crafting an effective build (Torvald and early Corvus come to mind personally for me). The third is bought 'equipment' in game. This allows you a smaller form of customization in game (thru an earned credit system based of caps and kills) to counter what the other team has on the field. I prefer this method instead of Overwatch's round swapping characters style. 

Pace: this game is fast paced, even compared to it's similar partner at Blizzard. The great thing is, though, it doesn't take a lot of thought. This is one of my favorite 'end of the night' drunk games. Get on with friends, play 5-6 matches, and then go to bed. It's enjoyable and memorable. 

CONS

Free to play: it is a free to play game. So monetization is everywhere. I still think they give ample ways to earn cosmetics and characters in game. Hell, they even have a daily sale feature which randomly chooses three things you don't have for like seven bucks. But it can be tedious for those who dislike the method.

Balance: all that customization comes at a price and there are characters who are simply stronger (at their base abilities) than their counterparts. But even with that, I have yet to see one character that is simply unplayable due to balance. There are some that require a shit ton of skill or a different way of thinking (Androxis is someone I will probably never be able to play as. Can not wrap my head around him) but overall I think they've done a stellar job at keeping all of the cast in roughly the same area power wise. 

Bugs and Lag: its a multiplayer, fast paced, shooter. Lag and the random bug happens. It's not overly bad (aka New World or Bethesda games) but for it being out so long, there are some that still probably should have been fixed by this point. 

If you're into the genre, I highly recommend this game. If you have a core group of 4-5 friends, I suggest it even more. It's a great game to bond over and have a lot of laughs with.

I play it from time to time because I play with friends. 

LOTS OF BUGS
 I had a bug in which our match got stuck and it locked up my account and I couldn't play any matches anymore. This is one of many, but certainly unacceptable. Maybe they want the game to die, I don't know.

BAD MATCHUPS
 There are only a few players left on the server so if you play normals, the odds that you will end up matched against masters, diamonds and golds are standard. Heck, I write this review after my friend and I played a game against a lvl 999 and his buddies in gold with levels 300 to 400 and we got our asses beat up more than we could even receive. I wanted to give up, to go afk but I didn't want to surrender to the horrendous matching system. 

I know I am not a good player, I am not here for that. I am here for having fun and playing casually. But it's so frustrating to play against teams that destroy you time again and again. I really haven't had any fun dying constantly the second I get seen.

UNBALANCED CHAMPIONS
 I don't know how this is still a problem, honestly, but there is some really idiotic game design applied in here. Champions can be invincible. I am especially talking about ZHIN, it's a champion so broken he doesn't even care. You might ask about what of his abilities? He becomes invincible. For more seconds at a time. He even has some card that prolongs that invincibility time. That is literally so STUPID. 
AZAAN is supposedly a tank but that man is so hard to kill and does so much damage he literally is an assassin, a tank and a damage dealer at the same time. He is really hard to kill, has a passive that protects him from % of damage you deal to him. And on top of that, he does a ton of damage. And the most annoying "feature" is he is literally modifying the map. He can place some type of walls down for a moderately amount of time and nothing will go through those walls, baby. You can try to destroy the walls but they soak up so much damage you better have your grandpa's patience. It really breaks the flow of the game. Yeah. Talk about bad game design.

I love this game, but there is no functional controller support. It works 80% of the time only. Sometimes it just won't work at all, and other times it would work completely fine. I tested it with 2 different xbox one controllers the game will stop responding to my controller input mid-match for no apparent reason, but it would let me use the controller for the menu only (thanks I guess..?), so i tried changing the controller input to 'controller', guess what happened.. it tells me you can't do that mid match even though I started with a controller! anyway eventually you'll get kicked out of the game over and over, and get reported by your teammates for being AFK! I believe the game came out around half a decade ago counting the early access period.. how is this still an issue? I have around 1k hours on this game and played it on different platforms. It's super fun when it works but there will always be a few game breaking bugs like this and the one on the switch where you'd get disconnected for no reason. BTW, you can't just quit the game and go back and look for a new game, it will keep throwing you in the same match where you can't use your controller. (Again I have multiple good controllers and this happened with all of them at least once, i tried it wireless and wired, it does not matter). *huge roster

All in all i would say definitely  give it  go, its free after all. and wait for a sale and that character pack usually goes down to like $8 ish. pretty worth the money in my eyes.

Paladins is a fast-paced hero shooter which requires a heavy reliance on teamwork to succeed (if you're in ranked, lol). For casual play, I would recommend either queing with friends or sticking to TDM, because a large portion of the casual audience will just pick champs w/o regard for whether or not they are building a good team comp (such as 4 separate players all instantly locking in damages/flankers, leaving no room for a support and tank). 

I tried Overwatch, but didn't enjoy myself nearly as much because it does not offer customized play like Paladins. If I pick Ash in OW, she plays the same as EVERY Ash that I will ever face. However, I'd I pick Androxus in Paladins, I can select a loadout that buffs his movement speed and distance traveled by his dashes, or i can make another that focuses on ammo regen and a shorter cooldown on his Reversal. (this is a super simplified explanation, there's a lot of variance to loadouts). My Androxus will also have 1 of 3 talents, which alter one of his abilities to change his playstyle even further. One changes the way his pistol shoots, another adds guaranteed damage to his Reversal each time he uses it, and the last option makes his melee punch have greatly increased damage. 

Additionally, as with every hero shooter, there are different classes: Flankers focus on movement and getting in and out quickly to secure kills, Damages excel at (duh) dps, Frontlines have large health pools and abilities that are good at negating/blocking damage, and Supports focus on healing their allies and providing other buffs/debuffs to allies/enemies. Each class has roughly 10-15 champions. So between the loadout and talent system, classes, and champions, there's probably a way for all FPS fans to enjoy this game :) I hope you'll give  it a try!! :D

While I love this game I feel obligated to say that this game is unpolished, riddled with bugs, horribly imbalanced, characters are overpriced (10$ or like 10+hrs of playing to get a single character), and a variety of other problems. 

That being said this game does fill a surprisingly underrepresented aspect of the character shooter genre and that is a focus on casual play. You find a character you like design wise? Congrats you can now play them in basically every role, no, I'm not exaggerating. This game puts a large focus on customization so you can alter each character's playstyle in massive ways, allowing you to play however you want and be effective if you get good at it, I used to play a squishy support as a cooldown-reliant dodge tank and found huge amounts of success doing so.

Ultimately, if you're looking for a competitive, balanced, and polished game as is the norm, you will not find it here, this game is the antithesis of that.
However, if you're looking for a chill, turn your brain off and press buttons game this one is for you.

As a person who has played both Overwatch and Paladins (but admittedly more Paladins) I would say that this game is still fun in comparison to Overwatch. I see this issue appear lots between fans of both games and I personally believe that both games have their upsides and downsides. I personally love the customisation which this game has to offer, which allows every character to be played completely differently from game to game by using different talent and load-out cards and even different items! I think this adds lots of strategic depth to the game, other than just "whoever can aim the best wins." I also think it has a very diverse range of characters, which wonderfully fill the four roles in the game (damage, flank, frontline and support). Despite this, I do understand where issues arise with the game. Firstly is that there is a defined meta, which certain characters are weakened by and certain excel in. But why not just pick the best character? Well this is where the issue of character unlocking is presented, since certain characters need to be purchased using coins or gems in the game which can be either very hard or virtually impossible to gain without spending real money. This makes the game very pay to win, allowing players who spend money on the game to have an immediate advantage. This gap can be overcome with enough time in the game however, since eventually you can unlock every character you want naturally. As stated prior, at certain times there are defined metas, where certain characters may be too powerful or not powerful enough. Overall it is a very good game however... and it's completely free to play!

Personally, I'd say this game is the next Overwatch.

Although sure, they are lacking so many things that Overwatch has, this game is much better in my opinion for various reasons.

1 - More champions/characters to play. 

We get around 3 - 5 champions (heros) each year and a good amount of maps along that as well. 

2 - More playablity.

This game has things called "Talents". Talents are basically special powers or extra skills you can use to change the playstyle. You can choose one out of three different ones at the start of each game.

These could vary from an extra healing charge for a healer, giving the healer more damage. Or "executing" (one-shotting) an enemy at or under 35% HP using a specific character, heal other players while using a specific move, and so on. 

The game also has these things called "Loadouts." Loadouts are a set of 5 cards that you make which changes things about the character. More HP, shorter cooldowns, extra range on moves, more ult charge, etc. 

Each card can go up to 5 points. To have a usable loadout, you need it to have 15 points maximum.

3 - Cosmetics.

For example, gold skins. In Overwatch, gold-skins are only available for your weapon. While in Paladins, the game allows you to get gold-skins for your entire character. Changing the color of the moves, the color palette of the champion to gold/black/light-purple. etc.

Also, there's a LOT of skins in this game. And you can also combine multiple skins! For example, I can use this skin that changes the color palette of the champion and then take the gold-skin for the weapon. Ending up with an interesting and unique look for each champion.

I could go on and on about this, but I feel as if this is more than enough. :)
If you're looking for a free alternative to Overwatch.

I have more than 1000 hours on this game, playing since early Betas. The gameplay is amazing. The characters are very cool. Skins are awesome. However, the company that manages this game seems to not care about it since a long time. They don't make quality of life changes, they don't support content creators, they don't try to build a community around the game. There used to be big championships in the past, but today there is nothing. Playing this game alone feels sad these days. Playing with friends is still nice. But overall, it is a nice game that I recommend having as secondary one. My main FPS right now is Apex Legends, so when I need some break from the Apex's grind this is a good choice. So, I don't recommend picking this game as a primary game, where you would put time and effort to be great at, but it can be a fun secondary game. Just play it for fun and have in mind that this game will probably die soon if Hi-Rez keeps making the same mistakes.

Played on PS4 since beta, recently came to PC cos deluxe was on sale. Great game if you didn't start it on a SONY platform. Matchmaking still takes an ungodly amount of time, the devs pretty much stopped caring about ranked and even your placement matches will be 10 minute queues. Bugs from beta still exist and CC only gets worse.
All that being said, the cards system incorporated with the TF2 style gameplay is very very good, to the point I have played this game for 5 years despite all of the atrocities that have happened with. CC is an issue, yes, but it gives an actual skill gap to the game that didn't really exist early on in the games' life as a lot of the pros and normal players were literally in the same bracket(yes I know pro play was a joke in terms of eSports overall,) but now you can actually have a learning curve to put yourself above others. Old characters for the most part still are good even 5 years after, and new characters are usually really strong when added but the game eventually balances around that. Yes, there are specific outlying champs that simply outclass everyone else in their archetype, but for who people actually want to play and do play anyway, the game IS fairly balanced. Bugs do completely fuck this up sometimes, but the game has had massive dips and climbs of players and different teams have worked on the game itself making a lot of the fixes take an incredible amount of time as the game was built on shit code that the current team has somehow made work. I definitely recommend buying the deluxe edition on a sale as it is at least worth that entirely over F2P as you will enjoy it more with the vast and expanding roster. I could recommend the Deluxe at the full price tag as well, but I personally already bought the game twice so I wasn't going to pay full again as SONY refuses to let account merging be a thing on their draconian shithole of a platform. TL;DR: Worth $30USD, if you like it, worth $60. Game has some bugs and can be sweaty but is definitely the most fun non-competitive FPS.

This is hands down my favorite hero shooter. I love both Overwatch and Paladins, but conceptually, Paladins has more to offer to challenge me (i.e. talents, items, loadouts, etc.). People love to compare them, but Overwatch just feels like the same thing over and over again, whereas Paladins allows each game to change dynamically.

Healers being able to defend themselves is a huge plus. The inactive healing mechanic is pretty cool...makes for some sweaty games. I love that they add new champions frequently enough so that I don't get bored.

The only feedback I have is to get better graphics, and the beef up the competitive scene. They'll need to throw money at this game to make it more successful. I'd hate for it to die when it is truly is the best of the hero shooters right now despite its lack of popularity.

This game saved my life.

I am 42.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ing minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

This game was super refreshing after playing a lot of OW several years ago. Nowadays I seldom play either, but find this game vastly less infuriating.

There's a ton of heroes, all unique and powerful in the right hands, and plenty of customization (something OW always lacked). It's a shame it doesn't get more recognition, but there is still a super active player base, it's free, and it scratches the team shooter itch as good as any game out there.

Overall, if you're remotely curious about this game, play it. I don't recall it being that pricey to unlock all the heroes (you can grind for them as well), but with dozens of unique heroes and satisfying abilities/gameplay, it's a no-brainer if you like these types of games.

My friend recommended this to me. Said "it looks like bootleg Overwatch but it's actually pretty cool". After giving it a try for a few hours I have to say: It looks like bootleg Overwatch and it plays like bootleg Overwatch. The game's community has less communication than other MOBAs, the different abilities make no sense to me, sometimes I can't even tell what they do, the levels all feel pretty dark, I found the interface clunky and confusing at times, and you can't even play as any character. You have to grind several hours as the free options, none of which I found satisfying, to even get the one you want. Or you could pay for it but like... I dunno. I feel like a lot of this was poor expectations set up by my friend but I also just am not having any fun playing it. To be fair I didn't pay for Overwatch either, it was gifted to me, but I'd still rather pay for a complete game than a free confusing one. Heck, League of Legends plays better and is less confusing. Maybe I'll come back to it eventually, give it another shot, but right now I'm unimpressed. As I feel right now, I can't recommend it. Could totally be missing something or not getting something but I feel pretty solid about my opinion.

I've been playing this game on and off since it came out. I really wish Steam had a "meh" score because I don't feel like this game deserves a negative review, but I don't think it deserves a positive review either. 

I suppose I may as well compare this to Overwatch, since that's always the first thing people bring up. Saying this game is a "knockoff" of Overwatch is inaccurate, since they were both in development at around the same time. Do some of the characters in here feel like OW clones? Yeah definitely, and some of the later additions may very well be, but let's be honest here. Overwatch knocked off TF2 with a lot of its characters, but at least Paladins has the decency to admit it's being derivative (like having an Engie skin and voice for Barik). 

As far as the gameplay itself goes, it feels a little clunkier than Overwatch because of the typical Hi-Rez jank, but it's fine for the most part. The characters are where it really shines though. There's more variety than Overwatch and characters have more defined roles (there's an actual flanking category). The moba-like card and talent system is also a great feature, since it gives you multiple ways to play the same character. You could have a pure healer Grover, or if you're a secondary healer you can focus on CC and DPS. It's incredibly flexible. 

Sadly, there are two areas where I feel like the game falls short. For one, matches are only 5v5 as opposed to Overwatch's 6v6. There are people who say 5v5 is fine and that's how it should be, but unless your team is REALLY coordinated, you're going to need two healers, i.e. you're going to have to sacrifice a DPS. Ordinarily this would be fine, since most healers in this game can actually put out decent damage, but the problem is the playerbase. I don't play ranked so I can't comment on that, but in casual it's extremely rare to ever get in a match where another person wants to be healer. You can see them hovering over a healer, and the second you lock in your healer, they immediately swap to DPS. And then they proceed to try to Rambo everything thinking you'll drop everything to heal them from across the map. And that's the other problem. The community is uh...not great. Again, I can't speak for ranked, but in casual there is zero communication. In Overwatch and even TF2 (at least on community servers) there's at least some communication. People on here will also get REALLY mad if you lock in a character they wanted to play as, even when they said nothing before the match started. And once a character is locked in you can't switch, so now you have to deal with a teammate who hates you.  

The one other complaint I have is that there just aren't enough maps. They consistently add new characters and skins (way more than what Overwatch ever did) and while I do appreciate it, I really wish they'd design more maps. Recently they reskinned a map, and it looks WAY nicer than what it did before...but I'd still like more. Or at the very least, a custom mode. But given how janky Hi-Rez games can be, it would probably result in a lot of bugs. It's just...they have battle passes and expensive skins requiring a lot of paid in-game currency. Surely they can do more with their budget? Then again, given all the stuff they've put in SMITE lately (Ninja Turtles, The Last Airbender, Transformers) I'd bet Hi-Rez spends most of their budget on licensing deals and leaves their devs out to dry.

JULY '22 UPDATE: well now the game is just plain awful. I install, log into the game and the first thing I see is a full screen notification for their RWBY crossover. Click out and then I see ANOTHER full screen notification telling me about the battle pass. Click out and then I see a thing where I can get free gems or whatever if I watch a 30 second ad. Paladins is now acting like a trashy mobile game and it feels like one too. 

The game is somehow even buggier now. On the character select screen, the background textures constantly flicker. Half the time the textures on my own character don't load. Decided to try out the new character Lillith, locked her in, and decided to buy the green variant of her skin since I had a ton of gold coins just sitting around. It popped up the notification for the new skin, and it would NOT go away. Kept clicking next, kept clicking dismiss all, the notification wouldn't go away until the match loaded. Character animations don't work sometimes. Sound effects don't play half the time, so I can't tell if my attacks connected unless I'm staring directly at the enemy I targeted. Game is also plagued by cheaters, so the only time you might have fun is when you're playing training matches against the AI. 

What an absolute waste. Everyone at Hi-Rez and Evil Mojo should be ashamed of themselves. Go play Valorant. Go play CoD Warzone. Go play Halo Infinite. Wait for Overwatch 2. Anything would be a better use of your time than this garbage.

I started playing Paladins back in 2017, during the open beta. I've been hesitant to give this game a review for years, even though I have over 1,000 hours in it. Paladins is a hard game to review. 

Paladins is fun, but only when you're in a party with your friends. Going into casual, or ranked, by yourself is no where near as fun as playing with your friends. I wouldn't recommend playing by yourself at all. With the current update cycle, there's a new champion every two months, which changes the meta, especially in ranked. Getting new skins every two months is also nice, even if some of the champions haven't had a new one in years. 

Even so, there are numerous bugs preventing me from fully recommending the game. In-game hitboxes are infuriating, and the invisible walls make the few flying champions feel bad to play. As much as I love getting new content every two months, I feel I would much prefer it if Evil Mojo took the time to patch these bugs out. The fact that Vora's prematch cosmetic splash art is misaligned, leaving a jarring black rectangle, doesn't affect gameplay at all -- its just gives the game an unrefined look. 

All in all, Paladins is a good game, great, even. Evil Mojo does take community feedback to heart, and does care about this game and community. And, simply put, Evil Mojo is a much better company than Blizzard ever was or could hope to achieve. If you can look past the bugs, Paladins is the best of its genre.

longer version--

I've got over 2k hours on this game.  I play it a lot and over the years always come back to it because at it's core it is an amazing game.  I'll list pros and cons and because the cons are extensive i'll counter them all and explain why i still play this beast despite them.

Pros:
-FTP, absolutely no need to spend in this game
-interesting characters that combo together.  Every game is different and that's amazing.  Except at high rank i'll cover that. 
 in cons.  The game is amazing because you will have to kind of learn the game anew each match with the composition you have and be flexible enough to figure out the playstyle that will make it work.  For instance it might fail until you figure out to group up well, or until you figure out to focus a specific weakness of the other team of of the map.  This means tactical thinking is rewarded on top of skill.  Knowledge of maps and characters and sound are cumulative and the net effect is a very enjoyable competitive match.
-looks great even on a toaster
-skill pays off 
-Ranked games come in less than 2 minutes at all hours
-character voice commands, not a lot of games have this but in this game they are fun and highly useful.  Some of the skins come with special voice packs which is really a nice touch and fun.
-skins actually enjoyableif you spend a lot of time in the game and honestly they really did well with their business model.
-champ abilities combo together powerfully and interestingly in groups.  2+2=5


cons:
-highly toxic player base that increases in toxicity the higher you rank with plat + being unbearable.  Thankfully you can mute them in games which i do almost every game from the first sign of one guy being a little B.  I realized early on there's no point communicating with people in this game anyways, skill should take over intuitively and the character voice commands can handle the rest.  

-The ranking system is pointless due to the fact that the player base suffer from copycat syndrome and refuse to play any characters except those sanctions by streamers and so on.  Each season the streamers rank the characters and the unoriginal masses just copy that and throw fits if you don't pick a character named by their favorite e-legend or whatever.  They also bandwagon together to try to sound better than they are.  This leads ranked play at higher lvls to be really boring and each match a repeat of the last, and a higher concentration of babies playing.  The skill levels at higher brackets actually decreases as people become inflexible and double toxics.  Like they have nothing in their life except the rank # to be proud of.  Extremely SAD.  

That being said you can downrank easily and play in the sweet spot which is mid gold to mid plat.  You'll see what i mean, pretty fast.  Unless you're a squealing man child who needs the game to say master next to your name so you can finally find the validation your parents and peers never gave you...  But even then this game has a place for you and a peer group you'll understand LOL

Here's my personal experience with "Hi-Rez Studios" and "Easy Anti-Cheat" and "Paladins" as a whole. I first joined the game a few days ago after getting a little bored of Overwatch and as I progressively played and unlocked some content with my decent aim from all my experience in games like this one... I proceeded to buy around $82.00 worth of extra content however from this moment on was down hill. After spending a lot of hard earned money on this game I wanted to show off my new content in training mode with fellow players in which we all face AI bots. I had a really good round I was having a blast but my Bluetooth Xbox One remote (The one I use for most the games I play on PC) started to die and usually when that happens while playing any game on my system it causes a memory leak or some kind of heavy glitch that takes down my FPS and crashes the game till my batteries are replaced. Long story short the game crashed after my controller died well I thought no biggie I'll just re-log like I do every time my controller crashes a game... well I re-log and come back to a big fat banned screen their anti-cheat had detected the glitch as a cheat and banned me right as it happened! I was not upset right off the bat however I was instantly concerned about my account and sent in a support ticket explaining what happened, after a few days they hit me back with some generic message almost auto like response explaining how I cheated and I was banned for breaking the rules. I was very frustrated at this point because they not only sent me a generic response but they also flat out ignored my concerns with what was going on. I thought okay I will try to find another way to contact them so I headed to the Paladins Reddit Discord server and contacted a few employees only to be told to send in another support ticket... I went ahead and filed another support ticket with Hi-Rez and got the same automated message saying I was banned for cheating. I continued to search for one last bit of hope so I had a private discussion with a Hi-Rez Steam Discussions admin, who had validated mine and others concerns with this games anti-cheat and told me to send in a support ticket. I sent in this final ticket explaining yet again what happened and got the same exact generic automated response. I never cheated. This is a honest review of my experience with Paladins and this company, This is also not a public ban appeal discussion I'm not trying to get un-banned anymore however I would suggest you switch to Steams anti-cheat system because others all over the web are expressing the same issues with "Easy Anti-Cheat".

This game saved my life.

I am 27.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ing minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you, Amelia Watson. You've genuinely saved my life with this voice pack.

I may not have many hours displayed here but I actually played this game a lot before getting it on Steam, using the Hi-Rez launcher, even spending some money to support the devs. At that time, during 2017-2018 I had a lot of fun and played with a friend quite often, but as other games started releasing and we had other things to do, so we just moved on. 

Game is okay, basically described as a "free Overwatch", but with much more consistent updates, new champions and balance. The skins are usually very good and some characters are interesting to play, but if you start loging in less and less, coming back like I did will be tough.

I don't really care much about the game now but I'm sure that if you don't mind investing some time you'll have a nice and competitive experience for (at least) months! If you don't like it it's fine

EDIT: before you could buy 1 pack to unlock every champion and instantly get new ones when they released. Now you have 3 different kinds of "packs" that unlock a different amount of characters and the most expensive one will give you access to the newer champions. That's quite bad if you ask me, but at least you can still unlock them with the in-game currencies (afaik), don't know how much grind you'd need tho...

I played the game since it's first released, now i'm back because of the update. Here are some of my thoughts about the game:
⚬ Graphic: The game has a " cartoony " graphic, it looks like it's made in 2012 not 2018. However because its graphic, the game is playable even if you have a bad computer ( mine included ).
⚬ Gameplay: It's easy to play but hard to master, every characters ( I think ) have simple kits, not complicated. However, the game is kinda " unbalance ", some characters are RIDICULOUSLY overpowered, and if you don't ban one of them in ranked, you just gonna have a bad time playing against them.
⚬ Other thoughts:
- You don't need to spend your money to get crystals, you can grind to get it and it's pretty easy to get. ( I've 600 crystals currently more than enough to buy the new event pass without spending a single dime )
- If you are a competitive players, you must have patience because the queue time in ranked is at least 5~ mins and the matchmaking is BAD. For example, if you're new to rank, you will queue with/ aganist 1 - 2 grandmaster, the others could be gold or above.
⚬ Overall, the game is still fun to play in normal but in ranked, it's not. If you're a competitive players and you want to grind your rank, I wouldn't recommend you play the game.

It's gotten to a point where you don't encounter them once in a blue moon, but rather you're gonna encounter bugs every single game.

Some aren't impacting the game at all, otherwhise actively negatively impact both fun and fairness, for example the bug where you don't get a horse but instead stay in first person perspective, and stay bugged until anything hits you.

If you can see past those bugs and enjoy the game for what it is, then have fun with it. I for my part have taken a long break, and at this point i still don't know if I'm mentally ready for those bugs again.

I originally played on Xbox, highly doubt i will ever do anything with the game on pc, but from my console experience, if you only play the game a few days a month, this game is fine. You won't really notice too awfully many game breaking bugs or glitches. But i love this game. The items, loadouts, the entire game is just perfect for me. But it is absolutely unplayable. Devs can't (or won't) fix years old bugs, they rework perfectly balanced maps (stone keep 100% did not need a rework, it was completely fine. Frog Isle's rework clipped numerous locations, rendering a critical place that was used for out of combat healing completely useless. Bounce points are nowhere near realistic. Servers are laggy, and the devs basically tell you "If you have a bug we can't fix, it's your internet". Matchmaking is never going to be perfect in team vs team games like this, but holy shit. I remember one instance when I was in ranked, our top pick was grandmaster, and our bottom pick was silver. How can you possibly allow that? The concept of this game is god tier. The potential of this game is unmatched. But the execution and management of the game is absolutely unacceptable.

The monetization is complete crap.  Even if you pay to have all of the characters unlocked, you're still going to be paying around 10 or more dollars for a skin.  The gold they give you in the game is used to unlock characters, but it's borderline worthless if you actually gave them money up front and bought the game to unlock the characters from the start.  What's more, almost all of the skins are locked behind loot box crap, and unlike Overwatch, you can't use your gold to buy the more desirable skins, only crappy recolors.  Combine all of this with a paid battlepass that locks you out of obtaining certain skins forever, and you've got a game that exists purely to milk you from your money.  Think about this:  would you rather have a 10 dollar skin or a whole new game on Steam?

I like this game because first of all, it’s free. I’ve played this ever since I was 13 with my best friend almost daily but abruptly stopped when I turned 15 because I thought it was time to take school seriously, and mostly because my best friend went to a different school. It is fast paced and I get bored easily so that is a factor that makes me like it. The ability to customise cards, loadouts and an item shop makes it unique. You can be OP against the enemies depending on your custom loadout.  

Paladins is a free-to-play team-based first-person shooter game that has two opposing teams on either side of the map. The main goal of each team is to capture the objective in the middle of the map. Each team will need 4/4 points to win. Capturing is 1 point, and successfully pushing the payload is an extra point. The objective is a circle where each player can stand on, preferably the front line, in order to gain points. You need to get 100% in points. After capturing the objective, a payload will spawn in the objective circle. The payload is a cart filled with explosives that has its own route towards the enemy base. The team who has captured the objective will then push the payload in order to make it go forward. The enemy team can stop the payload from pushing forward by standing in the circle emitting around the payload. The opposing team needs to defend their base within a given time limit, if not contested. If the payload runs out of time before going to the enemy’s base circle, the team who captured the payload won’t have an extra point, otherwise if they successfully pushed the payload in the circle, they will gain an extra point. Whoever gets to 4 points first, wins.

There are four different classes: the tank, support, flank, and damage. The tank has a lot of HP and shielding skills that makes them the best for standing in the middle of the objective as long as they are constantly healed by the support. The support has team healing skills. Flanks specialize in mobility skills which allow them to flank the enemy from the sides or behind. Lastly, the damage class has the most damage output with their skills. You must have good aim, fast reflexes, good instincts, and the right timing to use each skill- unless you’re a damage class then go bonkers.


The game doesn’t require you to buy in game purchases in order to have an edge over the enemies, they simply sell cosmetics. Although, there used to be a time where a patch- the OB64 patch, made it pay-to-win. In order to upgrade the cards for the loadout, you had to open chests. You also had to obtain several similar cards in order to level each one up. The champions used were also much stronger at higher levels, resulting in an unbalanced game if your champion is a lower level. That system is now non-existent, thankfully. As for the benefits of buying cosmetics using real money, I guess you can distract the enemy by having better skins but I’m sure it’s only for the player’s satisfaction. There are certain items that can be bought using virtual game money by grinding the game daily, specifically the quests and events.

There are so many bad decisions that absolutely plague this game. Unable to change heroes during a game and backfill are the two biggest ones. If you don't have a healer, that's it. You're fucked the rest of the game. Double goes for any roles you don't have filled. No tanks = dead. No dps = dead. No flankers/good flankers = dead. And if anyone decides to leave, they're replaced with a very dumb bot.

And that's not to mention all the bugs that riddle this game. You can get locked into the same screen by accident if you simply get anything is one I run into almost all the time. Only fix is by ctrl alt deleting the damn game.

Oh, and this game is PLAGUED with microtransactions aimed at whales. It is so bad, it makes Warframe blush with envy. Can't even buy every individual skin for a hero, you gotta buy chests that each cost $8 and hope for a CHANCE to get them. That's not to mention the game intentionally locks you out of being able to complete the playable roster unless you're willing to grind hours every day(since the gold drop rate is pitiful), drop $8 on every single champion, or drop $10-$60 to get the full roster.

I get it's free to play, yet this game is nothing but predatory. I advise anyone and everyone to steer very clear of this blatant Overwatch rip off that doesn't even accomplish a FRACTION of things already established in the hero shooter genre.

You want a good hero shooter game that's not an excuse to be predatory?

Now, i have way too many hours in this game as you can see, but to my defence i've played it since open beta, and this game has changed a lot, and i mean a lot. I've played through the 'Cards unbound' Update, and if you're an OG you know how bad that time period was for this game. Let's start with new players. If you come from Overwatch, this game will be a breeze in the park for you, if not, then it will be a bit harder for you to learn. This isn't a tutorial on how to play because they're plenty of guides for that, but the new player experience is quite challenging to say the most. I'm sorry, but unless i get in a game with other players i've seen or played with in the past, then i know the casual game has a 90% chance of either you destroying the other team (which may have only 1 good player on it) or you getting destroyed, very rarely is causal any fun unless you play in a party with good players. Comp. For OCE players like myself, as far as i am aware comp has been dead in that server for about 2-3 years +. During that time playing comp in OCE, i was diamond at the time, and i am not joking, i was versing legit paladins pros at the team (PPC or PPL is what they called it but there isn't a ESports scene for this game anymore as far as i am aware) even though they were both Grandmasters. I moved to SEA servers to play comp, where once again i was versing pro players in Diamond, Plat, and gold. Yes Gold (Im not bad i promise, i played with friends, Cope). My point with this is to let you know comp can and will mostly be balanced. Meta. I will tell you this right now, if you dont play 'Meta', and especially in comp, people will say very rude words to you, even if you drop 90+ Elims and 200k+ damage AND win the game (True story btw), they will still blame you. By me saying meta, im not talking about not picking a role that the team needs, eg not playing tank when you only have one or none, or not playing healer, im talking about characters, because for whatever reason, people don't care how good you are, and will have a sook if you dont play the character they want you to. So, if you want to try and get into this game, go ahead, it is fun, and i would't have 1200+ if it wasn't, it's easy to learn but hard to get into if you understand what i mean. But other than that i give it a 7/10

I'm loving the game so far. Bit late to the party obviously, but i'm still getting matches quickly so I don't think it makes any difference. The sheer amount of characters in the game now and all with different abilities is amazing, I've been loving just trying each out and learning how to use the abilities for each properly.

A lot of characters, like the new one "Trickshot". First time I tried her I thought the abilities were rubbish and I hated it. Tried it again the day after and it just clicked and now shes awesome. You can basically lob a coin in the air and then shoot it to bounce shots at people (for higher dmg). It felt gimmicky at first, but once you realise you can use it to shoot around corners or if you are trying to capture an area - just lob the coin in the air, and shoot the hell out of it from relative safety whilst the dmg numbers ping all over the show, its awesome. 

Give it a shot, it's free for the most part and only costs if you want to unlock more heroes/costumes etc and honestly, it's well worth unlocking all the heroes just to play around even if you suck at it like i do.

that being said it is a good game to play very casually and it can be a replacement for other hero shooters.


This game has a 50/50 win-rate policy. the more you win, it will match you against better and better players and put in your team worse and worse player, thus making it really hard for you to win. I've seen games with 3-4 GM's or masters in one side and pure silver or gold players in the other, this will not be an issue if you are mostly an average player, but if you have played games like this before at semi-high level you will notice it quite soon.

It's really hard to acquire Champions if you don't buy the packs or buy crystals, most of the good champions are really expensive so you either know which one to buy or you lament for a long time for not having enough gold to buy them.

The game doesn't have a kill cam, they removed it because they couldn't fix it and I fear they may never implement it again. On that note, not knowing how the others killed you WILL lead to frustration, and will probably hinder the ability to understand other champion's gameplay style (having the first person camera of someone playing it well, specially when you can see how you were playing when they killed you, it's a massive tool to learn how to counteract a champion, improve your gameplay or even know if a champion is fun to play without having it yourself)

People that AFK/Alt+F4, Feed, Insult or are plainly Smurfing (that are reported) will never get taken actions against, only cheaters have a chance and only if you write it explicitly in the comment and choose the "OTHER" category.

Finally, it tends to run horribly in many not-high-end pc's seemingly for no reason, has many Visual bugs and gameplay bugs, colliding with other people makes your character stutter (in some rare occasions you both get clipped and push each other upwards until you collide with the ceiling), many collision boxes don't match the visual models specially in new maps.

Finally queue times can be very long for ranked (10+ minutes is the norm for me) and casual can also go for 4+ minutes in queue, also the queue system not always makes sense.

Not worth the time, all devs care about is adding furry skins and lgbtq pride banners, aswell as the basically naked skins to get the 11 year old weebs to buy them, after 900 hours, I have collected more than 15GB of glitches I experienced whilst playing (I captured them as 15 second clips with NVIDIA capture), and I never recorded the same bug happening twice, server always lags late at night, toxicity, just don't.

Idk how to rate this game, more of a neutral rating than a purely negative one,

- I somehow clocked 160+ hours, but I will admit a vast majority of it was because its a free game that I can play with friends. So I'll give Paladins this much credit, first of all: it offers a free co-op experience and that's good.

- Further, I must say I really like the deck system and I think other class/character-based arena shooters should learn from it.

- I'm also a huge fan of certain champions: whoever made the turret man a tank with utility mini-sentries deserves a damn raise firstly, what a good take on an otherwise boring trope. Fernando also gets compared to OW's Renhardt a lot but Fernando feels completely different and much more dynamic. And then there's heroes straight out of left field like Atlas, Mal'damba, Imani, that I just love for being so original.

But my experiences with the gameplay itself overall aren't positive,

- 19 out of 20 games I'm either stomping or getting stomped, and stomping doesn't even feel good because I'm just afk on a point for half the game watching my opponent's death timers.

- While the characters are an overall positive, there's one or two that are truly questionable. Like that Vivian character just...left clicks. That's it, that's her entire kit. Either she's utterly busted like she was a year ago or she's terribly weak. How do you plan to balance this?

- Also kind of tired of the current roster. As much as I like the heroes, as a tank main I've been playing the same 10 folk for god knows how many games and Hi-Rez promises 1 char per year. Meanwhile fraggers have 28 options! No wonder everyone wants to hog DPS, heck, even I want to now that I write this.

- The game itself is pretty scuffed from a technical standpoint. Friends and I regularly experience crashes/disconnects, frame drops, loading screen sounds getting super loud and blowing our eardrums. Some textures and shaders lately have also started showing up as blurry/not fully loaded (mid settings, and I have a 11-month-old 3060 that runs AAA titles just fine). Not sure what can be done about these issues but its pretty annoying.

Sleeper hit that came out during Overwatch's massive hype, it's got a pretty unique card upgrade mechanic, and is still fairly active these days.

Also it's free-to-play without being scummy so that's a giga bonus.
Edit: They're putting Amelia Watson as an announcer so I'm obligated to give this game like 20 more points
Paladins is just Overwatch for broke people. It's good tho

Don't play this game, Its a game that is ridden with bugs some multiple years old, matchmaking is poor and someone crashes most matches.
But most of all, don't play it because it's Hi-rez.
This is a developer who doesn't care about the player at all, its not about the game, its about how much money they can get from you as they endlessly chase trends without the understanding that they have had something potentially great yet squandered it.
They see the player as lesser than them, intentionally antagonising the player base and acting holier than tho down at the pleasantry, straight up telling the community to "deal with it"
This company did the same thing with Tribes Ascend years ago, they did their absolute best to burn the bridge between the community and the developers going so far as to pull old favourite maps because their rework was getting criticism, not because it was bad, but as a punishment, said so by the developers themselves.
And here Hi-rez is doing the same thing again, when a skin for the community received backlash the art lead intentionally made a followup skin called salt just to piss people off. When a new champion doesn't get people calling
This is an art lead that consistently rips off other IP's with champion designs, from Warhammer 40k Space Marines, Tyranids, Mortal combat, Doom, Diablo, all the edgy games and IP's. It's like having a Deviant Art teenager who grew older but never grew up and out of his deviant art era mentality. Any criticism, constructive and justified or not is met with derision and "I troll you" mentality.

But sure, if you don't care about any of that and just want to play the game casualy, lets look at how it plays
The game is not stable, it has not been stable for years. whether or not the game is playable depends day to day, servers barely run with hit detection being as much as 4 seconds behind and input delay being just as bad. One can go several matches in a row with someone on their team crashing and disconnecting. Ranked is no better, just while I am writing this I saw a new video clip of someones ranked match crash to menu when they were seconds from winning a ranked match.
The draw of being able to make loadouts and play a champion the way you like is sadly not something that is a reality, as several times when a champion has a alternative way to play that is outside what is intended it gets nerfed, as such for many champions there is one way to play.
Animation bugs are in every match and for every champion, and entire features (third person mode and killcams) have been removed to fix them only for said bugs to remain in the game over a year later.
Several maps are getting reworked despite the community asking for new maps, while the game has several in progress maps from over 2 years ago still playable in custom mode. When the Maps do get a visual rework, they come with clipping, Textures that do not align with the map mesh, sometimes broken lighting, ultra heavy ramps that cause one to be unable to walk up them and entire area's the only certain characters can get to.

Monetiseation is centred solely around whales, with skins releasing in limited time lootbox chests exclusively, lackluster battlepasses, and direct to buy skins sitting at around $15 a pop.

So, when the Art director says that the recent skin was released because the community fucked around and found out. he is right, they have been fucking around and are going to find out the result, maybe not today, maybe not next month but at somepoint.

TL:DR the devs are malicious in their attitude towards the player, have not learned from their mistakes, and the game is buggy

The cards and talents add a lot of depth to the gameplay. There is a lot of player expression since a healer can play flank and a tank can play damage and so forth. As a player I do not feel restrained to a "meta".

Undeniably and uncontrollably fun. For those that don't want the toxicity of Overwatch yet the ultimate goodness of hero class shooters, you NEED to get this game. Plenty of ways to win without spending obscene amounts of money, and it's super easy to get fairly good at this game.

This game has a ton of potential to become bigger than it is, but the only thing holding it back is some polish. 
1: This game desperately needs skill based matchmaking for one thing, it's not fun for new players the get stomped by already experienced players who find it more fun to crush newbies and casuals than to actually play against others at their level. 
2: Some reworks to the currently available champions would also be a good focus. Some of their kits have just filler cards that don't really do anything.
I hope the devs would stop pumping out champ after champ and just focus on what they already have.

Ahhhh jumping back into Paladins, after around 3 years, feels so good.The nostalgia hit hard, since this was my free overwatch dose back in the day.It's your typical moba shooter,with its charming cartoon-ish graphics,tons of champions, with more releasing each season and a fairly in depth customization system to suit your playstyle .At its core, Paladins hasn't changed much, since i played it last time and that's not necessarily a bad thing. Matchmaking is fast and the timeframe to pick champions/load in between games feels shorter(which was my only complaint back then.You could literally brew some coffee in between matches! ).
Apart from that there's a lame season pass,not very rewarding for playing free, but oh well HiRez gotta make some cash after all.
In conclusion Paladins is a unique multiplayer experience for what it is and refreshing to jump back after your typical battle royale session.Give it some love it's completely free after all ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

Hi-Rez used to be a decent enough company.  I was thrilled to see someone picking up on the 'Tribes' FPS line and Hi-Rez came out with Tribes Ascend; a decent rendition of a classic with as much fealty to the original game as one could imagine.  However,  after playing Paladins for more than a year, it become woefully apparent that the leadership and management of this company veered sharply away from producing quality gaming but rather diving into the realm of woke politics.  I simply don't care to support a company that treads into the miasma of virtue signaling, woke-ness, and the quagmire of gender politics.  Gaming should be devoid of these elements, and to do otherwise is both divisive and ostracizes a good percentage of people/players that just want to frag another hapless victim online.  Perhaps should Hi-Rez renounce these futile platitudes, I could see myself once again enjoying the games they have and would produce in the future.  Until then, stay out of politics.

I have played since open beta (over 2k hours total) and I can say that all this time game was only degrading. Graphics was made more and more cartoonish. Most of the characters are already so nerfed that there are barely enough playable characters in the ranked for 2 teams - it's almost impossible to see some kind of variety. On the one hand, almost all maps have been graphically updated recently, but some have become less functional, some have been removed from the ranked. Matchmaking always was s h i t - people with difference in ranks about 10 divisions can appear in one team (In ranked), Account level is also used in matchmaking now: High-level players stand in a queue (in ranked) about 1-2 minutes and low-level ones - about 7-15 (match itself  can be short er than queue). A few words about in game currency: It's time to carry out the denomination. Old players have millions and new players will need a lot of time to unlock all characters if they play for free. And the last blob that overwhelmed my patience and made me write this review - an unacceptable ban policy based on user reports: anyone can be banned based on user reports, for example, reports for AFK or feeding. (without doing anything, just because there always will be a certain number of trolls who will report you to a low score), while the support essentially does not answer anything and then stops responding at all. Previously, I sometimes donated for skins (they are sometimes quite good), but after such a boorish attitude I will never pay a cent in the games of these developers again. I can't recommend this game to anyone.
