Okay I think after 700+ hours of this game i could say something.
To be honest- the game is good, it's really fun.
The only problem is the balancing of the champions, a few bigger bugs that are- "popular"(With that i mean that almost every player knows this one bug, that destroyes the game exept you know what to do so you don't get that bug)
Anyways, one of the problems still is the community, one part are really really nice player, the other side are... toxic player that only watch on the kill count(How many kills you did) in my opinion as a healer or a tank you get told that you are so bad (Only if you are with toxic people obviously xD) and that you don't heal anyone, even if you do you get that told many times.
As a new player you really only can hope that you get nice player, but as i said not everyone is like that.
One good thing, if you are completely new(Lvl 0 and a bit more i think) you will automatically play training matches for a few rounds(Means you play against bots)
But besides that it makes fun(I know i repeat myself very often xD)
Btw, don't get too involved with spending money on this game, it's like an addiction. (But you don't have anything from this, you know skins, emotes, sprays, that's all)
Soo, if i recommend it:
-If you can handle toxic player, yes
-If you can't handle toxic player, more a no, it's the best if you ask a friend to play with you and explore it with them, so you at least have one person that supports you and helps you get into the game and says what you can change on your way to play this champion and stuff.

But don't forget, this is only my experience, so if you play it, it may be a different experience!

Alright, let me get this straight. I LIKE and play Paladins but I DON'T recommend it to other new players in its current state. Let me explain. 

The problem this game faces is the failure of gaining any sort of traction. In 2016, the game came out of alpha and went into beta. This was a significant leap for Hi-Rez Studio because it was finally getting recognised by the media. The problem is this...Overwatch came out the same year. Of course, Overwatch's high resolution graphics was more desired than Paladin's  graphics resolution that looked like it was from 2012.  Due to Overwatch's overwhelming popularity, all of the achievements and milestones made by the Hi-Rez Studio got trampled over and Paladin's player base decreased significantly day after day. 

So what do they do? 

They started introducing champions like there was no yesterday. 

Now technically this would not be a problem if they had balanced champions as the new one come out, even the one that got introduced...but they did not balance anything. Hold on. Let me correct myself; its not that they did not balance anything is just the things they change is either irrelevant to the current "unbalance" or they make it even more unbalanced. Im just not talking about skill-wise; for all the people that say "Oh, your just bad at the game and therefore you blame it on the game". I WISH that it was that easy. Wait until you have met with a squad of 2 Hard Tanks that have "infinite health" and you would agree with me. 


 It is so blatantly obvious that Hi-Rez is competing with Overwatch with "who can introduce a new champion the fastest?" and this was what devastated Paladins. The balance of the game is so overthrown now (due to the lack of balancing) , the game is barely playable. If you met with a squad of Viktor, Yagorath, Raum, Dredge, Maeve, you would absolutely get destroyed. No questions asked. 

This is not even my opinion, Paladins itself is self-aware of this fact as they bans unbalanced champions  from ranked matches...on the day I learnt this, I was absolutely shell-shocked. 

Even now, in 2021, Hi-Rez have not changed a single thing about its strategy of combating against competition. In this 9 months alone, they  introduced 4 new champions. That might not seem like a lot but in the case of not balancing the game, suddenly it seems that they hold the game's fate in their hands. 

The second major problem of this game beside balancing is Hi-Rez Studio itself. Let me give you a few example: in 2019, they introduced Realm Royale, in response to the  popularity of  Fortnite but that game died in 3 months. This year, they introduced Rogue Company, in response to the popularity Valorant. You see the problem here? They abandoned the game that people loved and would have played if it was WORKED on, and instead they chose to follow the trend. Most of the dedicated players in Paladins would have supported Hi-Rez if the game shut downed for 1 year to work on its balance and overall mechanics. Look at it. The players are screaming at the creators for help but instead the creators chose to not listen and decided to abandon the game that they worked on for 4 years. 

It is so disappointing, as beta players like myself, see the game that have so much potential gets wasted away. See the game that I once loved gets abandoned by its creators. There is very little hope I have for this game to get better. I guess Hi-Rez is just waiting for this game to die out and shut down the servers and work on their next victim. 

(Edit: I went and looked at other people's POSITIVE reviews (cause Im still very surprised that this game is getting majority "very positive" for reviews on steam. 

And I have to say this: NO OFFENCE to anybody but it seems like people forgive this game's bugs and developers' laziness just because this is a free game. THIS is not a valid excuse nor is it a good one...no developers should be forgiven for their laziness and greed just because it is free; in fact the opposite should be true. The  developers for free games should aim to work HARDER then paid games to stomp on the idea of MONEY is EVERYTHING and if the game does not have funds, it will be stupidly bad. (I know this is easier said then done, but with enough passion, this can work [I am fully aware of bankruptcy and economic issues, but passion is what I believe in. ]). Anyways, thats all I have to say for the positive reviews that says the game is good cause its "free".)

While the base game is amazing, the experience is marred by frequent obvious cheating (people spamming ults with little to no cooldown) and matches that are lost because toxic community members love to start arguments with each other. It's a shame because the game itself is excellent.

Let's keep this simple, people are comparing this to Overwatch for good reason. So let's do that;

- Paladins has better team diversity then Overwatch.
- Paladins has a better gameloop and progression system then Overwatch.
- Paladins is more forgiving and casual then Overwatch.
- Maps in Paladins are more balanced and fair to both teams then Overwatch.

but there are things that are not so great with Paladins:
- Overwatch has a better custom game system then Paladins.
- Overwatch is better looking and more polished as a whole then Paladins.
- Overwatch has few to no bugs compared to the buggy-ness of Paladins.
- If you are looking for heart-stopping, Butt puckering and Blood for sweat type of gameplay then Overwatch is more competitive then Paladins.

Most people play games for fun, to get enjoyment out of it. To some people this is to become the best at something, for others it's just killing people in a match and then there are some that just want casual fun and do not care if they win or loose and just want a game that gives them some sense of progression.

Overall I think that Paladins is the better game. It's free to play and you don't have to spend one cent to get into the action. You can play to earn gold that you can use to unlock other champions, or if you want to cut to the chase you can buy a DLC and unlock all of them, which makes gold earning almost useless. You unlock talents for the heroes you play and if you hit lvl 50 you unlock a special gold skin for your champion to show off. It has bugs and it doesn't do so well in the custom game/settings department but that is a trade off. It's your choice in what you believe matters more.

In Overwatch you get all the heroes and there are less of them. They will always play the same and the maps are highly focussed towards the defending team (as they spawn at the point the enemy team must push towards). Unlocking skins for both games is the same, spend real money and buy a crate that gives you random stuff.

Anyway.. They are similar in many ways and it's up to you what you like more. Either go for a smooth game experience, nice graphics and highly competitive OR go for a better gameloop, champion progression and more enjoyable/casual game sessions.

. The characters all feel fun and useful. Even champions that are old can still very much so hold their weight.

TLDR: Game is fun, in my opinion it's better than Overwatch, and it's got my recommendation.

Before i say anything else, disclaimer, im a firm believer that the way you monetize your game is as much part of the game as is gameplay or aesthetics. If you dont think so and you want to disregard this review because of it, be my guess.

What can i say about this game, thatll not trigger at least some of the people playing it, who for some reason still cares about steam reviews? probably nothing. Its pretty much a game that does a lot of things other games do, but masters none of it. 
Gameplay is your typical hero shooter with the emphasis on teamwork and Overwatch style 5v5 pvp consisting of all your favourite roles. Champions, or Heroes, whatever you want to call them, are all about quantity over quality compared to other similar games, having a lot more of them but having half the dedication and quality of a character from OW for example.
Regular game modes consists of onslaught, witch is a King Of The Hill type of mode with a point that the teams need to hold to get points, Team deathmatch, witch is a total waste of time and Siege, witch is a mix between Onslaught and Payload (pls bring normal payload back).

Business model and monetization, the thing everyone wants to complain about but no ones wants to hear others to do so.
Main source of in game purchases, that the game has are in both character customization and in buying Champions, so that you can use them whenever you want without having to rely on the character rotation, thats taken straight out of League Of Legends. 
If youre the type of person, who loves to have their character look apart, but don't want to blow money on a game like this, i recommend not to get too into it as even getting the basic skins (that are usually very underwhelming) are a big grind away to access.
Most good looking skins and other types of customization are locked as being either limited or exclusive, making them unable to be obtained, unless during very special limited times and i have a feeling, that i talk on behalf of most people, when i say that i will not wait for the devs to finally put the skin i want into a box so that i can spend money on maybe getting it, i will go play games that actually let me get the stuff i want.

In conclusion, if you want to just play a free2play overwatch/league inspiration and don't mind the grind or the lackluster gameplay, or even dont have money and want to spend few hours messing in a free2play game, more power to you. But if you want a serious team shooter experience or have an impulsive personality towards micro transactions like this, i don't recommend as there are many better alternatives out there, even if it means spending some money up front.

Alright, so lets start off with this.

Clearly, I haven't played the game too long, but I'll give my honest opinion on it. Which is, it isn't necessarily bad, but is made bad by some stupid designs and horrible matchmaking.

So, I'll start off with the matchmaking. It is so clearly random. I've just started playing the game and as soon as I'm out of the training lobbies I'm immediately matched against people who have been playing the game for 500ish hours. Literally the meaning of unfair matchmaking.

Second is champion design. Some of them are really cool and unique, others are just straight up stupid and broken. The health-damage scale doesn't help either and some champions feel straight up broken. All in all, would love to play the game, but it's broken,  honestly it reminds me of League of Legends' horrible balance.

It's not terrible but there're way to many "CoD" champs. Basically the game is riddled  with characters whose sole meta is shooting people. They don't require any thought or serve any niche role, they just wander about the map and shoot people. These characters are easy to beat but they're boring to play against. One chick just shoots people and she also has a shield, ohhhhohohohohoho crazy right? These characters add nothing to the game and I roll my eyes every time they get picked. However, this also represents what I like about the game. There is a decent level of variety in the roster and I never feel like I need to play a certain character. Everyone is fun in their own way and even if I don't like them personally I like knowing I have that option.  

The game does have some balance issues. Healing can sometimes be irritating as some characters don't have the damage potential to outdo it. Stuff like this forces you to build a character into a specific way. The whole point of giving the player the ability to build a playstyle is to give them control and to add depth to the game. This is lost when you need to buy the same item every game just to be effective.

Ultimately this is a casual overwatch. Faster paced with a bigger focus on killing shit. Maps are smaller, at least they feel small. I've seen complaints about unlocking champs but I've only got like 20 hours in so far and have managed to unlock about 7 champs so I have no clue why they're pissed.

The micro-transactions are unobtrusive but dated. For some reason they still use the idiotic seasonal stores. If I want a skin I should just be able to buy it, no one is gonna be like "oh I can only get this skin during christian Hanukkah? I better play until then". Let the whales buy their skins. 

It's free so definitely give it ago.

But, the game is poorly balanced... Actually "#balance" is unknown term in there... Some characters are still broken as they always been, and worse characters are still... well.. worse. Making the game more frustrating than enjoyable experience, if your favourite character is most likely Tier-Trash.

Didn't play Overwatch, and probably won't. Because im not gonna support controversional developers/publishers, but Overwatch is most likely better balanced game gameplay wise. 

PS: Honestly i would love to give neutral rating, but there's either Yes/No in terms of recommendation on steam.

Paladins is a team-based fantasy shooter in which you fight against your opponents in the style of a multiplayer online arena - for free!

Many are of the opinion that Paladins is just "poor man's Overwatch", but while playing the action-packed moba shooter I realized that this view has no substance. The style and skills of the champions can easily be chosen and adapted by the different maps, which makes the champion equipped for every imaginable game situation. You can play Paladins super alone but of course also with your friends thanks to crossplay, which made it even more fun for me. Exciting matches and funny situations are on the agenda and make the time you spend in the game entertaining and really draw you in. 

Due to the fact that it is free, there is no reason not to give the game a chance. Try it out and believe me - you will love it.

~ Luca | qodly

It's basically overwatch except:

Movement displacement abilities - in overwatch every 2nd hero has a bump or a boop to mess up your aim, sometimes multiple boops from one source in under a second, paladins has so few of them I think it's maybe under 5?
Smurfing doesn't work / isnt attractive - your first few games shoot you up so quickly in elo that you're about where you need to be after around 10-20 games, also you have to buy heros with gold so losing your progress sucks and makes smurfing undesirable to do in the first place.
Supports are just DPS who can heal - they throw out their heal abilities in a nano second and go back to dps, you don't need to sit there focusing on the job of healing 100% of the time.
You can mitigate CC - you hate CC? just buy an item that reduces its effectiveness, YAY have fun in the game again
There's no bullshit situations where you just lose your ultimate - if your ultimate doesn't get all the way out you keep the cooldown
Information - there's so much more information/statistics/analytics available on matches compared to overwatch
Stale 2/2/2 meta - Paladins lets you have the freedom to make any team comp you want unlike overwatch
There's more than one way to play a champion - In overwatch you pick you hero and thats it, there's nothing further to think about, its braindead. Paladins gives you options, there are so many avenues to refine your build or match a heroes kit to your playstyle.

Been playing this since open beta on different accounts and on console (around 200+ hours altogether). Despite having quite a few negatives, I still LOVE the game nonetheless. Here are some thoughts:

Positives:
- SERIS (top waifu)
- Great variety of champions. This is what makes it way better than Overwatch and other games in the genre. There's one for everyone. Hi-Rez makes them really well too and they haven't stopped releasing new ones since the beginning.
- Combat mechanics, abilities and ults are all very nicely done.
- This game has the leggiest female champions in all team based games I swear to god lmao
- Quite addicting (which means they do a lot of things right).

Negatives:
- The lore is ONE HOT MESS. No one knows what the fuck is going on anymore. Take it from me who's been there since the beginning lol.
- Matchmaking is a bitch. Say you're on a roll for 6 games, being matched with equally skilled and level players then next thing you know you're on a red wall because you keep being paired with players who barely know how their champions work and then the enemy team has 2-3 lvl 100+ champions. Pretty unbalanced. If I did a push up every time I had to carry in Siege I'd be The Rock right now.  
- Queuing for ranked takes you at least more than 30 minutes. IT SUCKS
- Lack of game modes. It's the same shit for years now. TDM, Siege and Onslaught.
- Graphics aren't bad but it hasn't improved since open beta. A little upgrade would be nice.
- UI kinda sucks imo. They also took out player of the match.

Perfect game to play casually for many reasons:

 -No game breaking patches or reworks (LoL style), the game is still played the same as it was when released
 -This game actually still releases new content and is free while OW is not free and we'll need to pay to get OW2
 -a team composition of 1 Tank, 1 Heal, 3 DPS is accepted and means that I am less often forced to play Tank or Heal compared to OW
 -Gameplay of the same character can vary depending on your build (Some support characters can be played as DPS)
 -A lot of people actually play the game like I do (for fun) unlike OW where everyone is so sweaty
 -There are more possibilities to explore the gameplay than OW if you are willing to try out new decks/characters. There are many.
 -Games last approximately 15 mins and are much faster if the game is one-sided
 -Win 50% of the time (Unlike battle royales)
 -Making a comeback in a game is possible and incredibly satisfying
 -The learning curve is great. Easy for starters, one can always improve on details but won't gain a too overwhelming advantage over noobs (okey I'll admit some flank characters require more time than the others)
 -I commend my teammates more often than I report them
 -Female characters are thicc ;)

Imagine a world where you could play a competitive MOBA-like shooter, focused on team play and objectives, as well as characters with unique skills that set them apart from just being "tank" or "healer" archetypes. 
Imagine that the year is 2015, and your model is based on Smite. You're a year away from having your concept stolen by Blizzard, the masters of sexual harassment and assault.

Now imagine it being fun. It's crazy, I know - but trust me, this one is actually fun unlike the sexual harassment company's copycat. Now I can hear you screaming at me "How could this one be fun if Lawsuitwatch isn't!?" at the top of your lungs - let me explain.

In the lawsuit company's game, once you pick a role you are firmly stuck in that role - if you're a healer, you are a healer. You generally speaking don't have the ability to dunk on a flank player because your bones are hollow and your only offensive tool is to scream for help. Paladins however allows you to actually fight back, with decent effect - even if you're a tank, if you're good you can actually defend yourself from a flanker! There's also more variety here, among both characters and game-modes as well as maps.

The design is charming, the graphics look pretty darn great (though the game shows its age in some areas) but most importantly, there's always new content being made - be it skins, maps or small events, this game continues to deliver even 6 years later. 

Best of all? It's free. As it should be. The shooter MOBA concept (or the MOBA-lite genre in general, if you include Smite, the original third person MOBA-lite shooter/brawler) really is only suited for free-to-play models, rather than freemium games with a 60 dollar pricetag.

If you're sick of supporting the sexual assault company, give this a try. It's free to try and who knows, maybe you'll like it?

Whats up all! Its your boy PhriskoDaGod! Shouts to the OG PS4 community members for Paladins! Yea, i put my big boy shoes on and got a gaming PC lol! RIP Vengeance_7x on PS4. We miss you everyday.

So, I've been playing this game since Closed Alpha on PS4 and for the last 2 to 3 years on PC with a controller (yes with a controller lol) and i have been through all the ups and downs. I love playing this game and i can never see myself ever stopping! Here's why!

Its free, constantly getting new updates and new champions and is very community focused when it comes to the development of the game since the beginning. Its an easy game to pick up and a tough to master. 

As a new player, you need to understand that this game is all about learning roles along with learning the ins and outs of each champions kit. Rule of thumb is that you want to learn at least 2 roles with 3 champions in each role. Most new players jump into playing as a Damage or Flank champion so do yourself a favor and try to learn Frontline and Support first. At lower levels, its hard to find good tanks and supports because people just wanna shoot things without understanding that this game has MOBA elements. Learning to fill any role is the best choice, but focus 2 first.

You'll be playing against bots until you hit level 5 so don't go thinking you're amazing at the game and everyone is bad lol. Familiarize yourself with a few champs and save your gold to buy meta champs if you plan on going into ranked. if not, buy whatever champs you want really lol. But you might find yourself getting into the game and being upset at yourself for buying a champ because she had big boobs or hes just so handsome. To be, or not to be a Simp. Thats your call lol

The game also has a bit of lore for those that are into that. I'm not. Quite frankly i never gave a crap about lore lol. Its a fps to me at the end of the day. I enjoy applying the fps and Moba skills and kicking butt!

One of the major drawbacks to this game is how buggy it has always been! Its not as bad as it was in the beginning but its a free game by a company that pales in financial resource compared to the likes of Blizzard or Activision. For the bit of bugs it suffers from over the years, it remains a fun game worthy of you time and effort if it brings you joy to play!

Also, this community can be toxic in Ranked so, don't rush getting into ranked. Have fun and learn the game, learn your roles and if you think you can contribute to the ranked community, go for it! but you have been warned about the toxic environment it may be at times. Working as a team and playing your roles and champion well eliminates that. Go into ranked without knowing your roles or champions will get you in a lot of drama. Don't be that guy that last picks a champ we didn't need.

This game is a pretty cool hero shooter. It'll provide a fun time for anyone looking for a f2p Overwatch substitute, but even on its own this game is still great. There are lots of heroes to play around with and have fun. You get to personalize your playstyle with loadouts that you can make with cards. These loadouts will augment the characters abilities according to how string you want them. The game also has a lot of f2p bullshit, and its kinda buggy, and it's not that well balanced. However, those are only going to be problems if you take it seriously. As much as I enjoy playing this game, I can't blindly defend some of the problems with this game, but I do ask that if you can overlook these issues then Paladins can be a lot of fun.

Pros:
 - As I've already said there is a lot of fun to be had with this game. A lot of the characters can be really fun to play with and even characters that I've found annoying to play, can still be satisfying to use against noobs and people who don't understand how to fight against those characters.
 - There are fun costumes and stuff to play and use that, in my exp, made my mains stand out more and fit their personalities very well. You ofc get sprays and emotes, that can also be satisfying to taunt people with. 
 - The gameplay: I mostly get into siege games. I rarely get to play other game modes, which is kind of a shame because the other game modes can be really fun. Except for Team Deathmatch (its so dumb). But I'm not upset about that because siege games are still fun, unless you get incompetent team mates. I can't really talk to much about what this game's competitive scene and the meta are like since I mostly play casually, but I have spent over 400 hours in total playing this game (played it on my switch) so I think that counts for something.

Stuff thats ok:
 - The visuals are neat, but kinda like the art style a bit.
 - The music is fine.
 - The characters, story, and lore is also fine. Maybe a bit generic for some people.

Cons:
 - As I already said, the only problems is just the fact that the game has all the f2p bullshit (no p2w stuff right now). MTX, Lootboxes, it also has a Battle Pass and other things you can purchase. It's a fucking buffet of greedy bullshit. If I had one recommendation, I would say to not take the game seriously. Its fun to play, but don't feel like you have to buy stuff to look cool online. If you pull off a cool play, people [b] will [/b] notice you.
 - And also its a bit buggy sometimes. I've not encountered anything gamebreaking while playing, but some other people have.

TLDR: The game's fun. I recommend it. Don't take the game too seriously, just play it to have fun and its free so there's no reason to not try it out, unless you want to avoid the f2p stuff.

I've spent hundreds of hours on this game between Playstation and Steam. A lot of people, myself included, have called this the Overwatch clone. In a way, it is, but I also think in some ways it's better. It's free, so that's already a plus. From a morale stand-point Hi-Rez has a better reputation if that's something you consider when playing a game. The community is not quite as toxic or competitive at least in ways like bashing you over voice chat or text. I'm not saying it doesn't happen, PvP games bring out the best, and worst, in everyone. Hi-Rez does a lot of interacting with the community through Discord and Twitch, and that's something I appreciate.

One of the most unique features, one that separates it from Overwatch and improves upon the formula is the cards. You can create your own style of fighter based on your cards and their allocated points. It adds a layer of customization and also generates so many varieties of the heroes, really allowing you to make it just how you want.

For me this game is always going to have a special place because it brought my friends and I together a lot. We'd group up, sometimes having a whole team, and just spend the whole night playing. A lot of laughs and good memories were made playing this.

It's a game that I'm always going to have in my library, even if I don't play it as often these days. When I get the itch to play a pure PvP game this is the one I queue up.

Tons of bugs, disconnecting during matches making it hard to play in a group, though it's still far worse to play solo. Typical in game culture that's rather negative and mean-spirited, can't honestly say I have fun more often than not. Heavy pushing of microtransactions to the detriment of functionality, and a lot of artificial complexity in terms of loadouts giving the illusion of customization that will routinely get rebalanced, so your two options are either sink hundreds of hours into repeatedly becoming competent at a free to play game that could at any moment change/be shut down, or just follow recommended buildouts and lobotomize any involvement you have in the game beyond following instructions.

All in all, I would just recommend playing a different game if you have an option that your other friends are willing to play.

Just gonna keep it simple :)

- Basically Overwatch but more content (maybe not skins) and RPG elements through loadouts/talents/in-game store
- Free sooo... just download it and try it?
- Game has been through a lot of rough stages and highlights through the years but it is now fairly consistent in quality/gameplay
- Gameplay is good w/ lots of champions, customizable loadouts, and map variety
- Combat is good but hitboxes are large and misleading, especially during fast movements (dashes, teleports, etc)
- Balance is more consistent now with few to no outliers. However, ranked meta evolves every update (every 2 months) and usually isn't too stale.
- Matchmaking is very inconsistent depending on individual performance and how many people are playing at that time. Sometimes I get amazing matches that last 30 minutes and then other times it ends faster than the queue time :)
- Queue time can be fast (0-2 mins) but when it's late, it can become closer to 3-5 mins)
- Servers can randomly turn to dogshit but sometimes it's good connection

Overall a good game that you can just sit back and play to relax.
Tip: Watch streamers and youtube to get tips

This game is not worth your time as a new player. Find a better game with better devs, better balance, and at least somewhat decent quality assurance.

Most things Paladins release is broken or unfinished which can lead to lengthy times to fix, the refer a friends page has been broken for who knows how long. If Paladins cared about their community, they wouldn't have to shut down their competitive gaming scene.

On the positives, the game can be really fun when you get a good team and has a lot of different characters that can fit anyone's play style.

I do give a recommendation, but with a huge caveat. These kind of games (TF2, Overwatch and the like) often suffer from an overly casual player base with less than stellar teamwork skills (heck, less than stellar skills in general). 

If you intend to really play the game and not just tag along with a bunch of toddlers trying to figure out which way is forward, then i suggest you try to get a few friends together and play as a team, as you won't have much luck with the random matchmaking Paladins offers.

The graphics are serviceable, the heroes offer a good variety in abilites and can be fun to play (I play healers and tanks mostly) when given the chance (i.e. when the team doesn't suffer from wanna-be dps heroes that REALLY should have their eyes checked, and REALLY REALLY actually shouldn't play dps).

So, if your nerves can stand up to the above, give Paladins a try, you just might like it. Just make sure you keep a cup of tea ready to keep calm and carry on.

Cheers

My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.

paladins oh paladins how great and how disappointing you are, i enjoy this game, loads and on a very very basic level this game is better than overwatch, characters are all different from each other bringing a unique and dynamic feel to every match, maps are pretty decent and theres not a single map that i straight up hate which is rare for me and the card system is amazing, it really feels like each and every point you put into every card changes the character incredibly, paired with the perk system i really think it makes the game come alive you can make a character be and feel like so many different things which has the affect as well of seeing multiple different play-styles on the oppositions side.

now lets talk about where it falls short. the game just doesn't have that overall polish that overwatch seems to have, everything just feels that bit more 'clunker' and doesn't have that smooth linear feel which is what i enjoy form overwatch. skins which are mostly attained through monetary means (this game is free though so ill let it slide) leave something to be desired and dont give that 'wow' factor that some games deliver. i dont like that you have to buy characters and level them up to get certain perks as it kinda restricts the game for newer and more casual players but it isnt the end of the world.i would say i do prefer overwatch but that may just be that im better at it 

overall i would defiantly recommend this game, at least just to try plus its free so you really are not losing anything.

I've been playing this game on and off for like 4 or 5 years and I've also been playing Overwatch for around the same amount of time on and off (clocking around 600 hours of match time), those are different games and can't really be compared in my opinion. Paladins used to be a good and somewhat balanced game with its flaws but now everything that made it interesting to play got lost amongst all the negatives.

Awful matchmaking, in itself and due to the fact that no one is playing this game anymore. The ranking system is broken beyond any repair, I've been placed Bronze during almost all of my placement matches yet I end up high Platinum or Diamond after 40-50 games of climbing, meaning the games are completely unbalanced. You get Silver players in Plat/Diamond lobbies, you get fresh accounts in bronze lobbies against Golds/Silvers, you get players with 10 champs unlocked including the free weekly rotation. 4 games out of 5 the outcome is set in stone during draft phase. Also the difference between mouse / keyboard and controller queues is insane, you get Master players with the titles and the frames obtained in easy controller queues that are literally lost when it comes to play with a mouse and keyboard and constantly feed or are unable to aim in Gold games.

Ranked has never been a good experience in Paladins (while not perfect, Overwatch's one is a bit better, but still average). Casual is okay, but here are all the other flaws of the game. The netcode is quite poor, skill shots barely exist, map collisions are buggy af, some techs / ultimates are literally unusable or work once every two moons, the UI is also filled with bugs (win and losses resetting to 0 for no reason then reappearing out of the blue, daily quests not tracking, rank not being displayed, game history with empty charts and such). The reward system is a shell of what it used to be, gold is only used to unlock characters and to buy basic skins, can't get skins even for a lot of in gold money. Skins are to be bought with real money and are in lootboxes so you can't even buy the skin you want. You have to spend some money, open some chests and hope you get the skin you wish. Some of the skins are really good, some of them are totally cringey and aimed at 13-yo anime fans (especially female heroes).

The balance used to be quite good too, with like every game, some overpowered stuff that wasn't that overpowered the higher you'd play. But now, you could strip literally 30 heroes out of the 50 the roster has and you wouldn't see any difference in ranked play. Some supports are literally broken and are mechanically above every other one, some flanks / damage dealers have to be instalocked or banned because you shoot yourself in the foot by not having it in your team. It results in overall boredom because every game feels scripted, you face the same heroes, playing the same talent, and you also know from start if you can win or not, provided the matchmaker does its job and matches you against an equivalent team (which happens rarely).

This game has some qualities : the hero roster (character diversity both in roles and gameplays), the pace (not too fast, not too slow), its easiness to understand (it really has no depth compared to Overwatch), the deck and talent systems allowing for customization and freedom of gameplay, along with enemy team countering. But none of them are good enough any longer to justify investing some time in this game. It's okay for casual intermittent play but that's it. 

TLDR : broken rank system and matchmaking, game is riddled with gameplay, collisions and netcode bugs and is basically a cashgrab unless you're ready to grind for hours or to throw the games because you can't pick a decent hero to counter the enemy team.

It's a game that looks shallow at first but the play styles available across a increasingly huge roster allows for incredible depth. There are point and click heroes with simple kits that can still be played a variety of different ways. When you feel comfortable enough with the item system and the mastery of easier characters the game has a great cast of easy to learn impossible to master champions that have a skill ceiling comparable to any shooter I've ever played. As for negatives the servers can be rough at times to the point of unplayability. Hitboxes can be incredibly forgiving to the point that you will question how you headshot someone you were barely even aiming at to begin with. I feel like this game will forever live in the shadow of more popular hero shooters but it's level design character kits and general game flow is in a league all it's own that deserves more attention.

cons: sometimes I think I'm playing against bots (generic names and not that great at the game), I've played for 2 hours and no one used voice chat ( I had to check to see if it was enabled), the game gets kind of repetitive 


pros: decent production value for the game, unique characters with good looking skins, it's fun for a minute

On balance I'd recommend this, but here are some positives and negatives.

Pros:  Fun hero based shooter, very similar to Overwatch in style.  The character designs are usually pretty good, some are quite interesting some a bit generic, but most feel like they have their own style.  The game is fairly populated, so match queues (as long as you select all game mods) aren't terribly long.  3 different standard game types (point push, team deathmatch, king of the hill) which gives the game some variety.

Cons:  There is some cheating; it doesn't appear to be as prevalent as it used to be but I've ran into at least 2 people running hacks in the last few days.  While not as bad as some games, the userbase can be very toxic at times.  The fast paced gameplay usually mitigates that, but it's not uncommon to see.  Some of the game balancing is very poor, and the development seems to be more geared towards putting out new characters than balancing the game.  It's not uncommon for quests to be implemented with bugs - this oddly seems to impact quests that provide currency rewards more often than others.  Fixes for these issues are not swift.  The netcode is rather mediocre - it is not uncommon to die when running away after fully being behind a wall.  It's not bad enough to be a deal breaker, but it is notable (and very annoying) from time to time.

Cash Shop: Most skins and cosmetics are behind (quite expensive) gatcha style chests.  If you have a single skin you want, you can't just buy that skin but have to buy chests that have a dozen to several dozen other possibilities.  As such, unless you're planning on whaling you likely won't get cosmetics that you want.  There are some side systems to gain special cosmetics, but they're generally poorly implemented to the point of irrelevance. 

On balance the game is pretty fun, and scratches the itch for that Overwatch style game.  I can't say I like some of the development choices or the cash shop design very much, but as the game is free it's hard to complain too much about that.  It's not nearly as polished or graphically impressive as Overwatch or other AAA caliber games, but it looks and plays quite well and is worth a shot if you're looking for a nice fast paced shooter.

[h1] My Impression [/h1]
I just recently liked to play something similiar like Overwatch and I thought to give Paladins a chance. Gameplay is exactly what I want. Everything fits nicely. It does have different features compared to Overwatch. Each Champion has its own unique playstyle. Additionally you can further customize your Loadout/the Skillset with Skill Cards, which are immediately provided as soon as you acquire the Champion. There are Items, which also adds more depth to customization during the Matches. Paladins has more customization, whereas Overwatch is just simply "pick a Champ and go". The decision making in Paladin in consideration to what Loadout and Items you buy is detrimental to your groups Strategies. I love it. I prefer games like this, where you need to figure out about the champion you play to understand its playstyle.

[h2]Results:[/h2]
After that said, as much as I like the game, I unfortunately cannot bring over my Heart to recommend it to anyone.


[b] There are several Points that completely shatters the enjoyment for this game:[/b]
[list]
[*] constant disconnects for me / other players when the game starts
[*] micro stuttering (i couldn't figure out if it concerns the connection or just bad coding)
[*] massive Lag Spikes, I already tried swichting regions just to see if there are any changes (there are many reports about it on reddit, discord, or just online and there are no solutions to this issue).
[*] all above issues just leads to a low player pool. I tried playing Ranked Games and I would need to wait at least more than +10 Minutes until a game has been found.
[/list]

So attempting to be as reasonable as I can, here is a list of reasons I wouldn't recommend this game outright to anyone who is hoping to get a great experience from a free-to-play spin-off of Overwatch.

-The community is becoming increasingly toxic. Ultimately this stood as the primary cause for me to no longer indulge in this game - even occasionally - anymore. Honestly I have encountered many toxic people throughout my gaming life and I typically try to only play games with an emphasis on PvE and Co-operation. But this game takes the cake for a community experience I could no longer stomach, it literally started to make me physically sick and I felt myself becoming toxic to others. So, if ever I was cruel to anyone on this game for any reason, I apologize. But I digress, there were occasions where the matches were hard fought and the post game lobbies were filled with great feed back and respect for both the victors and the runners up as it felt like no one really outright "won" the match. But alas those occasions became too few and the toxicity began to reign over even matches where ones team managed a close win. So moving on.
-Patches fix some things and break others forever in a struggle to find balance amidst the imbalance.
-It is a free to play game, that being said naturally the cartoon aesthetic and ease of access draws a great number of people who want a casual experience. Which is completely fine. However I found towards the end of my time with this game (And I'm not certain the former is is the reason) People would frequently go afk without any real heads up or comment. Which again, is fine. But it became so prevalent it was hard not to feel the punishing impact of losing a teams healer or tank to (at times) several minuets of inactivity, sometimes in the midst of contesting the point or other meaningful engagements. And with such frequency it made one question ones commitment to winning. Once happened in 6 back to back games where we had someone go afk in the spawn or in the middle of a clash with the other team for more then a minute. So needless to say I logged off that session feeling drained and questioning my ability to derive enjoyment from something others just queue up and log off of or go and make a heartwarming cup of tea (fair to assume?) in the middle of.
-Bugs are abundant and have manifested in (but not limited to) key bindings randomly just unbinding despite the key binding menu showing abilities are in fact bound to the appropriate key. To be fair if can be easily fixed but in tight rounds where the littlest mistake can throw the game, it's a pain. Not to mention sometimes the keys unbind themselves mid match. But mostly I'll log on get into a match and find out my key bindings aren't functioning in the spawn before the match starts. No harm, no foul. 
-Abilities occasionally break at random and don't act right. For instance I was once silenced by Torvald for the last minute and half of a close match with the duration meter showing no duration for the ability's effect, which it normally does (Hacking perhaps?). On another occasion I initiated Grohk's special which should have sent the hero into a floating frenzy of buffing nearby friendlies and debuffing and inflicting minor damage to nearby opponents and instead (much to my chagrin) Grohk stuck to the ground without moving and I was easily eliminated.   
-Players tend to disruptively spam voice chat when they feel someone isn't doing what they expect (For example when they feel the healer isn't healing them specifically.*collective sigh*)
-Team composition is frequently irrelevant to some players resulting in unfair advantages for the opposing team if they have a more rounded team. Which isn't always necessary if the team itself is just loaded with talent.
-Match making is seemingly so inefficient that I have regularly spent weeks winning against opponents who are easily pushed into their spawn and there they exist for the entire match. And other times I have spent weeks winning 1 in every 10 matches. Consistently. Over and Over again, which consequently seems to bring out the most toxic of qualities of ones team mates. Like sitting in the spawn and refusing to do anything in the chat because they feel everyone is inferior to their next level talent. *Oof*
-Lastly it seems the development team struggles to effectively integrate new characters without (sometimes) weeks of unfair exploitation of new characters O.P abilities and builds. Which I will cut them some slack on the principle fact that this is a free-to-play game and they are likely a smaller team trying to fine tune a product that's only revenue is derived from Season Passes and cosmetic items. So I doubt the Q.C department is expansive. Not to mention this isn't their only IP, so I won't hate on them too much for this.

All in all, its worth a try if you're interested. But as a long term investment of ones time, I'd say get a kite, make a salad and eat it or something equally appropriate and healthy because games have been and always will be something one should do for ones enjoyment. I've lost my enjoyment of this game due to the above challenges this game poses. Nearly 500 hrs later, I wish I would have invested my time into something that didn't see me descend to others level of angst and misguided anger over something that should make you feel like perpetuating something other then hate and ridicule. Go pet a kitty, or eat an apple in a meadow, something, anything! Just don't feed into the toxic atmosphere on here or anywhere, this is - sadly - all some people have.
I just wish they focus more on fixing clear gameplay issues like bugs and balance instead of the store but nevertheless the game is awesome, you can easily spend lots of hours having fun.

Balancing, poor QOL, and bad management. 

Balancing: Champions all fill a very specific niche. That being said, your choice of champion is locked in during the duration of a game, but, that's where cards and items come in, to fill potential niches by giving small and large buffs to specific mechanics. This quickly becomes irrelevant when the meta is quite strictly defined by what cards you're running and what items you buy in the duration of a match. Additionally, the champion ultimate abilities are all insanely good or insanely bad; example: Drogos' ultimate has him fly through the air at a high speed, instantly killing the first person he collides with, regardless of health, damage resistance or shield amount, while Octavia's ultimate is a bunch of random moderately-sized beams that maybe deal 1/3 of an enemies health and are incredibly easy to avoid (I can only recall one time I was ever hit by one, and that was because the ultimate is generally so bad, it doesn't even matter that it does hit you, so I didn't bother avoiding them). The teams you get put on are usually either getting demolished by the enemy team, or stomping the enemy team so hard they don't even leave the spawn room, with very few in-between.

QOL: There are certain systems in the game that just feel tedious to use, despite everything being relatively simple. I would also like to extend this to the design of certain aspects that just make them unnecessarily annoying and/or hard to work around: a notable one that comes to mind is a broken pillar in the spawn room on Frog Isle, you have about a 20% chance to spawn behind it and get stuck for a moment, while you are taking a second to realize you got stuck in the first place. Some collision is outright bad, like when you'll get caught on a random corner that didn't appear to have any texture there; there's a massive boulder on Jaguar Falls where exactly that happens. Copy & paste doesn't work in chat boxes (presumably to combat bad formatting, but the chat system so annoying to use in the first place, IDK why anyone would bother).

Bad management: The community will want something, and the developers will add something completely different. *You want classic Siege? You get another Siege gamemode except we add something new to it every once in a while. You want champions with new designs? Here's another incredibly edgy guy with a generic gun... BUT WAIT, he can CHANGE HIS FIRING MODES.* While the game is seeing regular updates and new content, the regular updates barely change anything, and the new content is rather lackluster or uninspired. It's clear that what they're putting out in terms of actual gameplay is rushed at best, but often nonexistent, and skins are a higher priority. I want there to be more Limited Time Modes, because they bring a new take to the gameplay and strategies involved, but, like the name implies, they're rarely around. Anything to work with that would genuinely change the flow of the game as much as Limited Time Modes or the ancient PVE modes would be a very good thing to have, even if they're only implemented as Custom Games players have to host (maybe it will finally be used for something other than mechanic testing).

Regrettably, I can't stop playing this game and occasionally spending money on it. It may be an annoying game to play, but its the only semi-modern game that retains some level of replayability, even if that level is low.

An update: I have a new system, and it seems like some "stars-aligned" issue popped up that's such a specific combination of this computer, Windows, and this game that causes mouse inputs to completely blank out for seconds at random periods of times. It's not a mouse issue, since it persists between different mice, it's not an input issue, as the keyboard still works, it's not an USB issue, as controllers still work, and it's not a hardware issue, as it doesn't happen in other games. It could only reasonably be an issue with this game or its interaction with Windows, or those two also combined with the hardware. TL;DR; I see no reason not to try it.

Overwatch, but;

- Fun
- Free*
- Buggy**
- Less competitive***
- Less polished
- Less precision
- Worse physics
- More of a moba
- Booba+

(*)  F2P , still need to unlock heroes, but its extremely easy to do so . Just as you feel like you wanna try another champ, you have enough gold for it. Also can unlock them for a reasonable price. Lets not forget the hero rotations.
(**) I am not saying Overwatch is a bug free game, just look at Doomfist bug list, but this game takes the concept of a buggy game to a whole other level. Some things you see in this game  makes you question certain things about the whole development process, I will leave it at that.
(***) When you first start the game, it all feels like a generic dumbed-down fps game with its colossal hit-boxes, sluggy physics and seemingly OP and forgiving mechanics. But there is actually a lot more depth then it looks to this game, unfortunately, all for the wrong reasons. The skill cap of this game look like overcoming the things I mentioned above. You need to be extremely fast, elusive and accurate at the same time while maintaining game sense, one small mistake means you are dead cuz its extremely hard to actually miss your shots, again for the same reasons mentioned. To me its not worth trying to master set of skills that  translate minimally to other games just cuz devs visioned the game as something that everybody can feel like they are good at.

Even though I own overwatch as well, I would say I often prefer Paladins. The fantasy-esque setting of paladins is more in line with my style than the near-future modern setting of overwatch. I also prefer the hero roster of paladins over overwatch, especially since I main support (the selection of support characters in paladins is better in my opinion. I will say that it lacks some important features that overwatch has, like specific role-queueing, and I don't love how you have to unlock all the characters seperately (as opposed to overwatch, which has all the characters playable from the beginning), but I understand why, as its a free game and they need to have some way of making money, but I have to restate that this is A Free Game. I would even go so far as to say that its not even pay-to-win, as you can unlock ALL the characters through in-game currency. Overall, I would say that I prefer this game to overwatch, and I would like to see the game continue to grow. I can honestly say that I would have absolutely paid for this game, and will likely be spending some of my hard-earned cash to unlock all the characters in order to support the creators (despite the fact that I'm loyal to my main, Ying). 

My advice to you, dear reader, is to invest some time into the game, and see for yourself what makes It a game able to equal--and in my opinion, exceed--overwatch. Try not to let the occasional glitch or lag get you down, and take my word that you may have found what you're looking for if you dont want to empty your wallet for overwatch. I acknowledge that this game might not be for everyone, but if you like the Hero-Shooter formula, I couldn't recommend it higher. And if you're new to the genre, I wish you luck on your journey.

I liked the idea of Overwatch, but I really thought the balance team worked at the player's expense. I also think the way that Overwatch was implemented was really poorly thought out with their laning system or how ults and their ability guarantee removal would really cause the games to be sloppy.

Paladins offers a much better balance, core gameplay, and map planning at the expense of some EXTREMELY buggy client architecture and specific game mechanics. I love playing this game, and I can play it comfortably solo. I'd say the best way to enjoy it is with a group of 3+ people for the team of 5. It is rare that a casual game can be ruined just for 1 bad player. Draft pick is very fun in ranked. It's a little hard to come up with builds without netdecking, but other than that the game is in a very healthy place and the devs are very good at tweaking it. I trust their decisions moving forward. Even while it is dripping with jank.

Paladins: Champions of the Realm is a 2018 free-to-play online hero shooter video game by Hi-Rez. The game was developed by Evil Mojo, an internal studio of Hi-Rez and was released on May 8, 2018 for Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 4, and Xbox One, followed by a Nintendo Switch version released on June 12, 2018.

Paladins is a team-based first-person shooter that focuses on two groups of five players each, who compete for combat-based goals. The game is set in colorful sci-fi fantasy maps, where each player chooses a champion that cannot be repeated in the same team and cannot be changed in the match. Each champion has their own weapons, skills and fighting style; in addition, they can be enhanced and personalized from a card and skin system. The interface of each player is very profitable and customizable, with avatars and customizable borders to symbolize the player's profile; titles when reaching mastery level 30 with a champion, among others.

This is one of my favorite shooters. It has lots of content, and more frequent character releases than most competitive games. It offers a great balance between strategy, tactics, and mechanical skill, so none of them feels overwhelmingly strong on it's own. The game is very fun with a premade team or without.

"Why play this game over Overwatch, or another shooter?"
Most shooters including Overwatch have a very large emphasis an mechanical skill. Paladins offers loadouts as well as items you can obtain in-game that offer more levels of play than Overwatch or other shooters offer. I have played pretty much every big shooter on the market, and have put 1,000 hours into Rainbow on PC. I had gotten the highest platinum rank, falling a game short of diamond on console when diamond was the highest rank. My meaning in saying this is that I can play other shooters quite well, but Paladins is easily one of the top shooters I have played.

And as a heads up if you are about to or just created an account: The game will pit you against teams of bots at first, and when I played at least, they did not tell you they were bots. Just don't let your beginning bot matches ruin your experience. If anything, use it as an opportunity to experiment with all the characters you have access to. You will know you aren't fighting bots anymore when you start seeing enemy team toxicity in the endgame screen XD.

Overall, this game is great! I remember playing this game all the time with my dad, and I recently got back into it! Must say, worth the 25 GB download. The characters are all so diverse and unique, each having their own personalities, so they don't just feel like a shell of a character. The abilities are fun to use, and all the characters have their pluses and minuses that balance them out pretty well. Another  great thing, while you can spend money to purchase characters or currencies, you don't have to in order to win. The game lets you stay a F2P as long as you want! Its great. I love it when games don't force micro-transactions down my throat. 

Again, 100% would recommend this game to players looking for a good, team-based FPS game.

Edit: Okay, there are a few broken characters (Yagorath, Raum, Corvus), but they still have counterplay and a few minuses that make them killable.

Edit 2 (2022): I feel like Hi-Rez is currently doing far too much creating and not enough balancing. They need to cool it on the new champions and balance the ones that already exist!

Pros: 
- It's free, and you can get a lot of stuff just by playing.
- Doesn't requiere too much resources, you can run this on a toaster.
- 50+ Champions with different builds, lots of variety.
- The Season Pass events are the absolute best, you can get crystals (the premium coin) just by completing challenges.
- 4 Rotation Champions per-week, so you can try new characters without commiting to buy them.
- Every champion in the game is available for practice mode, rather you have it or not.
- Really cool gameplay, its a shooter in combination with a moba, but has a freestyle flavor to it as well.
- You get benefits by playing on a party with your friends.

Cons:
- Its pretty buggy, they eventually solve them, but there's always a glitch to complaing.
- Ranked mode doesn't allow a full party of 5 people, only 2, this is dumb considering the fact that is a team-based game.
- It has some balance issues.

I'm gonna be using Overwatch as a comparison for this review. This is also gonna be a pretty messy review...I'm not good at reviewing games and stuff and giving a full opinion, especially when comparing it to something, but I'll try my best.

Gameplay:
I know some people might just classify it under "garbage Overwatch copies" but i think it deserves a little more respect than that. Just because it's a first person shooter with playable & unique characters doesn't mean it's a wannabe Overwatch and that it can't be fun. I think the whole concept of an item shop to counter champions and abilities that might be a pain for your team composition is neat and is the reason why I think, as far as gameplay goes, Paladins kinda beats Overwatch. Yes, I'm aware that you can swap heroes in Overwatch to counter the enemy's team composition but I think the item shop is still a better idea than being to swap characters mid-match. In Overwatch, if I even want a chance at winning, I have to swap heroes which means I won't be able to play the character I want to and might even end up playing a character I hate playing as. In Paladins, I can play whoever I want and just buy items instead of having to switch to an entirely different character and playstyle. I feel more freedom in playing a character because of the different loadouts and builds I can make to better fit what I like to play. 

Graphics:
I think this game is a pretty good example of "a game doesn't need good graphics to be enjoyable" and even with that said, the graphics aren't the worst in the world. The graphics reach the perfect point where they're not 11/10 but they're not so garbage that it hurts to look at. I do have a problem with lag, though. Like, severe lag. I don't want to completely blame this on the game because my computer does lag sometimes but it's not as bad as it can get in this game. Sometimes I'll lag back, like, 30 steps backwards. It doesn't happen every match but it's definitely something I want to address because it doesn't get that bad with other games like, well, Overwatch or any other games I play on this same PC.

Small Things:
Characters aren't as iconic looking as Overwatch's roster (with the possible exception of Androxus) but that's kinda forgivable since it's not as big as of a game as Overwatch is/was. I don't really wanna talk about balancing stuff and all that because I'm not really good at determining if something is actually "op" or "game breaking" unless it's painfully obvious that it is, so I'll leave game balance stuff out of this review (unless you want to count the bit about the item shop, but that's up to you). As far as the community goes, aside from a couple of douchebags here and there, I'd say it's not too bad. As a matter of fact, I'd say it's better than Overwatch's community. Don't get me wrong, I've encountered plenty of genuinely nice people in Overwatch, but the amount of toxic players in Overwatch kinda beats the amount in Paladins. I'm speaking for myself, of course, so if it's different for some other people who have more hours than me then I completely understand but from personal experience, Paladins has been a bit more pleasant. I do have a massive problem with how much money I feel like I have to spend, though. Now, obviously, the game is free to play and has micro transactions but good lord...the only skins you can get without spending money is the mastery skins. The obsidian skin, the cosmic skin (or something like that), and the golden skin at level 50. Some champions don't even have the obsidian and cosmic skins. I'm typing this review before I've really tried any of the new updates so this might not be an issue like it used to be when I started playing and, if it has been changed, please correct me. This might only be a problem that I have, though, since I don't really wanna dump a ton of money on the game right now but I just kinda wanted to mention this.

Conclusion:
I'd honestly say the gameplay is a bit more balanced than Overwatch's because of the item shop and more freedom you can have when picking a character. The graphics aren't eye burning. The community is, in my personal opinion, a bit more pleasant than Overwatch's community. Now, I definitely believe the game has problems, It's not flawless like I'm making it out to be. I do still kinda prefer Overwatch over this game but this isn't a review about Overwatch so I won't get into that. Overall, not 100% better than Overwatch but it's definitely worth your time. If you want a game like Overwatch but you don't wanna spend money, then this is your game, You might get the same amount of fun out of this game that you'd get out of Overwatch, if not more fun (sometimes). This is a messy AF review but it's only, like, my second steam review ever so don't judge too hard.

The gameplay is good. Almost every champion is unique, and requires you learn a new way to play the game. It's much faster-paced than something like overwatch. There are a lot of pros to get into, such as it being a completely free game with no pay-to-win aspects to it. 

There are however, also some fatal flaws. 
- The balance is oftentimes a mess, with questionable nerfs and buffs. 
- Player retention relies on the sunken cost fallacy. That is when you continue to come back to something due to how much money you've spent rather than the game actually having improved. 
- The current state of the game involves cheaters, drophackers, and toxic individuals not being banned due to the team fearing a decrease in player numbers. There is no enforcement to keep toxic players at bay.
- Only the most popular champions get skins, and oftentimes they are extremely sexual. Sex sells, but male champions are severely underappreciated.
- The lore is a mess. New champions being added does nothing to help anything but player numbers, and most of all is a disservice to the lore.
- Customer service being passive-aggressive and unhelpful towards players who are angry about misleading marketting.
- The website literally doesn't work. You cannot report players through the website because it is so damn slow to load that your report needs you to do the recaptcha before its ever sent to the support team.
All of this is ignoring the stability issues, from spaghetti code that has the dev team scared to work with it, to the game being literally unplayable on the nintendo switch due to crashing the moment you boot up the game. 

tl;dr At this time the game is falling prey to short-term profit. There is no goal to keep players. Playing the game itself is fun, but ultimately will be damaging to your mental health. The matchmaking is so bad you can go days without winning, and nothing is done about toxic players due to the fear of losing player numbers.

If you're looking for something to sate your thirst for Overwatch-style gameplay then keep looking.

Most fun I've had playing hero shooters in a while, each hero has his/her own unique quirk and mechanics that makes them deep. However everything isn't rosy as it might seem.

The first and foremost criticism I would make is the rubber-banding, anyone playing from the middle-easts will have random disconnects, bullets not hitting despite being on target, getting shot at despite being behind cover. This all comes down to ping and loss. I sincerely hope they use their funds to launch a middle east server. This game is a gem, it deserves better.

Another criticism I have is the way they monetize their game, I'm fine with paying for new characters or buying gold or deluxe edition to unlock the large roster of characters. But, what I can't stand is the way they sell skins, their must be way they can make it bit more cheaper 100USD for 20 chest is a bit too steep of a price for me personally. Especially when you consider the fact that as I mentioned before we don't even have servers in our local region. 

The bounty coin system god please just make the skins a static price, it's so annoying having to farm coins only to get shafted because you were at work when your favourite  character skin pops up, only to later find out its worth 4000 COINS!!!!! come on now your already drip feeding us the coins while releasing new skins every month. Please just make weekly offerings with fixed price.

Other than that most people complain about community being toxic, but come on which community doesn't have their fair share of salt shakers?

Literally one of the greatest competitive games of all time. Not to mention, meme builds are fun every now and again too! Healer Skye? lol, sure. Five-tank team? Let's doooo ittt!! There are so many ways to enjoy yourself here. If simplicity is more your style, there are presets, but you definitely won't be getting the full experience. All of this wrapped up in a vibrant and lore-rich fantasy world makes for an addicting game to play for years. It's worth a shot. I mean hey, if you just wanna dip your toes in... that's free! So what do you have to lose?

Honestly, it just feels like a less polished Overwatch. Which is saying something. Hi-Rez keeps releasing new champions every few months instead of balancing out older champions. It's really frustrating, and makes the game feel like it's in constant beta. You say all day until you're blue in the face how it's not like Overwatch, and how it's a FPSMOBA with each character having their own unique play styles, but really, that doesn't make it better. You get locked into certain ways of playing, because playing any other way just isn't viable, Sound familiar?

So if you didn't like the state Overwatch was/is in, I would not recommend this game. Even though it's free, the frustration takes it's toll.

Update: Spent some more time playing some time after making this review. Everything I've said still applies.

Update 2: Due to the balancing (or lack of balancing), this game is being dominated by a very overpowered champion. Hi-Rez/EvilMojo aren't doing anything, nor are they planning on doing anything about it. I once again do not recommend this game. It's now frustrating beyond just my earlier points.

The developers do care about the game and are working toward making it better, there might be decisions that may be frowned upon just like in the past, but the game still has something that makes me keep playing (call it an abusive relationship if you must).
So before reading reviews, watching frustrating gameplays, and bug compilations i'd suggest you give it a try and have your own opinion.

Overall this game is a solid 9/10 for me.

I'm a fan of this game, it plays well and almost anyone can pick it up and have an overall good time. Characters are well designed and so far I haven't had any big problems with this game or encountered any bugs. This doesn't mean it's without flaw though. I do think that the game can be a little too easy at times, and that should be saying something because I main a healer. I manged to get a 50 streak, which is unheard of for me, as I'm predominantly bad at FPS games. Other times, it can be pretty challenging, which is something you want in a game like this. I hope that mew players like me could be faced with more challenge in order to help us learn how to utilize our champions abilities better. There's also the problem with the chests in this game, which gives you a chance to get the item(s) you want from it. I could see people getting addicted to spending money just to unlock everything from these chests. Thank god they're only cosmetics, because that means you don't have anything Important or overpowered locked behind a crippling gambling addiction. Overall, my second complaint can be overlooked. This is still an excellent game and I hope it improves over time.

It still has the usual problems of bugs and unbalance matchmaking, but it still is a really fun hero shooter with less emphasis on the shooter aspect for the most part, unlike Mr Overwatch. 

Now Paladins is way more fun than Overwatch in my opinion, the main reason being that paladins is way more free in what you can do and pick as a team, unlike the counter or mirror formula in overwatch. I mean the main way to play the game is to queue for specific roles, like jesus just remove all the heroes except dmg and make a Valorant game.

Point being, Paladins is fun, and gives you quite the freedom on how to play your champ and team. If you dont mind the usual free to player and mostly quiet coms and chat, you will like paladins. If you want to continue to play paladins you will have to deal with the matchmaking system as well as the weird bugs, but that is if you sink some time in paladins.

I played Paladins for the first time 4 years ago because of a game called Overwatch, and while I liked it, Overwatch always overshadowed it for me and many others. Paladins was always the easiest game to make fun of, however I think it's reputation is undeserved because while Overwatch was always more popular, I think that Paladins is a better game in many ways.

Paladins' card system creates a amount of replayability and creativity that I haven't seen in many other games like it. It's extremely fun to create your own setups or use other's ideas to use a character in a way that they weren't originally intended for while still being useful. Many characters that I wouldn't normally like by themselves have cards that can fix the things I don't like and create an enjoyable experience that would be impossible in many other games.
The balance in this game is impressive for the amount of characters and the aforementioned customization,
any character can be useful and in most situations skill and strategy is the only determiner of winning, of course there are a couple outliers but this is expected in a game with as many possibilities as this.

I find it hard to take Paladins seriously as a competitive game, which shouldn't deteriorate from it's quality as it can very much be a competent competitive game, however that is not the role that Paladins fulfills in my library. Paladins isn't a game to be taken seriously for me, but one that brings child-like joy of creativity the likes of which I haven't experienced in a while.

In the end, Paladins is one of the funnest experiences I have had in a while and playing with friends only enhances the experience. I regret my former distaste for the game and can only recommend it to anyone who reads this review.

I have soaked over 200 hours across multiple accounts on pc and even more on console into Paladins and I can tell you that this is a great game weather you are someone who plays casually or competitively. Paladins has a handful of different modes, although the most popular is Siege so I will be using that for this review. In this case, Paladins is a 5v5 team based FPS with a huge cast of characters from a little winter witch, Evie, to a death defying god-like axe-wielding destroyer of anything containing life, Terminus. In this game skill most definitely tells a part in the motion of the game, although teamwork is key. In this game you can honestly feel hours in the training area just playing around with different characters finding out who you want to unlock and it wont be boring. One of the things that I love about this game is the cards. If you don't think that a cast of more than 30 characters was enough, you won't be disappointed, you can play the same character in so many different ways because of the deck loadouts that you use, this feature adds a sense of personalization into the mix because you can play the character the way you want to play them. Want more health then why didn't you say so, BOOM more health. Want shorter recharge time on your abilities, okay here you go. There is so much you can do to simply tweak how your chosen champion works and it really does have its advantages because I have loved soaking many hours into creating the perfect builds for me and I enjoyed every single bit of it!

My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.

How do I put this; This game has and had the potential to be good, but with the way the hitboxes work (for those of you who don't know, they're pill-shaped, meaning everything is much more larger than it needs to be), and the way matchmaking seems to constantly be an algorithm of "Matching you with two games in a row where you steam roll the team, matching you two games in a row where you're steamrolled," piled ontop of the inconsistent and oftenly OP champions against the inability to change champions in game, and you get the issue with Paladins; a game that seemingly wants to be about skill, while never feeling like it's about skill at all as much as it is just a luck of the draw you have limited hand in. 

I want this game to succeed, as fuck Blizzard and fuck Overwatch is one of my key viewpoints, but this isn't a worthy alternative, as it manages to suffer from the same issues as Overwatch while being unsatisfying to play.

Fun to play with friends, but do not take it seriously under any circumstances.
