I always come back to this game and i enjoy it at first but it always happens that i quit after awhile. Not because it's not fun or too hard etc. There is literally one reason and one reason only......Flankers. Having a role that is made up of characters who sneak around and kill key targets is fine... in theory. Especially in a team game where you can work together and focus them down but NO ONE TALKS OR COMMUNICATES!! 

Now this isn't something I really care about because in all my years of playing games i know 95% of people don't talk in team games. The problem is I would expect developers to understand this also. You see a Buck (Flanker) better run or have teammates with you because he is jumping onto without consent and shoving that shotgun in your mouth. See a Skye (Flanker) (jk she's invisible) prepare to get shot with Covid and then filled with bullet holes as the cure. See a cat lady with pink hair bouncy 20ft in the air constantly? Uninstall because that is the only way you survive.

Every other "Role" in the game is honest in what they do. Tanks usually have shields and are beefy. Damagers usually hit from medium to long range and you can usually see them coming. Healers...heal(fuck Furia). Flankers on the other hand I have to pray they are garbage at the game or just run away and hope that their bloodlust is turned to another one of my teammates. I usually fill in games because i enjoying playing a bunch of characters and making sure we (the team) has all the tools to win. That's why I don't just say fuck it and play a flanker. It's boring when I can just hop on Skye and easily get 20+ kills almost every game and i'm not even that good. All in all play Tetris or something.

Also my girlfriend is getting scared of me because I keep smashing my desk and yelling.

I recently delved back into Paladins after taking a while off. (I think 2019 was my last go at it, I enjoyed it then.)

I've already reached the ceiling of gameplay that I care to reach. What in the everlasting f*** happened to the seasonal reward system? I paid 10 dollars for the new season in May the actual day-of starting, and found NO reason to stay. 

Season progression went from 80 or 90 levels to, like 25, meaning that you stay the same level for MUCH longer and the rewards for each rank progression are dogsh**. (SOOOOOO MANYYYYYY WALL-SPRAYYYY COSMETICSSSS) Seriously if anything has become stale in this game, it's the rewards.

All of these aspects were taken away to promote their new Limited Time Modes, also known as "The typical online game Battle-Pass way to get you to spend much more time logged for the same rewards, using gameplay modes that are a slog to get thru." Each LTM has a locked reward that you cannot access until each of the 3 LTM events are complete. The catch? LTM events are released in sets of 3, once per week. Instead of grinding out the (arguably cool) rewards that we were once given a path to, we now have to play in bits and pieces, and make sure we log in more often, and make sure we stay on top of the "weekly timed events." (Good Christ, it's sooooo "Battle-Pass" dynamics and marketing)

Sorry guys. I miss actually playing thru the Season and earning all the sick skins you used to offer. (*and enough GEMS to buy the next season, ensuring that you stay and keep playing another few months. Now you guys just offer sprays, emotes, and chests (That are heavily sleighted towards emotes and sprays.)

Matchmaking is still a WILD potluck of new players VS seasoned vets with zero communication. Ranked Paladins is also among the most toxic MOBA environment out there.

It was fun while it lasted guys. This game used to feel much more balanced and worth my time. Now it's just another FTP MOBA Cash-Pumping machine.

This game saved my life.

I am 27.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

though low hours I can judge based on mechanics and game build in how it feels.

Your real matches are a mixed bag of good equal fights or team of starters vs high rank veterans stomping on players.

There is no match making via levels or so from what I've noticed. So prepare for many frustrating matches where you cannot even kill anyone. So you get spawn camped to death by 1 dps. The infamous Terminus vet with 2 healers vets makes him unkillable as new players never listen to Dont shoot him when hes absorbing. 

biggest fun killer, is if you accidentally pick a healer than dps, you cannot change. So not like other FPS types and can quickly kill the fun and variety especially if struggling. This pretty much kills the match as one extra tank or healer spells doom to a match. Yet dps will always be better to destroy shields.

Card system is interesting but best to look at sites that tell you which builds are meta or you will anger team or fail greatly.

Doesn't feel rewarding much even with gold coins/gems to unlock new players it will take forever but nothing much else to use it on. The new get new points to buy limited edition skins up for small amount of time is only for vets. You will never have enough in time but they give so few it'll be a mind numbing grind.

Many maps are not really well built, adding to confusion to new players with so many multiple paths or dead ends. It feels really cluttered at times due to some maps just being too enclosed with many exits and entrances.

compared to TF2, with class types, Overwatch it really doesnt feel so good to play or fun in long run.

Does have a nice leveling that must be reached for a number of characters before heading into ranked. Bad part is if you're a new and free player you get the cheaper builds that often arent good to use in matches. So heads up on team builds.

My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead, murdered by my brother-in-law Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, Hank came to me with a rather, shocking proposition. He asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using his connections in the drug world. Connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded, I... I always thought that Hank was a very moral man and I was... thrown, confused, but I was also particularly vulnerable at the time, something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me on a ride along, and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin so I agreed. Every day, I think back at that moment with regret. I quickly realized that I was in way over my head, and Hank had a partner, a man named Gustavo Fring, a businessman. Hank essentially sold me into servitude to this man, and when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn.
Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling out. From what I can gather, Hank was always pushing for a greater share of the business, to which Fring flatly refused to give him, and things escalated. Fring was able to arrange, uh I guess I guess you call it a "hit" on my brother-in-law, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured, and I wound up paying his medical bills which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge, working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring, and did so. In fact, the bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen in the ranks to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA, and about that time, to keep me in line, he took my children from me. For 3 months he kept them. My wife, who up until that point, had no idea of my criminal activities, was horrified to learn what I had done, why Hank had taken our children. We were scared. I was in Hell, I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, to end this nightmare, and in response, he gave me this. I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. I... All I could think to do was to make this video in hope that the world will finally see this man, for what he really is.

Paladins... this game has had questionable decisions made around it leading to some really bad eras of the game, but honestly recently things have been going in a great path for the game and I only hope for its success in the future and for them to continue making this a good game, because at its core it is a pretty fun game! So why play Paladins over Overwatch and other hero shooters? The characters kits are honestly all pretty fun to use. I've achieved a decent level of mastery with nearly every character because I find 90% of them to be really enjoyable, with all having some skill expression (varying amounts as expected), and very satisfying, fluid abilities that should supply a lot of fun. Now I will admit most of the characters kits are a bit simple so some may lack the complexity some look for, but luckily there are still a good few characters that can fit your bill. I honestly overall enjoy these kits a lot more than the characters of Overwatch for the aforementioned reasons. Now maps can be a hit or miss, I feel this is a common problem with hero shooters with a large variety of maps, some of them just suck. They can be designed in such a way where there's a really select few picks that are good on the map that just dominate which can lead to some pretty aggravating games if their team gets the power picks, but I will say from a casual point of view most of the maps feel good to run around in and have fun. Gamemodes for Paladins leave a lot to be desired as there's only three two of them being a capture type and then a team deathmatch. The devs have said they're finally going to be adding/re-adding more in like a Payload type one so that should be something to look forward to. Next in line is balance of the game, it's... alright. Some updates can be annoying with a few characters being overtly stronger than everyone else and some being terrible for too long since the biggest complaint I have with this game is that the devs take a ton of time to balance characters due to them wanting to keep an eye on things for about 3 months before doing anything to get the best idea possible on where to balance, but then they usually miss the mark on nerfs, the buffs are usually good though! For our final review point let's look at the most important the skins. Pretty good overall, they've gotten a lot better recently, I've spent some money sadly on them. Overall a very fun game I'd say a better casual experience than competitive. Try it out it's free you lose nothing for trying it. Also the characters are cooler and more interesting than Overwatch characters and nothing can change my mind, thank you <3
Game play is very pleasant and gets competitive rather in a steady but keep me interested kinda pace, definitely underrated, DOWNLOAD and fall in love. :)

It's a really fun game - if you think it's 'just a copy of Overwatch' and for that reason alone you don't play it; then you're missing out on probably one of the funnest games there is. They have a very wide selection of Champions that vary in difficulty - so you can pick up one of the easier Champs and be pretty good right away. Depending on which play-style you like, you can choose to be the Frontline (basically the Tank of the team, they soak up most of the damage, and are meant to be constantly trying to stay on the point), the Flanker (they flank, pretty simple), the Damage (they're the main line of offence - they're the guys that are usually trying to take down the Frontline), and finally the Support (you heal people, again pretty simple) a lot of the Champions can actually act as hybrids between roles - allowing for you to change up you strategies accordingly.

I've noticed a lot of complaints about paladins lately, with regard to their low dps and limited combat options. But what players are forgetting is the main reason Blizzard programmed Paladins. Paladins were not designed to be hybrid Tanks/Healers, as many claim. Instead, paladins were designed to be played while downloading pornography.

Paladins have roughly zero combat interaction, thus making them the perfect character to play while downloading massive amounts of hardcore pornography. Simply target a monster, hit "1", and minimize your window. Then sit back and enjoy the amazing girl on girl action.

Because a Paladin takes about one full minute to kill any monster, you can leisurely browse the erotic and pornographic fruits of the internet without much concern over your Paladin's welfare. After a minute, I go back to WoW, and usually my Paladin is alive and ready to loot the corpse. This is what makes grinding so pleasurable and convenient for me; the ability to simultaneously watch girls have sex with each other and level up at the same time. I doubt any other class has such an elegantly designed system, and I applaud Blizzard for their foresight in crafting a character that I can play with while playing with myself.

DPS? Who needs it? The quicker I kill something, the less time I have to watch boobies. Combat Interactivity? Overrated. I'd much rather interact with the girls writhing on my computer screen. Yes, a paladin was created for the sole purpose of surviving a fight while you stream hot pornography directly to your computer. That is why we have the high armor class, healing abilities, and the low, low DPS.

As for PvP, nothing is better than getting into Battlegrounds and soaking up the honor points while I watch girls take their clothes off for money. Only the minimum interaction is necessary for a Paladin to perform, and it is this very quality that I love the most about my Paladin. I doubt Rogues get any time to watch pornography while trying to vanish and rack up combo points, and I bet Shamans haven't seen a single naked breast while figuring out which totem to throw down before choosing which shock they are going to cast next.

In addition to grinding, we have several defensive options during combat that also allow us the flexibility of downloading pornography. Hammer of Justice allows a quick 6 second glimpse at a naked lady while our opponent is stunned, and Divine Shield allows a leisurely 8 seconds of quality right-hand time. Indeed, Paladins have cornered the market on the pornography during playtime of World of Warcraft gameplay.

It saddens me that many Paladins do not take advantage of the main functionality of your character, and are in fact lobbying for increased DPS, or more combat options. These are all unnecessary frivolities that would only harm our pornography downloading efficiency. Instead, we should thank the fine programmers at Blizzard for crafting a character that is great to grind with while grinding your loins.

I have played both Overwatch and Paladins and I can say they look similar but play somewhat differently. Paladins feels more like a MOBA in a FPS setting then a team FPS like Overwatch. What I like about Paladins the most is the loadout system makes every character feel different unique compared to what another player has set up compared to Overwatch where characters have a fixed play style. This game is free to play and while it does have microtransactions it doesnt have anything thatll give players a major advantage its really all cosmetic. On top of it this game has crossplay between Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4, and Xbox One. And for people who refuse to let go of the controller u can queue with only controllers which is nice. It also has cross progression between Nintendo, Xbox, and for PC but not for PlayStation. I tried with PS4 but it just didnt work I dont know why. Other than that its a fun game u should definitely give it a try since its free :)

This game suffers in the shadow of Overwatch, but the most important thing to do if you're thinking about it is to just give it a try. If you're a fan of the fantasy aesthetic this game is a visual treat, and there are so many characters one is bound to fit your play style.

Speaking of characters, I found that trying to unlock them as F2P takes enough time to make you plan ahead, but it is certainly faster than other games with a similar system. If you stick with the game for 30+ hours as a F2P, consider buying the Digital Deluxe Edition on discount for ~£30, as having instant unlocks for all previous [i]and[/i] new characters gives you plenty more content to enjoy. (It also refunds gold spent on characters for use on some nice recolours or other misc things)

The gamemodes are nothing too special, but the fun of the game is definitely in its huge but not overwhelming cast of characters. Despite being initially overwhelmed after being thrown into a game without warning by an experienced friend, characters are incredibly easy to pick up, but take longer to master. The individual Champion levels help you gauge how well someone should be with a character, as that means they've spent time with them specifically, although this doesn't mean they're invincible or make you feel hopeless like when you see an Apex Predator in your Plat-stuck-ass' game.

Daily quests can be completed in Players VS Bot matches, which makes grinding ones that force you to do something you don't like doing much quicker. If you're being stomped game after game it can be relaxing to just play however you want, as whilst the bots aren't the smartest they can still be a challenge when they're ganging up on you.

All in all I think this is a really fun game, and if you're reading this you're obviously thinking about trying it, so just do it!

Pros- Fun shooty gun game. Free overwatch essentially.
- great character design 
-tons of champs to choose from, there's something for everyone!
-very consistent updates
Cons- it WILL crash on you. The optimization is poopoo. 
-If you buy the bp you also have to grind. So you pay $15 min for content you then have to painfully grind for while hoping the game doesn't crash on you. 
-theyve added "direct buy" skins so now you don't even get all the skins that should be apart of the bp. 
-some of the skins cost $35 (1200 crystals)... yes... $35 in rl money... how tf are they getting away with this? I'm not sure. 
-If you're mains aren't skye, maeve, lian, or androxus don't expect new content for them. Some characters haven't gotten new content in LITERALLY 2+ YEARS... RIP WILLO, MOJI
- Most of the player base is braindead. Front lines "dont need to be on point" mentality, support "dont need to heal" mentality and flanks "dont need to flank" mentality is rampant. Doesn't matter if you're playing casuals or ranked. Equally braindead. 
TL:DR play it ftp, don't invest in their shitty bp and extremely overpriced in game currency

[b]Introduction[/b]
Paladins is an awesome game that you can really sink hundreds (or even thousands) of hours into it and it'll never get boring. This game is great for the casual "gamer", and if you like other similar titles like Overwatch then you'll enjoy this. 

[b]Casual Play[/b]
My take on this game depends to what extent you want to play it. If you're just playing some quickplay with your friends then this is an awesome choice and there's some cool champions to play as well as some really nice map designs. I actually prefer the champions and maps in this game over Overwatch (and I have a lot of hours in both games, actually even more in Overwatch). 

[b]Ranked Play[/b]
On the other hand if you're a more competitive gamer like myself you'll likely want to hop on this game and dive right into ranked matches and this is where some issues start to arise. 

[b]The issues with ranked[/b]
The matchmaking on this game is very flawed, and likely needs some looking into. It's very easy to jump ranks, and within only about 3 days I was placed in Diamond V. With that said, it almost feels like the rank hardly matters anyway because you can sit for 10 minutes waiting for a ranked game, get put in a game full of Grandmaster / Master players, and then someone dodges the game only to then be placed in another game 2 minutes later with some Silver/Gold players. I assume this is likely Hi-Rez's way of avoiding long queue times, but then you'll almost regret playing anyway because people will pick whatever champions they like even if it means you will almost certainly lose the game (Like 5 DPS).

Another issue is that Paladins is (unfortunately) notorious for it's bad servers. With that said I've only actually had 1 bad server in the last few weeks and I'm in the EU region (but I'm not too sure if other regions have it worse or not). 

Toxicity. Toxicity. Toxicity. The players in the ranked scene on Paladins have probably some of the worst attitudes I've ever seen... and I mean it's likely because it's a free game and if they ever get banned they can just set up a new account and they're good to go again. But if you do play Paladins I hope you have thick skin, or you're okay with blocking people regularly because you should expect that in basically every other game someone will swear at you, shout racist insults, and even go as far as to spam whisper you in your following games the same insults. I should add that I've reported a few people for this and so far one of them was banned for it. However I really had to encounter this same person numerous times and report them each time I saw them because they just carried on.

Player base. The Paladins player base is seemingly struggling at the moment as you will see that every other game you play with someone you already know, and if not them, their smurf accounts. Everyone and their grandad has smurf accounts on this game since it's a free game. And most of these smurf accounts are made with the intention to only play one character, and if that character doesn't fit into your teams composition, then guess what? They'll pick that character anyway.

[b]Finally for the good stuff...[/b]
Although I pointed out a lot of nuisances and annoyances above.. Paladins actually is a lot of fun, but it's mentally draining. The champions are a lot of fun, the abilities are great, the maps are beautifully designed, and the skins are nice (but please bring out more skins). I play Paladins almost daily recently, and I'm having a lot of fun, but some days I have to just stop playing because I'll run into the same few people who play with no intention of winning games. My strongest bit of advice is to always try play with a friend to try and reduce the chance of getting these trolls in your game.

[b]Final message[/b]
This is a brutally honest review, I play Paladins myself daily and would love to have a bigger player base. Don't let anything I said deter you from playing the game though. This is just my experience, and I think as long as you're able to just mute and ignore players who are toxic then you'll be fine. GL in game <3

~Wild

The best hero shooter game out there. Loads of variation. You can play one champion for 10 games with different playstyles each game. Want to go play support but your teammate ain't kicking it? Go frag with damage build instead! Want your explosive projectile to travel further instead of them exploding? You can! Honestly this game has loads of possibilities, and the roster is very interesting. A major downside though is the abundance of bugs. Some can be game breaking but these rarely happens, and the ones that often happen are the minor ones. Devs are (hopefully) constantly fixing them though. Give this game a try! Completely free to play! ...unless you want certain skins, but these are purely cosmetic, of course.

Overwatch is a 2016 team-based multiplayer first-person shooter developed and published by Blizzard Entertainment. Described as a "hero shooter", Overwatch assigns players into two teams of six, with each player selecting from a large roster of characters, known as "heroes", with unique abilities. Teams work to complete map-specific objectives within a limited period of time. Blizzard has added new characters, maps, and game modes post-release, all free of charge, with the only additional cost to players being optional loot boxes to purchase cosmetic items. It was released for PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and Windows in May 2016 and Nintendo Switch in October 2019. An optimized performance patch for the Xbox Series X and Series S was released in March 2021. In June 2021, Blizzard announced that the game would support cross-platform play across all platforms.

A very well-designed team FPS game. The thought that went into creating the game is incredible: all the mechanics and most of the characters (I'm looking at you, Vivian) are very well thought-out and interesting. 
There is a lot of customizability with loadouts and over 45 champions in four classes (Damage, Flank, Support, Frontline). Although you only start out with a few champions, every single character in the game is unlockable without spending money, assuming you're willing to grind a bit for in-game coins (I was).

This is my first (and only) FPS game that I've ever seriously played. A lot of people talk about server issues and the like, but in my experience as an average player I only encounter those every once in a while. 

It's also got lore and stuff but I'm not as interested in that personally but I don't have much to say about it. Each character has their own voicelines and personality to go with their unique, customizable playstyle, and no two games feel the same. 
Community is also chill for the most part - there are toxic players but that's the case in every game. Even chess has toxic players, so how on earth is an FPS game going to have none? There's a really good reporting system for toxic players and a commendation system for chill/good players, which is great.

I highly recommend the game, it's a lot of fun, There are limited modes as well which makes it less boring. The purchasable aspects of the game aren't pay to win, Just pay to look good. The champion pack is a great value if you really want to have every champion and the upcoming ones as well, It's worth your money.

Keep in mind that there are still some bugs that haven't been fixed for years now but I still have hope that the state of the game is gonna get better in the future.

The matchmaking:
getting matched with some of the most brainless, bot-like players you'll ever see, Literally uncarriable teammates against an enemy team that is filled with sweaty players, And oh boy, If you are playing onslaught against them simply you ain't gonna leave your spawn. So there's that.

The cards and the talents system is what makes the game special and unique IMO; You feel more in control of your play-style and it really changes the way you play that champion, there are some problems; The servers aren't stable you simply get disconnected at least 3 times every 5 hours or so, the crashes that randomly happen for no reason and if the game crashes you have to kill the process from the task manager every time which's really annoying

But overall it's really a fun-to-play game especially if you have friends to play with.

Paladins surprised me. My perspective was as a gamer with a thousand hours in Team Fortress 2 and maybe a few hundred in Overwatch, so I expected Paladins to be a weak imitation of the class-based formula with the character bloat and over-complicated systems of a MOBA. Instead, Paladins has: really strong class-based gameplay; a comprehensible (but far from perfect) item shop that creates a distinction between early, mid, and late game; and enough characters for the developers to forget about some of them.

Paladins has its flaws with how some features are implemented, and its servers, but there are few games that can compete with its concept.

Basically Overwatch with some differences. I've played over 1000hrs. I'm a Level 100 healer. The major differences I noticed were:

1. the in game items you buy each game to counter opponents (I love it, it adds more variety to the games/characters and overall strategy.)  
2. The 1 of 3 different abilities you choose for each character at the beginning of the match. Again, more variety and allows you to play the same character very differently. 
3. There are multiple invisible units compared to the ones on overwatch which I thought was a plus. 
4. Apparently the graphics are way worse than Overwatch, but I never play on highest resolutions so...this might be a big issue for some. 

I think Paladins has characters that can really work with people who don't have sniper skills...me...as there are Healers/Tanks/DPS characters that fit with this category. While it also has some characters that please the snipers and more coordinated players with high agility/skill characters (Evie/Vatu/Maeve). 

Community in the quick matches is good. Plenty of trash talkers but also free awards to grant players that displayed leadership/teamwork/skill. The wait time for games is very minimal...like 30 seconds still and I've been playing about 2 years.

Man i can't even begin to say where my enjoyment begins anymore.
Genuinely, i loved Paladins before Terminus, however he's not the reason i can't recommend Paladins.

Hi-Rez is one of them, but the state of this game is why i can't recommend it.

Casual literally has a risk factor of matchmaking with teammates who can't even read. These people can't even see the obvious "damage" icons either, and instantly select their favorite champion regardless of composition.
Any kind of Balance is completely tossed out the window in casual, you'll either quit from the frustration of waiting for ranked, or play long enough to find that ranked is practically the same. You need 12 champions and level 15 to get into ranked.

What's worse is the idea they're using Root kits to block simultaneous access to a player's Task manager on their PC, in order to prevent users from leaving a match. I tried to spam ALT+F4 and the game refused to close as well. This is a major security concern for me. My PC, My control. 
Now if you do manage to open task manager and close the game in time before the match starts, you can still be given the exact same level of punishment, you'd get while playing ranked, which is Bloody ridiculous with all the issues this game suffers from. Yes, you can get a deserter tag IN CASUAL of all game modes to be concerned with, especially how bad it is.
I say this, to implore it as much as possible, Casual is the worst iv'e ever seen, in any FPS game ever. Overwatch, R6 Seige, Boruto Shinobi striker, Duel Links, nothing compares to how abysmal Paladins casual mode truly is. even League of Legends casual mode is centuries better than this.

People who refuse to work together are so common in this game, i can't blame a single person who rages inside of it.
Ranked? ha.
Seris who refuse to Pocket a Ruckus, Buck's jumping into OBJ and throwing, Enemy Maeve with the skills of Pro league gamers, teammates who barely even have a character above level 10 and require an Experienced player to carry them.

which also leads me into the fact, that it feels like the game is pairing completely New and ignorant players with those who are experienced, and expecting them to demonstrate Overpowered skills or OFF-META play-styles.
a Front-line has to become a Flank if let's say a Victor is the only one holding off the entire team.
A damage user heals themself because the support needs to heal their discord buddies.
A support becomes a flank because they think they can pocket a damage champion while flanking.

It's such a twisted environment, that half the time, i don't even know how we won or lost!
That's before the many BOTs who literally just play to farm levels. Iv'e seen so many AFK BOTs in only 3 Hours of game-play here, than my 40 or so hours on Rainbow 6 Seige.

Now, my Issues with Hi-Rez.
The events. Atrocious? yes. Greedy? Of course. Falsely stating that free to play players can earn rewards? Yep.
I'll never forget Furia's event, which started the precedent that players who play free can earn event currency, but can only gain rewards for that event by buying some form of Premium pass? The Abyss hungers was such a failure, i fear it will happen again with Shadows. Hence why I'll never buy into anything Hi-Rez makes, not even the rust off a penny is worth anything they make.

Edit:
I want to bring to awareness, after several hundred grueling matches later, ranked is....
Toxic can't even describe how awful it is. Lawless, unchained, harassment is constant.
From being called Autistic and feeding for having my own loadout. To people controlling my playstyle and belittling me for minor mistakes. it's absurd how obsessed this community is with ranked being narcissisticly precise. It's pretty much forced by the community for anyone to look-up a guidebook, to use the Perfect loadout and movement or suffer from people spamming the VGS, or using slurs to attack you. calling you a slew of insults like Retard, Moron, dumba**.
 Overwatch, Seige, and League cannot compare to this level of anger for fellow teammates who don't conform to these, mythological standards.
Paladins was so much fun back a few years ago, what the hell happened?
it went from petty "you're bad" and spamming VGS, with so much less toxicity over perfection.

to ganging up on the support because i feel like it, I need to control my team, your loadout made me dodge, slur, racial slur, disability slur, gender slur, braindead this, [Insert IRL criminal threat], threats of Doxxing, perfect loadout, perfect buy items, perfect aim, perfect skill use, perfect ultimate use, perfect movement, level 50 minimum for each champion, my mom, my sister, this person is a virgin for choosing [Insert champion name} and you can't pick them because others are better this one is bad.

Holy hell, if that makes any sense, please, make a translation.
My point being, this game's safety is deplorable, and an Enormous part of the community is disturbed.

after playing ranked for 4 of my 5 qualifier matches, i haven't been able to completely finish yet. Iv'e grown so discouraged, i want to continue, but i'm afraid to do so.
iv'e won twice and lost twice being matched with the same people who harassed me for the two losses. My teams which won were happy and positive, but would viciously attack the enemy team in the after game report.

One of the best hero shooters in my opinion. This game is very fun when you find a champion and loadout combo that you like. Overall, I would give this game a 9 out of 10 for the great team dynamic and different play styles to suite your wants/needs. If you've never played before I would highly recommend you give it a try because it is free! Thanks for reading this, hope it helps anyone wanting to know more about this game.

One of the best multi-player games I've ever played. Its like overwatch but if it didnt have the dev's hands smothering anything off meta or unique. The game actively encourages you to try and find new meta's with a pretty cool card + talent system that had lots of room for self expression. Like any game of course, there are "meta builds" and try hards, but the game is an absolute gem in spite of that,  and I can honestly say in my 400+ hours that I've never truly had the same game twice. Lastly, the Dev team simply keeps the game fun and wacky, without being gamebreaking. I recently had the pleasure of playing with a game dev who confirmed that a popular glitch/ bug has been left in for years because the players love it. Something like that would never happen in overwatch. Of course, like any review, this is just personal opinion, but if I had to summarise this review, I would simply say this:
(TLDR) If you wanna play a game with a bit more polish, but feels like an Esport wanna be with less creativity, play overwatch. If you want to play a goofy, but mechanically sound, fun game with variety, play paladins

This game isn't Overwatch. It's closer to a MOBA than Overwatch, but I will mention Overwatch in this review, just as a comparison.

[h1]What I like[/h1]
* A lot of heroes are "shooters" -- they shoot something (gun, bow, etc). I find that more fun than melee.
* Tanks (front line) are pretty fun to play. Particularly compared to Overwatch. Some of them are absolute beasts (like Fernando, a knight with a sword that's a flamethrower).
* The card system adds a layer lacking from games like Overwatch or Team Fortress.
* Normally a free to play game tends to attract the worst people, griefing people in chat, etc. Shockingly, I've seen less of that here than in paid games.
* The team comp isn't forced. You can choose any combination you like (though the UI encourages you to have at least 1 of each type).
* The meta is more fun than Overwatch's. Overwatch forces a 2-2-2 composition in their main modes currently. The paladins meta is 1 healer, 1 tank (front line), 2 flankers, and 1 of flanker or damage. But it's a fairly soft meta, some teams roll with other comps.

[h1]What I don't like[/h1]
* It suffers from the same community problems as Overwatch. In Overwatch, everyone picks Damage (in Paladins, usually Flankers are chosen), often healers don't heal.
* Unlike Overwatch, you can't change your champion after the match has started (not even within a category), and can't even change the card deck. So if your team makes a terrible choice, now you've got like 15 sweaty minutes of trying to save your team, even though you know how it's going to end within the first 60 seconds.
* The sound design is inferior to Overwatch and Rainbow Six Siege. In those games you have clear directional feedback of where footsteps are weapons fire are coming from. In Paladins, I haven't seen that you do.
* I think teammates use voice chat even less than Overwatch. I've never seen someone use it even once.

[h1]Other notes[/h1]
* I'm sorta surprised, particularly for a free to play game, there aren't actually that many cosmetics to purchase.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
If you like Overwatch, but want to change things up, this might be for you. I've had fun. Although I'm beginning to think the "hero shooter" or "moba shooter" game type is a fundamentally flawed concept due to people on the internet being terrible and team balance being so critical. It's not fun to respawn and get blasted repeatedly because the other team has a balanced comp and yours doesn't. It's no fun doing that to another team either -- no challenge. And yet -- I keep playing these things.

I've been gaming online since Battlefield 2 and playing free-to-play titles since GUNZ: The Duel. I've played every Blizzard title and was super excited for Overwatch only to realize shortly after it's launch that I HATE IT with a passion. Paladins addresses and improves upon everything I hate about Overwatch, from the forced reliance on teamwork to the static playstyle of each of it's heroes. Thanks to customizable builds a-la SMITE, Paladins allows you to play a character the way you want it to be played. Each of the 3 game modes are easy to pickup and each champion is intuitive enough that anyone can pick it up and have fun immediately. Skill is rewarded regardless of the role you choose to play, and a well played team of nothing but damage & flank characters can sometimes outgun a team more "properly" composed. In Siege mode (payload), when you capture the point your team is awarded a point, with a successful push to the enemies spawn awarding another, a successful defense on the enemy side awards a point, and the first to 4 points wins. This often leads to intense final round clashes unlike comparative hero shooters where people give up, swap out of their roles to play a character that's more fun rather than trying to win, or just become intensely toxic toward their team.

The one downside I'm starting to notice about Paladins is that I personally find no reason to buy into the season pass.. the rewards are lackluster and few champions have what I'd consider enough skins - especially enough skins I want - and ESPECIALLY enough skins that are attainable without real money purchases. You have to give me an attainable grind to things I want before I'm willing to dump money on the extras (looking at you too, Destiny.)

Paladins is a Hero Based FPS, often compared to Overwatch as it released not long after, however Paladins has a larger character roster, different mechanics and more variability in playstyles. For example, each Champion can be played with a minimum of 3 different styles using their different talents, their talents will often change their attacks or abilities so they have to be used differently, the game is free, all champions can be unlocked for free by playing, or by buying the Champion pack, they can also appear on the free rotation, there's 4 different champion types with different playstyles, Damage, task is mainly to help focus pressure on the point, Flank will go around the map and try to finish off low health targets, attack the enemy Flank and take out high priority targets from behind like the enemy Support, Frontline's task is to pressure the point or push the enemy team back while the team captures the objectives,Support's job is to keep the team alive or boost the team with shields and damage boosts, they also should focus on keeping the frontline alive, overall the game is fun, competititve is rather toxic, but that's common in games.
Hope this helps.

Okay. This game is similar to Overwatch. Pardon my ignorance here, but I'm pretty sure this came first. Now that that's out of the way. In my honest opinion, this game is superior to Overwatch in Pretty much Every single way. (Save for the physics and interactive environments.) 

Character selection is locked. Once you choose a character to play as, you're locked into it for the match. This is pretty neat, because of the item system. The item system allows you to take a character, and adapt it to the situations that the match calls for, such as, Lowering healing effects on the enemy, Faster reloading, Increased movement speed, Reduced damage, increased incoming healing, lifesteal, etc... These two systems, for the most part, make strategy almost as important as knowing how to use the Character you've chosen. 

Character Variation and selection. Paladins has over 35 champions. There are Support (Healers,) Tanks, Damage, and Flank Classes. Each has it's overall role, each is necessary for a good team build, and it's very balanced in this regard. Each champion in the game feels different from the rest, and there are no two champions that play exactly the same. Each champion has 3 different special abilities that they can choose at the beginning of the match, enabling even more variation in the characters, game to game. 

The maps and game modes are usually very well balanced. As this game is a PVP based game, obviously the outcome of the game is going to differ match to match, but overall, the maps and game modes keep the game interesting. There is Siege, Onslaught, and TDM. Siege is my usual game type, push the cart to the enemy point, (Much like TF,) Onslaught is basically King of the hill. TDM... Well, that's self-explanatory. For PVE, and new players, there is a "Training" mode, VS. AI, so you can learn the different champions and get some target practice in. Every once in a while the AI teams stumble on some magical team, and can be a challenge. So, there's a bit of something for everyone. Another bonus to Training mode, is that the Challenges for the battle passes are able to be progressed against the AI as well, so, that's cool if you're having trouble with some of them. 

Battle Passes. Okay, so, this is a sore spot for some, and I get it. But hear me out. Hi-Rez made this game, and you can play it for free with little limitation. The battle passes enhance the items you get as you progress, and typically they last anywhere from 2-3 months, (Spitballing, I'll let you know in a few days when the next one drops.) the price is reasonable, and they give you ample amount of time to earn enough gems, through the challenges, in order to keep getting the future passes for free, (Again, you just have to complete the Challenges, and earn the gems in order to buy the next one.) This, I feel is more than reasonable. This game is Free To Play, but if you enjoy it, support the developer so you may continue to enjoy it. 

The Micro-Transactions are all cosmetic, title and avatar based. Meaning, pay or no, your ability to win is not hampered or amplified. The only thing I can say, mildly negatively about Micro-Transactions is that with the way that you unlock characters, you can just buy gems and unlock them. I don't mind this at all, again, I love the game, I'm going to support it, and to be fair, this is a convenience thing. If you don't want to do this, all characters are unlocked in any order you desire, with gold earned round to round. I would recommend that everyone buys them with gold for the first 100 hours or so of the game, as it will only cause you to learn the characters you have and make you better at the game through experience, rather than having 35+ Characters to pick from and no idea how to play. 

There is a ranked mode. Special rewards for playing competitive, That's cool, not my cup of tea but it's there for all you MLG wanna-be's. ( I'll touch on this when I get to my gripes.)

Gunplay is refreshing, Movement is smooth, and the game runs great, even on Potatoes. Meaning, even if you have an ancient PC, you'll likely be able to run this. Which is great! 

Now, I do have one major gripe about this game, and it's not really about the game, and more about the community. I play this game a lot. I play with a group of friends, I've done so for the past couple of years, on and off. My stats reflect an above even Win-rate, and positive K/D ratio. Now, I'm not saying this to puff myself up, it is what it is, I know how to play. The issue is, when you get into Pubs, (Or ranked which is far worse,) There are a LOT of Toxic, whiney little children, thinking that they know your character better than you do, or that their tactics work better than yours, or by default, blame you for their shortcomings. Unsportsmanlike conduct and temper tantrums run rampant, and honestly, the toxicity can, at times, be very intrusive. You can mute the morons, but the fact is, with a game like Paladins, TF, Overwatch, etc... You need to communicate, and Whiners, blame placers and trash talkers, pretty much make it so that this does not happen and most people mute the Voice Chat by default. The one thing I will give Blizzard/Overwatch is that they do take unsportsmanlike conduct a bit more seriously then Hi-rez, and the community, while toxic, isn't quite as bad. Guys, it's a game, a free one at that, get over yourselves and have fun. You want to play MLG style, group with a team and play ranked, stay out of pub and for the love of god, play a game that's not largely F2P, see how you fare in Overwatch, eat your humble pie, and come back a little more human. 


Overall, this game is one of the few that I keep coming back to. There's enough variation to keep you interested. It'll take you a year or two to unlock all of the characters, and each one has it's own learning curve. There is a LOT of replay value, and honestly, it's fairly well balanced. I would recommend this game to anyone who only has time to play a couple of 15 min rounds, or anyone who's a fan of the FPS genre. It's a great game overall. Polished, fair, completely voluntary Micro-transactions, and high replay-value. 10/10 for me. Download it, you won't be out anything if you disagree with me and don't like it. But if you find that you do agree with my assessment, you may find yourself a new favorite game.
Easy to get into and fun

PvE Review: I had a hard time trying to start this review, so I figured I'd just list the Pros and Cons.

[b][u] Pros [/b][/u]
The bots are an odd difficulty. It's hard to say, but they are balanced. They will punish you if you don't play as a team, but can be pushed over with even a decent squad. All modes are available to play against AI, and quests and Trials can be completed in PvE, allowing you to play the game however you want, mostly. The PvE servers are populated, so there's not games where you have to play with and against AI, you'll mostly get other players.

[b][u] Cons [/b][/u]
Anytime they release anything, whether it be anniversary stuff or whatnot, it always requires you to play 2 non-bot games to receive them. It's kinda stupid IMO, but I'm no developer. The game, in PvE, can feel really repetitive really quickly, but friends can help alleviate that a bit.

Overall, the game is free, what've you got to lose? It's fun and engaging in both PvP and PvE and the devs mostly don't force you to play a specific way.

This game is buggy, has networking issues and honestly feels like it would still be in early-access, if it wasn't for the large roster. This doesn't make it not enjoyable however, as it is a fun alternative to games like Overwatch and other class based shooters. 
I used to play this game a lot back in the game, and I don't feel like it has improved.. at all. It honestly seems more bugridden than before and all of the cons combined make the game feel abandoned.

Pros:
-Doesn't require a very good gpu, so can be played half-decently on most modern laptops.
-Fun artstyle and (some) quirky and interesting characters
-Big roster that fits almost all playstyles

Cons:
-Pretty toxic community, atleast in quickplay and lower ranked ranks.
-Buggy, networking is iffy and although my graphics are set to high and I have good frames it still looks like a blur.
-Some characters are uninspired and some are just not fun to play (against)
-Head hitboxes seem inconsistent and messy
-Very expensive skins and a chest system so you need to be lucky to get the one you want

Overall.. I really don't think this game is good (anymore). It is a solid base of a class based team shooter and with a big roster to boot, it seems very cool at first glance. It's underwhelming and honestly unpolished, even after 3 years of full release now.
That doesn't mean I don't recommend trying it though. It's fun, the abilities and characters feel powerful and cool. You shouldn't go into this game with high expectations, not with rose-tinted nostalgia glasses, because it doesn't hold up.

Another pressing problem is the lack of moderation from the game's staff and moderators, with cyberbullies harassing other players and Taliban-supporters using the game's chat system to spread their ideologies but were never banned even after a year has passed.

The thing i like more about paladins compared to overwatch is that you can't change a hero in 1 playthrough which give more immersion. Gameplay wise it felt pretty much the same, solid overall. 9/10

It has some problems I think are fixable. More formats than 5v5, and more gamemodes than TDM, point capture, and hybrid payload would do wonders. (5v5 is good competitively, but it means that every single team member is essential, and if one is slacking, has no idea what "team composition" means, or is just AFK, you're in for a bad time.)

But the heroes themselves are great, and every one I've tried has been very fun, even the ones that aren't my favorite. And this is one of the few games where it's been so fun that I play far longer than is needed for efficient progression.

And while it's definitely a game of "pay to get cosmetics", you can get everything if you are patient enough, as there are opportunities to get the paid currency every once in a while for free.

This was definitely a "download on a whim" thing for me, because I liked the look of one of the heroes - I didn't expect to like it this much, since I knew all of its flaws before playing, and none of its good points. But I was pleasantly surprised, and it's gotten on my "play often" list already.

I wish I could recommend this game, I really do but it in every way continues to feel like Hi Rez’s unloved stepchild. The gameplay is fairly solid, balance is about like it’s competitors so nothing of note there outside of a couple outliers. The problem is like with most of Hi Rez’s games, polish. You can make the free to play argument but that would be ignoring Hi Rez’s financial history. In reality they put all their cards on Esports and care very little for their casual playerbase. 

Much like Smite, this game’s micro-transactions are within reason but the removal of the “Ultimate God Pack” equivalent is perplexing to say the least. Maybe it was for a good reason, I am far from an expert but it’s a change I was not too fond of considering it was already limited in comparison to Smite’s version.

All in all the game is not bad, it just needs work that clearly isn’t going to be put into it. If you just want a time sink, sure this works but there are better options out there at this point.

Hello, Overwatch refugee here!
     My friends and I have a lot of fun with this game, the characters have so many unique and interesting qualities, and it's a lot of fun making loadouts that fit your play style for each champ. Being able to pick items during the match to make you more powerful, sustainable, and to counter the enemy is a great feeling, something I wish Overwatch had. That being said, there are some things that bother me.

     I highly dislike the change to the battlepass system. It went from 120 levels all the way down to 24. It takes way longer to level up, so much so that I forget there's a pass active half the time. It doesn't feel very rewarding to me, since it's a somewhat agonizing crawl through it. They added "Trials" which is a series of challenges that you can work on two at a time. This is a fantastic concept, however, you can't pause or abandon a trial that you spent a ticket on. If you're having trouble finishing the trial or you get bored of it and want to switch it out for another one, you can't, you're stuck with it until you finish it or the pass ends. 

     Furthermore, the matchmaking is not always that great. Maybe they've lost a large part of their playerbase, or maybe their MMR system is not good, because casual games and ranked games can be all over the place. This is a bit of an outlier for an example, but I solo queued into a ranked match when my rank  was gold 5 and I got put in a full lobby of Masters players. That's a difference of 3 whole divisions. All of the characters I play were either taken or banned and I basically lost the game for those guys because I obviously wasn't supposed to be there. It was a bad time for everyone on my team. 

     The skins they're putting out are very hit-or-miss, and my friends and I sometimes take multi-month breaks from the game because the matchmaking can really ruin our fun, but ultimately we always come back. This game can be insanely frustrating for many reasons, but I love it.

Think of it as a more basic, casual, and accessible alternative to Overwatch.
The graphics look like it's the XBox 360 version of Overwatch.
But it runs on much weaker machines, and requires less network bandwidth.
It has huge old-fashioned hitboxes, so it's easier to aim.
It has a lot of characters(champions here instead of heroes), A LOT.  
If you're bored of Overwatch, this could be interesting.
If you like the idea of Overwatch, but it's just too much for you... this could be interesting.
If you want a unique experience that sets itself apart from Overwatch?  Eh... not so much.

Paladins is a pretty fun F2P team shooter. At first glance it may seem very similar to Blizzard's Overwatch, and that isn't just skin deep. The game modes are similar and there are some characters with similar styles and moves. But in all reality this game has had more of a pull for me than OW. The different maps that actually suit one play style over another per map. (Long range maps, close range maps) The broad spectrum of characters and powers really makes it feel like, for the most part, you can play any character and be good at them. Overall I would recommend everyone to at least give this game a few matches of tries.

Why am I reviewing this game just now? Well before I played in the main launcher which was the OG launcher.

Paladins, I only have 3 words to explain simple, fast, balanced.

Simple, Yes it is simple why? You can easily learn how the champions work, you can easily learn the game mechanics, actually not that easy but when you get the hang of it it will be easy, It is challenging as there are too many things to look out for many enjoyable champions and gameplay's you can do whatever role will suit you the best.

Fast, You know why its fast because, the game and gameplay is fast paced every mode is fast let it be siege, onslaught, deathmatch, rank game its still very fast it is very competitive but it is still a fast game mode mixed with so much aiming and comms and teamwork, well lets not forget to think fast of what the hell is happening in the match.

Balanced, am I being sarcastic or not? 50/50, slight sarcastic, slight not-being-sarcastic, half is balanced half is not, have the right items to buy things will be balanced wrong items nope you lost, right cards for your champion alright balanced. Champions hmm.. It is, you heard me the champions are balanced. Tiberius is excluded I hate the damage on that guy I mean its the reason why he always gets banned in rank, but every champion in the game has its unique gameplay that makes it balanced cause in the end it will be your gameplay and your teams gameplay on how you will counter the enemy team.

Alright this is all I have to say Paladins great game I love it and some of you surely loves it too, once you get in the game first time and get to feel the game you'll keep coming back at it, enjoy the game.

(P.S. I hate Tiberius mains)

Could be a great game. The mechanics, lore, and characters are a lot of fun. Maps are decent. Lacks a little polish, but is also F2P. On top of the hours logged here, I've logged 1000+on the Switch.

Problems? Game-breaking bugs everywhere. Characters will lag from one place to the next. I play with motion controls, which work about 65% of the time, and when they randomly cut out suddenly I'm not set up to properly aim. Controls will randomly glitch out entirely, causing the character to become unresponsive and camera to aim in randomly-shifting directions. Other players will disconnect, and you are left with a pretty useless bot rather than pop in another queued player. Ranked matchmaking is notoriously terrible. I actually gave up on it because the bugs/disconnects/etc. will cause you to lose randomly. I've been playing for a couple of years now, I think, and the player-base is increasingly toxic.  

They are great about coming out with new content, but I wish they would spend a cycle or two fixing bugs to get the game in a more playable state.

This game saved my life.

I am 41.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.
After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you

So I played this game back when it was first new in beta, being one of the many Overwatch players who went and played it and just seeing it as just a flat out rip off, it had many flaws back then and I didn't give it much time only getting up into the 20's. But coming back to this game using my old account I can say this game is so much fun to play now. They have improved so many systems like getting rid of the pay to win mechanic of buying chests for cards, and has balanced many champions. To be completely honest this game has drawn a lot of inspiration from Overwatch back then to the point of copying it in some manners when it first started, but that shouldn't stop you from playing it. This game has evolved and has created so many new champions that are fun and original, and they continue to strive for balance in them. The devs are also making it very friendly to people who don't want to spend money to the point of adding challenges to unlock cosmetics and in game currency, and improving their bounty store in which you can get skins by playing the game. 

I recommend you try this game out if your looking for a fun free FPS to grind.

And if you are to spend money I recommend buying the season pass. It unlocks all classes and gives a lot of currency to use and its well worth your money.

After spending a decent amount of time playing Paladins, I have come to the conclusion that this game is fun as long as your expectations are set very low.

That's not a jab at Hi-Rez studios either, it is just enjoyable in a really janky way. The heroes are pretty fun to play. There is a good variety of them. The maps are beautiful. Overall, just a decent free-to-play game.

On the flip side, the balance is awful. The community is what you'd expect of a free-to-play game. And Hi-Rez seems more interested in trying to address the toxcicity in the community instead of fixing the bugs, random crashes, imbalance, awful mathmaking, rampant AFKing, etc. that seem to breed the toxcicity.

I played to experience something new. I stayed to learn the ins-and-outs of the game. And I left because of the community. The community is very casual. It is very common to have someone just AFK in the middle of your game, or legitimately sit in spawn trolling. I have never received confirmation of a report being followed-up on or punished. Overall just seems like the type of game that's not very competitive or has any competitive integrity.
The game is fun with enjoyable characters and good looking maps, and its not pay to win, the downside is that its a Hi Rez game and the balance could be a bit better,

Although the game plays nice and looks nice, the community is full of trolls... 
Going 3 healers? Full dmg? No problem man all is good.
There should be a report option for trollpicks as well as queue per class so you avoid these kind of things!

I can't believe how addicting this game really is, mobility/movement is great, abilities are great, anything to do with characters is great. Graphics are very well made and textures are surprisingly good for a game like this, I'm sure that a lot of work went into this game. This runs without lag AT ALL for me, and cross-play works as it's supposed to. There's many strategies on each map and every game is different regardless of what map/game mode it is, even if it looks exactly the same, you still have a million different pathways and patterns to try out. It reminds me of Overwatch, although I don't think it goes really deep into the lore. I recommend playing this with a couple of friends, there's a party and team chat and a built-in voice chat option which means third party applications (e.g Discord) are not necessary, refferal links give rewards, and you get an XP boost for playing in a party. Overall great game, no flaws for me at all, 5 Stars.

this game has always been plagued by coming out in the same period as overwatch and despite it being in development before OW it gets called a clone to this day...i have no hate towards OW, i played it a tonne and enjoyed it despite all the frustrations i had with it...but paladins is it's own thing...always was...people think that it's a ''cheap version of OW''  based on some dumb opinions who think that ow invented the genre or something...and they write off the game without trying half the roster which currently 48(soon to be 49) champs...with most of em having at least 2 to 3 different ways to play them and sometimes a complete role change...skye for ex. can become a supp if u want(a good one as well) even tho she's designed to be a flank.on the other hand pip can become a monster dps with some off supp traits in the right hands.plus the custom loadouts systems helps u make the really ur own...u like more speed go for it...wanna be a bit tanky add some HP...want lower CD u got it on most abilities...some abilities get augmented by cards that change how they're used like bombking's jolt card and they're way more depending what champ ur making a build for...not to mention items in this game tho not perfect by any means solve a huge problem in ow which how overbearing and hard to balance barriers, CC and healing are in the game...remember GOATS meta?...ye no one liked that i can tell u as much...it was unfun to watch and imo unfun to play as well...the reason this isn't a prob in paladins is the existence of the items strore which helps u counter stuff like healing,CC, shielding and so on...if u like OW...don't follow the stupid bandwagon of ''OW CLONE REEEEEEE.'' and give this game a proper shot...invest some time into trying new champs every week on free rotation look up some tutorials to help with certain mechanics and different builds or just ask for help in the community tab or reddit. people will help...the players can be dense sometimes especially new players who don't understand the way to properly play roles like frontlines and supps and just flame cause they think they're doing well on dps(it has that in common with OW i guess) but if u ignore that and just do ur thing this game is easily hundreds of hours worth of fun. the game has had a rough life after ob64 but it's miles better now and it's genuinely fun and in a much better spot in every way...also i don't see why u can't play it AND ow...crazy i know...i'd still take this one tho personall...i like the characters more in terms of variety, overall design and they just feel more satisfying to play regardless of the role...also the lore is cooler imo since the devs have more freedom cause of the game's fantasy esk setting...btw paladins wiki is the one stop for everything paladins...lore...detailed champs kits...full voice line of each champions''skins included'' nad much more...

Всем привет, давайте я разложу все плюсы и минусы игры Paladins по полочкам

Плюсы:
1. Доступна система различных сборок, я расскажу на примере: есть Инь - шикарная, добрая девочка сосочка, так и обнял бы ее ирл ( жалко, что она в игре(((( ) ее можно собрать в разные билды: фулл сап, либо дпс сап: фулл сап -хорошо лечит, дпс сап - умеет как и лечить, так и наносить нормальный урон (исцеление в данном билде слабее первого) - такие вариации можно делать практически с каждым персонажем, благодаря системе карточек (сбор билда)

2.Множество разных персонажей на разные роли, новые персонажи выходят не редко и это очень радует!

3.Возможность получать какие-либо награды за просто игры без доната и маленькая цена доната (про донат - в лайфхаке) (это будут не скины, а граффити, либо аватарки) Вставлю сюда лайфхак: если хотите купить батлпасс - проверьте акции в магазине (есть акция-набор - ты получаешь скакуна, 60к золотых и 400 гемов - за 265 рублей батлпасс ваш вместе с вышеперечисленным)

4.Личный плюс - присутствие лора (это не просто рандомные персонажи которые сражаются, а вполне связанные между собой герои, конечно есть исключения)

Минусы:
1.Англоговорящие токсики - пацан на Фернандо говорит что я мусор на Ио, отхилив 112к хп, а Серис отхилила 60к и он говорил что она топ, учитывая то, что Серис даже не взяла талант на оглушение

2.Хорошие скины находятся зачастую в дорогих сундуках, поэтому понравившийся скин будет не просто добыть (не 100%, что открыв сундук получишь тот самый скин, который хотел)

3.Визуальные баги - у героя в победном экране нет оружия, а просто руки и замыленная моделька, когда выбрал чемпиона (может быть это только у меня проблема, поэтому можете этот пункт не считать)

4.Есть имбовые чемпионы (не так много, если что), но избежать испорченной игры можно просто попросив игрока забанить имбового персонажа (ban (имя персонажа))

Я надеюсь, что вы заинтересовались данной игрой, будете играть в нее и поставите мне лайк на обзор).

Cool and entertaining game, I liked it a lot!!

Good: Fun, fast paced, zero rage felt when I die for the most part. Back in the action fast. Game feels smooth to play. Having TDM as an option in an OW like game is nice. It's fun. I don't really know what more I can say with 8 hours of playtime. I got 8 hours of playtime, on a fun game, for free. It was basically a Saturday event ticket to do something fun for the day when nothing else seemed fun to play. 

Bad: LoL style "limited hero roster that you slowly unlock" presents a huge barrier to entry. Unlike OW you will not eventually unlock all cosmetics just by playing excessively. Loot crates for skins and you can't outright buy them. And you don't get RNG chests on "levelup" or anything. There's CLEARLY some balance issues with this game that they don't stay on top of the same way OW does. Buckle up for some anus puckering if you're decent at FPS games because you're gonna positively roll the level 0 players in your first dozen games and end up with a skewed af hidden MMR for non-ranked, and end up in games with smurfs and actual good players, which is lowkey horrifying when you've played like, 2 characters by that point. 

As a free game, it's really hard to say you don't recommend Paladins. 

I stayed away from this for literally years assuming it was gonna be a really generic and cheap feeling OW clone. 

It's not. 

It's not cheap feeling per se, it's more like, the same way LoL isn't exactly the most graphically stunning game ever, neither is Paladins. Doesn't mean it's bad. It's just not gonna fight with Blizzard for their level of polish. 

If nothing else Paladins is a successful distraction from the monotony of existing.

I want to like this game.  I want to like it more than I like Overwatch.  

But the communication system, instead of being a radial menu, feels like entering commands into a command prompt.

There's no role queue, so even if you want to play the least popular roles (tank & healer) for the benefit of the team, there are still lobbies where people just instalock 3 healers & a tank.

The loot system is pretty dire too, with specific cosmetics only obtainable through a specific lootbox.

Lastly, the UI is overwhelmingly bad in places, with profile images that look like they've been saved in 1998 & saved so many times that the profile image is more artifact than image.

The maps are reasonably well balanced, the classes are interesting & well designed, the audio is decent.  But holy moly ,the issues I mentioned above, reaaaaally affect anybody queueing up solo.

Gotta give it a thumbs down, sorry Hi-Rez.

I played Paladins at early Beta, took a break, then came back, then took a break, then came back. Over time, what was once a really great concept - and contender to Overwatch - became something different. It used to be I could just play casual here and there, play through some competitive if I was in the mood, and generally have a good time playing the way I wanted to play. I make it up through one of the early generations of the comp rankings and was pleased with pretty much everything about the game. Money was really only needed for cosmetics, having only to grind to unlock other characters. 
Game modes changed, and I didn't love every change. They got rid of my favorite game mode, but I could play different modes. Overall, not great changes, but not awful, either.

Regarding cosmetics... back when, if you spent real coin, you could buy exactly what you wanted from the shop, and it was great. Eventually, the cosmetic unlocks turned into loot boxes, and... yuck. All cosmetic, so thankfully not pay to win, but a step backwards, IMO. Then, the unlocks were further blocked by moving to this season pass setup, which now locked you out if you were only casual and/or didn't have or want to sink the time into earning it. As soon as this happens (other games as well, e.g. Warframe), then the game becomes a chore, and I'm done.

If you are one who can play without worrying about the cosmetics, then I really do recommend this game. As a new player, I feel like it could still be enjoyable. Coming from what the game was before... meh.

Lots of characters to choose from, but you don't own all of them and have to pay to get them
Weekly Rotations - Their are 4 characters everyone gets to try out

Each Champion Has 3 Talents to Choose From, Which can Completely Change The Champion

Cons:
They Give Skins to a Lot of The Same Characters. For Example: Ying, Viktor, and Maeve

Every 2nd match the game crashes without notice, until the application finally closes or puts you to a constant reconnect attempt screen that, most of the time, keeps failing until you force shut down the game and restart it。Meanwhile, it's already too late to get much fun out of the current match, because the stupid bot system auto-bought useless items already and runs into suicide by itself, being completely useless。The worst part about it is, it counts to "your" performance and stats。I might as well mention the wall glitches and getting idiotically stuck or rubberbanding on map structure, but those are there from the beginning… unlike the connectivity issues that appeared since late 2019。Will it ever change? Smite got those exact same connectivity issues as well, around the same time。What happened to Hi-Rez? They make a simple concept for a game graphically so pretty, but the fun ends here。I hope for the best。I don't talk to new friends about this game anymore, since I don't want them to get frustrated on those issues as well。I keep trying to play this game… I keep hoping… but I end up being annoyed again, longing for fluent entertainment, which I get by playing other games in the end, that function appropriately at least。So, no, I do not recommend this game anymore, until it gets fixed。
